address: Union Lofts, Grand Union Canal, Maida Vale W9
detailedDescription:
Garrison Estates are excited to launch a remarkable collection of 20 unique warehouse style apartments set along the banks of the Grand Union Canal in the heart of Maida Vale.

Union Lofts is positioned in the heart of West London. Maida Vale, Hyde Park, Notting Hill, Regent’s Park, Paddington and a number of other popular locations are well within 30 minutes walk. The Grand Union Canal is bursting with bustling locks, peaceful walks, areas of living history and wildlife. Alive with colourful houseboats, walkers, cycle trails, anglers and day trippers. As well as the impressive main canal, many smaller branches make great diversions if you have time to explore.
Maida Vale is a tranquil suburban district in Zone 2 just outside central London. An affluent, safe residential district well known for its peaceful and picturesque setting of wide tree lined streets, large communal gardens, beautiful Edwardian architecture and the infamous Little Venice canal on your doorstop makes this a highly sought after and desirable location.

Close by are London’s favourite Royal Parks & the city’s leading cultural experiences. Just an easy walk or ride from Union Lofts, London’s famous Royal Parks provide beauty & inspiration throughout all four seasons of the year.

Offering close proximity to Central London with excellent transport links in the vicinity, numerous restaurants, coffee shops and markets close by, it offers the perfect location for those who want to be close enough to Central London but away from the hustle and bustle.
The details


20 Brand new smart & contemporary apartments with canal views.
South facing, with the majority of the apartments enjoying either a private balcony and or terraces.
High specification appliances and finishes as well as bespoke built-in wardrobes to all bedrooms.
Central and conveniently located, offering easy access to transport links, landmarks and popular locations.
Ideal for those want to be close to the hustle and bustle of the city but also for those who enjoy an outdoors lifestyle.

*3D Virtual Viewing Available ** | Two Genuine Double Bedrooms | Two Shower Rooms | Duplex | Balcony | Fitted Eat-In kitchen | Long Leasehold | Realistic Service Charge | 808 Sq Ft | Superbly Located | Less Than £900 Per Sq Ft!

Priced at less than £900 per sq ft is this well-proportioned two-bedroom duplex apartment with a fantastic separate eat-in kitchen/breakfast room and balcony off the reception room. The apartment benefits from two good-sized garden-facing double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes and two shower rooms.

The bright refitted kitchen-breakfast room features integrated appliances and tiled flooring. Both shower rooms have been refitted with modern suites. The ground floor reception room and hallway feature wooden flooring.

The apartment is offered for sale in excellent condition and would make a perfect London home or investment property, such is the superb rental demand for quality homes such as this.

The apartment also benefits from an extended lease and no ground rent, along with a very reasonable service charge of just £1,400 per annum.

Brunswick Court features extensive communal grounds.

Location is everything and Brunswick Court is superbly located. Regency Street runs between Horseferry Road and Vauxhall Bridge Road. The closest tube is Pimlico, just a few minutes away, giving easy access to Green Park, Oxford Circus and Beyond.

There are a number of local parks for your enjoyment including the redesigned Christchurch Gardens, the historic St John’s Gardens and equally historic, Victoria Gardens, adjacent to the Palace of Westminster. Slightly further afield but still within an easy walk is St James Park, the beautiful 57 acre Royal Park with Buckingham Palace to one boundary & Horseguards Parade to another.

The amazing location also provides endless opportunities for shopping and eating, with Pimlico Village a few minutes walk away in one direction, and Strutton Ground and Victoria Street a few minutes walk in the other – with a diverse range of foods from the Strutton Ground street market to The Ivy in Victoria Street and many other Michelin Star restaurants.

Whilst walking down Strutton ground toward St James’s Park why not stop off for a drink at The Grafton, a public house notable as the location where Peter Sellers, Spike Milligan, Harry Secombe and Michael Bentine created The Goons.

This long-lease apartment is available for a chain-free sale. Please contact us to arrange your private viewing.

Leasehold: Approx 148 remaining
Service Charge: £1,400 per annum
Ground Rent: £Nil<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
**3D virtual viewing tour** 4 Beds | 3 Baths | Period Terrace House | 1830 SqFt | Freehold | Beautifully Presented Throughout | Open Plan Kitchen Dining Room | Private Roof Terrace | Double Bedrooms | Built In Storage Through Out | Utility Room | Separate WC | Walking Distance of Victoria & Pimlico Stations

A truly stunning example of a four double bedroom terraced house, nestled on the highly sought-after Denbigh Street, Pimlico. This ideal family home has been finished to the highest of standards by the current owners, who have re modelled the property to maximise the use-able space throughout.

The ground floor of the property provides access to the open plan kitchen dining room. This has been finished with high quality kitchen appliances with an Aga styled cooker, double Belfast sinks and custom fitted units. It also benefits from having beautiful high ceilings that still is finished with original period features. The ground level also offers a well-proportioned study that could be used as a home gym.

A bespoke Oakwood Engineered Flooring has been crafted to flow through all of the living spaces and bedrooms across entirety of the property.

The fourth bedroom on the first floor, is ideal as a guest bedroom with its own en suite shower room. A welcoming living room with high ceilings and pair of double doors leads out onto to a full width balcony with views of Thomas Cubitt Statue. To the rear of the property finds a separate WC and the private roof terrace with views of the surrounding chimney pots.

Two double bedrooms can be found on the second floor, these have been re modelled to create a larger space for a shared family bathroom. Both bedrooms benefit from built in storage and you will find the utility room on this level.

Finally on the third floor is where the principal suite is situated, with a large double bedroom, walk-through dressing room into private en suite with a standalone bath and walk in shower.

Denbigh Street is a highly prestigious tree lined residential street in the heart of Pimlico. The public gardens of St. George's Square are only moments away, as is Pimlico tube station (Victoria line). Victoria station provides further superb transport links (Gatwick Express, National Rail Services, District, Circle and Victoria lines) as well as an abundance of shops, bars and restaurants.

Tensure: Freehold<br /><br />

Description

Prince's Mansions
One bed/one bathroom flat
Second Floor 465sq.ft.
Roof Terrace, Porter, Lift
995 Year Leasehold
Situated a stone-thrown away from Hyde Park, Prince's Mansions promises its residents a lifestyle as lively or relaxed as they choose to make it.

This fashionable part of London is renowned for its eclectic blend of stylish stores, restaurants, bars and entertainment. Prince's Square is a classic mid-19th century white stucco front Victorian building. It has several historical features like the entrance porch, the rusticated quoins and original cornicing which is listed with the English Heritage Collection. The building has a dominant design and presence on the prestigious Prince's Square and is part of London's historical heritage in a prime neighbourhood.
Prince's Square is in close proximity to the Embassies of China, Russia, Liberia and Morocco providing an extra level of public security and overall safety to the area.
Current famous residents of the area are Roman Abramovich, Lakshmi Mittal, Sultan of Brunei, and he Saudi Royal Family. Other famous people like Winston Churchill, Princess Diana, Madonna and the Beatles have also been residents in this neighbourhood.

Street parking (permits may apply)

address: Warwick Place, Little Venice, London W9
detailedDescription:
A truly unique, detached industrial low built villa, which is secluded by walled gardens all around the property

Location

Warwick Place is situated within easy access of all the shops and cafes of Little Venice whilst only moments from Regent's Canal and Warwick Avenue Underground Station (Bakerloo Line providing easy access to Paddington main line station and Heathrow Express.

Description

A truly unique, detached industrial low built villa, which is secluded by walled gardens all around the property.

The property is a perfect mix of industrial modern and period features and has been completely newly built and interior designed to one of the highest standards we have ever seen in the area.

Designed by Wells Mackereth this modernist home can only be described as a masterpiece of architecture. This creatively built home is a fine example of top craftsmanship with spatial drama. The sunken kitchen was built to resembles Frank Sinatra's house in Palm Springs. In the old coach house, the bedroom features wood paneling reclaimed from The Partridge Fine Art workshop that once existed on the premises. Further features include a hydraulic door which opens onto the garden from the vaulted reception area.

The property when acquired by the vendor consisted of a coach house at the front where the bedroom is now and was the old workshop of Partridge Fine Art of Bond Street. A sense of the industrial heritage has been retained on a site which was rooted as place where things were made. There are many industrial features such as winches and winding gear adding to the history of this remarkable property. A wall of black engineering brick now divides the old part of the house form the new. The decadent library/cinema room in the basement has Charlotte Perriand inspired capped in bronze and a conversation pit finished in Chestnut leather.

Further benefits include three sets of double French doors leading to a courtyard garden and a roof terrace.

The property has a large secure garage giving direct access into the property. There are two further parking spaces outside the property.

The property was also featured in the below awards:

• Winner of The Daily Telegraph British Homes Awards 2011 Interior Design Category
• Finalist in the New London Awards 2011
• Finalist in the World Architecture News Interior Design Awards 2011

Square Footage: 3606 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A wonderful, beautifully presented Queen Anne house located next to St James's Park.

Location

Queen Anne's Gate is located parallel with Bird Cage Walk and St James's Park, close to the internationally renowned and iconic landmarks such as the Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey, and Buckingham Palace. A location steeped in history, it is widely regarded for its exquisitely preserved examples of 18th century architecture. It is tranquil and attractive, blending history with the modern world, and combining a sense of rus in urbe. A hidden gem, this pocket of Westminster located close to Buckingham Palace and St James's Park, Westminster Abbey and the Houses of Parliament, it is a beautiful and quiet residential part of central London.

Westminster and the area surrounding Victoria have seen significant regeneration and development in recent years. The vast expansion and improvement of retail, office and residential properties have seen the area much improved, re-joining the traditional trophy enclaves that are recognised as "prime central London". A destination and "lifestyle hub" boasting Michelin star restaurants from Michel Roux Jnr, Tom Kerridge and Andrew Wong; fashion houses from Mulberry and Tom Ford; a Curzon Cinema; Andrew Lloyd Webber's Other Palace theatre and studio; St John's Concert Hall in Smith Square; the Tate Britain Art Gallery, and all in addition to the offerings in St James's, Mayfair, Belgravia and Knightsbridge. Local transport connections are excellent and include St James's Park and Westminster underground stations providing District, Circle Line and Jubilee Line access. Victoria Station provides underground and mainline rail services with national network connections including the Gatwick Express.

Description

7 Queen Anne's Gate is located within a group of 5 terraced houses built in c. 1770-71 by Thomas Clarke (brick layer) and Emmanuel Crouch (architect). It comprises a traditional brick built mid-terraced house having four full storeys plus a basement, with three windows in width, under a Welsh slate tiled triple pitched roof with lead valleys. The main entrance to the house is approached by a short flight of steps, with a recessed panelled door.

Part of an exceptional group of late 18th century and Queen Anne houses, this fine and elegant property is Grade I listed. It has been beautifully renovated creating a classic but contemporary family house in a prime central London location. This part of the street was originally named Park Street and separated by a wall from the western part called Queen Square. Originally forming part of the Christ's Hospital Estate, the previous freeholders of the terrace, it is regarded as one of the best preserved areas of 18th century domestic architecture in London. Meticulously restored and reinstated as a family home in the late 1990's, and recently redecorated, this property is beautifully presented. It provides many significant historical architectural features. There are fine fireplaces in the principal entertaining rooms, an absolutely charming south-facing garden terrace which has been recently refurbished - a rarity in central London. There is extensive lower ground floor accommodation, including a bright "media and office" space with skylights providing abundant natural light. There is also a studio flat with a separate entrance to the front of the house, which could also be used as a "home gym". The property further benefits from a large central skylight which provides the main stairwell with natural light.

Square Footage: 4267 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A circa 2,632sqft five storey freehold family home with integrated garage and roof terrace is presented to the market in Pimlico, SW1.

With potentially six bedrooms if required this substantial home is both well designed and versatile. On the ground floor there is a large open plan style kitchen flowing through to a dining area and family sitting room. The more formal drawing room is on the first floor as is a study / fifth bedroom as well as a south westerly facing roof terrace and bathroom. All principle rooms are equipped with air conditioning including the master bedroom suite on the second floor. There are two further bedrooms and a family bathroom on the top floor. In the basement there is a built in garage, accessed from turpentine lane, another bedroom suite as well as utility room.

Located in the middle of the Westmoreland Triangle and benefitting from an open view up Clarendon Street towards Westminster this would make an excellent central London full time family home, substantial pied-a-terre or long term investment.

Being approximately 0.6 miles from Victoria mainline station including underground and Gatwick Express services, 0.8 miles from Sloane Square and the famous Kings Road and only 0.5 miles from the 200 acres that Battersea Park has to offer, this property is well positioned for local transport and shopping.

detailedDescription:
Full of charm and character this well presented Grade II listed four bedroom apartment located in the prestigious address of Hyde Park Gardens. This approx. 3000 sq. Ft lateral apartment benefits from wonderful south facing green views overlooking Hyde Park and access to the award-winning communal gardens.

The apartment benefits from high ceilings throughout with a wonderful abundance of natural light. A double fronted reception room has far reaching views over Hyde Park and the private roof terrace is the perfect spot for a glass of wine in the evenings. This wonderful apartment also benefits from separate studio apartment/office space.

Hyde Park Gardens is a monumental terrace of grand, stucco-faced town houses dating back to 1836, designed by architect John Crake. Their principal front is to the south, facing landscaped gardens and overlooking Hyde Park. The terrace has been designated a Grade II listed building by English heritage and lies within the Bayswater conservation area.

On the first floor you have a sublime double reception room and study with stunning floor to ceiling sash windows flooding the rooms with an incredible amount of natural daylight, and another endearing bedroom.

The second floor is designated to the principle suite with a superb bedroom, a separate bathroom, additional walk in wardrobe and a stunning roof terrace.

First time on the market for over 50 years, this delightful four/five bedroom Freehold Mews house measuring approximately (2433 Sq Ft/226 sq m), located in this sought after and quiet cobbled mews.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
As you enter this well-proportioned first floor lateral apartment the generous floor-space is immediately evident. Consisting of over 1500 square feet (140 square metres), it is well above the average size of most apartments in this prestigious development.

The reception room measures 23 feet by 20 feet (over 7m x by 6m) and has west-facing windows and a covered balcony. This room provides ample seating space as well as a dining area conveniently close to the kitchen which has recently been refurbished and fully fitted. A second balcony from the far end of the kitchen faces east so is ideal for an al fresco breakfast and morning coffee.

The master bedroom measures 18 feet by nearly 14 feet (nearly 6m by over 4m) and has a fully equipped bathroom en suite comprising a full-size bath and separate shower cubicle. Two further double bedrooms have large east-facing windows and fitted wardrobes. One also has an ensuite shower room, with a third family shower room/WC leading from the hallway.

Step Outside

Close to the junction of Ebury Street and Lower Belgrave Street, this development is only 250 metres from the Victoria coach and mainline train stations, including District & Circle and Victoria underground lines. Gatwick and Heathrow airports are therefore 30 minutes and 45 minutes travel time away respectively. Travel to the City, Canary Wharf and the West End is even less.

Belgravia enjoys a prestigious “village” atmosphere with high quality restaurants, bars, cafes, traditional London pubs, supermarkets and individual shops all within easy walking distance.

Elizabeth Street

- Thomas Cubitt a gastro pub with excellent food and a great atmosphere.

- Peggy Porschen the world's most famous cupcakes, served with a choice of tea and coffee

- Philip Tracey where to buy the most fashionable and unique hat for Royal Ascot

Ebury Street

- Santini, 29 Ebury Street Classic Italian food with Venetian specials offering the al fresco' option

- pataka, 52 Buckingham Palace Road - authentic Indian cuisine with a super twist

- Le Poule au Pot, 231 Ebury Street exquisite French restaurant, with genuine Parisian charm”

Orange Square & Pimlico Road

- The Orange very presentable, recently refurbished pub and restaurant, offering wild boar soup with chorizo followed by wood-oven pizza

- Daylesford Organics - Chic, all-day cafe-deli with marble-topped tables, for seasonal organic plates and salads.

- Fine Art shops, galleries and antique furniture stores for a fascinating browse around on a drizzly afternoon

Seller's Insight


“What we immediately liked about No 28 was the extra space, especially in the living areas and the master bedroom. Having two covered terraces one east facing, the other facing west was also a joy. Fresh air at any time and sunshine mornings and evenings whenever the weather was kind. Having the kitchen within the open-plan reception room was very sociable when entertaining the family and friends.

Having bedrooms and bathrooms distanced from the living areas was a blessing whenever our guests arrived early, perhaps after we had had a late night!

We realised after moving-in that being on the first floor was so much more convenient than always having to wait for the lift. Keeping the car under the building was very helpful and perfect on a rainy day, coming back from the supermarket with children as well as groceries to man-handle.

We were an easy walk to cafes, bars and outstanding places to eat, and only a short cab ride to theatreland, museums and shopping either in Knightsbridge or Oxford Street. Nearby trains and coaches were always another option.

The building is so well-run by Syed and his team on the front desk nothing is ever too much trouble. We rarely had to lift a finger when parcels or other deliveries arrived”.

address: The View, 20 Palace Street, Westminster, London SW1E
detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented two bedroom apartment with stunning views from the sixth floor of a highly desirable Westminster development with 24/7 concierge

Location

The View is a landmark Westminster development converted by Land Securities in 2004. Located to the south of St James's Park and to the east of Victoria, the property is within reach of the amenities, restaurants and shops of Victoria, St James, Mayfair and Westminster and will benefit significantly from the newly completed Restaurant Quarter at Nova.

Convenience has been enhanced by recent improvements to Cardinal Place, including the opening of a new entrance to the Victoria Underground Station.

Transport connections include underground services from Victoria and nearby St James's Park, as well as mainline national rail services from Victoria Station, including the Gatwick Express. Buckingham Place, Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey and Cathedral are iconic landmarks in this most historic are of London.

Victoria mainline and underground station: Approximately 0.3 miles.
St. James's Park underground station: Approximately 0.3 miles

Description

A well-proportioned two bedroom apartment situated on the sixth floor of this centrally located and convenient apartment block near Victoria.

Accommodation comprises two bedrooms, two bathrooms; reception room with a wonderful balcony, and a separate kitchen.

Being positioned on the sixth floor, the apartment has breath taking views of some of London's iconic landmarks, The London Eye and the BT Tower to name a few.

The building benefits a helpful and renowned 24 hour concierge team and passenger lifts to all floors.

Square Footage: 981 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 981 years remaining

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This imposing family house stands midway along the east side of Eaton Terrace with an outlook directly down Graham Terrace to the west.

Location

Eaton Terrace is a classic Belgravia townhouse address with a wide range of local amenities available on Elizabeth Street just 0.1 miles away. Sloane Square and the world renowned Kings Road are also close by with their shops, restaurants, bars and cinemas.

In addition Sloane Square tube station (0.2 miles) and Victoria Station (0.5 miles) are both easily accessible to the property.

Description

Having lent itself as a comfortable and substantial family home for many years, the house comprises around 4,400 sq ft and is built of red brick with an impressive front door porchway and a pretty garden at the rear. Situated over 6 floors, the house has ample bedroom accommodation in the top 3 floors and a fantastic first floor kitchen and dining room with views down Graham Terrace enjoying the afternoon and evening sunlight. The ground floor comprises the formal reception space and on the lower ground there is staff accommodation and a sizeable office.

Square Footage: 4405 sq ft

address: The Watch House Berwick Street, Soho W1F
detailedDescription:
Greater London Properties are delighted to present to you The Watch House – a brand new boutique scheme of 11 apartments and 1 penthouse in the heart of fashionable Soho. Curated by architects, interior designers and developer, The Watch House offers luxurious living in the geographic, creative and cultural centre of London.

Each apartment has been designed to a very high specification combining stylish interiors with exquisite materials. A palette of hardwood engineered timber flooring, bespoke kitchens and porcelain tiled bathrooms exude a sense of depth and distinct quality to each apartment. Door fittings, light switches and sockets are by Buster and Punch and tiles and kitchen surfaces by Domus. All apartments benefit from air conditioning to living spaces and master bedrooms and underfloor heating throughout.

This impressive two bedroom flat features a stunning double aspect open plan living room with stylish brick feature walls, wooden flooring, excellent high ceilings, and large windows which bathe the entire apartment in natural light. The beautiful bespoke kitchen comprises Domus honed, composite stone kitchen surface, fitted wall units, and all mod cons. The master bedroom opens to a wonderful private balcony and features an en-suite bathroom with tub and built-in wardrobes. There is also a second bedroom with plenty of built-in cupboards. The bathroom boasts cp Hart Catalano Verso wash basins, clear silver Artisan mirrors, built-in vanity units, Domus porcelain floor tiles, gold metal feature wall tiles and porcelain wall tiles, a shower and a toilet. The property further benefits from an abundance of built-in wardrobes and bike storage.

The Watch House is located on Berwick Street, in the very centre of Soho. The theatres of West End, the shops of Mayfair, and the restaurants of Soho and Fitzrovia all lie within a short stroll. The development offers easy access to the City of London, airports and to many of the world's best universities. It is a short walk from Carnaby Street and Oxford Street and is very well connected in terms of buses and tubes. The nearest Underground stations are Piccadilly Circus (Bakerloo and Piccadilly lines), Leicester Square (Northern and Piccadilly lines), Oxford Circus (Central, Victoria and Bakerloo lines) and Tottenham Court Road (Central and Northern lines, Crossrail).

Notice
Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

address: Gloucester Square, Hyde Park, London W2
detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to acquire a south facing 2815 sqft 1st floor (with lift) lateral apartment arranged across 3 buildings on the prestigious Gloucester Square.

This one of a kind property offers incredible volume with its 4.5m ceilings (14.8ft) and includes 9 south facing floor to ceiling French doors all of which open up onto the terrace which stretches the length of the property and from which there are views of the private gardens located at the centre of Gloucester Square.

Furthermore, the property has been elegantly decorated and furnished and includes porterage, a 600 sqft reception room, a large dine-in style kitchen which opens up onto the terrace and outside sitting area, master bedroom with ensuite bathroom and dressing room, 2nd double bedroom with ensuite shower room, study/3rd bedroom with guest WC, study/4th bedroom, utility room and storeroom.

Gloucester Square is highly desirable address where residents have access to one of the best private gardens in London. It is just north of the green open spaces of Hyde Park and close to Paddington Station, Marble Arch Underground Station, The A40 Westway and the boutique shops, cafes, restaurants and pubs of Connaught Village.

Share of Freehold with a 984 Year Lease.

A spacious apartment in an imposing Georgian fronted terrace conveniently located near The London Business School, Baker Street tube and Regents Park.

This immaculate studio apartment located on the second floor of this imposing period building is finished to the highest standard. The bathroom is also elegantly fitted out with quality luxury fitments.
Minutes from the tube at Baker Street, this location provides easy access to Hammersmith and City, Bakerloo, Metropolitan and Jubilee lines, as well as Marylebone train station. The open green spaces of Regents Park are just a short walk away.

This apartment would make an ideal rental investment due to its proximity to The London Business School.

address: Clive Court, Maida Vale, London W9
detailedDescription:
One of a kind property, refurbished to the highest standards and offering incredible lateral space.

Location

Maida Vale is a stunning location in west London, offering period conversions and red-brick mansion flats some of which include well-manicured communal gardens. Paddington Recreational Ground offers open green space for the avid jogger and dog walker, as well as an athletics track, gym and 3D artificial pitch. In addition, there are a number of tennis clubs in the immediate area. Bbc Maida Vale Studios is conveniently located on a quiet residential street and hosts a number of live performances.
The local area has excellent transport links from Maida Vale Station (Bakerloo Line) and great bus links into central London.
Maida Vale benefits from a wide selection of local amenities such as cafes, bars, restaurants and florists accessible via Elgin Avenue and Lauderdale Parade.

Description

A stunning four bedroom lateral apartment in a popular mansion block. The apartment has been meticulously refurbished to create a spacious and comfortable home, with top of the range specification and double glazing throughout. The open plan reception and dining area is bright and offers access to a balcony. Featuring four spacious bedrooms, with a principal that has access to the balcony and four bathrooms, this large apartment also has a separate kitchen with integrated appliances and underfloor heating. Clive Court benefits from a 24h porter, a lift and gated private parking, and is perfectly located next to Clifton Gardens where a selection of boutique shops, cafes and restaurants is on offer.

Square Footage: 2057 sq ft

address: Jacob`S Well Mews, Marylebone, London W1U
detailedDescription:
A modern town house on a quiet mews just behind Marylebone High Street. The property comprises of a master bedroom with en-suite shower room, three further double bedrooms and family bathroom, kitchen with separate washing machine and tumble dryer, reception room, study and guest w/c. The property also benefits from a large private garage which is also ideal to be used as further storage space. The property also has a generous sized balcony accessible via the third floor.

Located in the heart of Marylebone, now considered to be one of the Golden postcodes with its central location surrounded by many beautiful restaurants and boutiques on Marylebone High Street.

Marylebone still looks and feels something like the village it was 400 years ago and the handsome Georgian development it was 250 years ago. Its High Street in particular is a pleasure to visit; the atmosphere is a bit more cosmopolitan than other parts of the city, and at the same time, a little more relaxed. A pristine haven a short walk from Oxford Circus filled with squares of tall, beautifully proportioned Georgian houses.

detailedDescription:
Hollandgreen Place is an award winning development completed in 2016 on the site of the former Commonwealth Institute and found on the southern boarder of Holland Park itself. Residents are looked after by a 24 hour concierge team and also have use of a number of private facilities including a 20m swimming poor with double height ceilings and natural light, a sauna, steam room, gym, spa treatment room, cinema, golf simulator, business suite and children's playroom.

Located on the fifth floor, this apartment offers open plan living, with generous reception, dining, and kitchen space. The kitchen has been designed to a high standard and is complete with an island. Through the reception room there is a large private roof terrace.

In the principle bedroom suite there is a separate sitting room and dressing room. The bathroom features a bath, shower and double sink. There are two further well sized bedrooms, both complete with en suite bathroom and fitted wardrobes.

Throughout the entire apartment there are floor to ceiling windows, allowing natural light to burst through.

Kensington High Street is close by with its huge variety of amenities including Michelin starred restaurants, renowned supermarkets, excellent transportation links (the District & Circle lines at High Street Kensington Underground Station), well-regarded preparatory schools as well as the open spaces of Holland Park, Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An elegant Grade II listed Georgian townhouse providing approximately 3,760 sq. Ft. Of exceptionally bright family and entertaining accommodation, a few minutes’ walk from the West End. This exceptionally well maintained traditional Georgian townhouse enjoys a prime position on the preferred West side of prestigious Connaught Square with commanding views over the beautifully kept residents’ garden, which offers a wide expanse of lawn, a variety of planting, magnificent trees and a children’s playground, all for the exclusive use of the Square’s residents. The property offers a perfect blend of traditional style and modern living featuring stunning original period features throughout and an integrated surround sound system. The property has been the current owners home for over 20 years and would suit a family looking for a fine home with a village feel in Prime Central London.

Situated on the leafy Hyde Park Estate, Connaught Square is just north of Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens, two of the world’s great city parks. The numerous boutique shops, restaurants and other leisure amenities of Connaught Village are in the immediate vicinity of the property. Oxford Street, Marylebone and The Portman Estate are also nearby with Mayfair and Knightsbridge a pleasant walk away across Hyde Park.

The transport links on offer are outstanding. The Central Line at Marble Arch and the Circle, District, Bakerloo and Hammersmith & City Lines at Edgware Road are within a few minutes’ walk, providing convenient access to all parts of Central London and beyond. The Elizabeth Line/Crossrail (opening soon) at Paddington and Bond Street stations and the Heathrow Express at Paddington are also within easy walking distance.

Connaught House and Wetherby, two of the best junior schools in London, are located on the corner of Connaught Square and on nearby Bryanston Square respectively.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Property Reference PR1001

Paddington is not only famous for its fictional Bear, it's also famous for being a wonderful area, full of beautiful tree lined streets and beautiful canal walks with fantastic architecture and facilities. On a sunny day it's like living in a real-life oil painting by one of the grand masters.

This striking Grade 2 listed corner property, which is located on the corner of Southwick Street and Star Street, offers a wealth of local shops and restaurants nearby. It is also within close proximity to Connaught Village, the vast green open spaces of Hyde Park, Marylebone and the excellent transport links from Paddington station, which has an express service to Heathrow Airport in 15 minutes.

With in excess of 3,000 sq ft this superb property could be transformed into an enviable home for a potential buyer, whilst also offering many options as a multiple use investment opportunity.

It's current configuration is of three separate units:

A recently refurbished two bedroom lower ground floor apartment.

A ground floor former retail unit, previously house a Coffee Shop, Dental Surgery and prior to this was the office and a London headquarters for Bob Geldof's Live Aid operation.

The upper floors offer a four-bedroom maisonette with a private terrace.

“I never intended on moving here, I bought the house because I was looking for a property for my daughter to open a coffee shop and have her own independent flat, I never intended on moving, I was settled in my own home but I saw the building and literally fell in love with the corner aspect, the huge windows, the light this gave and the exceptionally high ceilings. What sealed the deal was the original rosette and cornices on the lounge ceiling and the original Georgian shutters sealed in the huge lounge windows. I wondered how many stories those walls could tell.” Says the current owner of why they originally bought the property.

Looking at the exterior you can tell the potential of this building, it has real presence.

Inside is just as impressive, and then some! The upper maisonette boasts high ceilings which are impressive, upon entering the building oozes the grandeur of its era, you know you are entering a piece of history, but one not just trapped in the past, there are fantastic elements of modernity here, seamlessly fitting in with the whole ambience and feel.

This upper section has three bedrooms, the master bedroom is generously proportioned, offering views of tree lined roads in this picture postcard location. It is high-ceilinged, light and airy and offers a walk in wardrobe for added chic and luxury, talking of which, the en suite bathroom is one of the largest we have ever seen, with a Jacuzzi, bidet, a two-person steam room, a shower and two hand basins as well as a toilet.

Being a corner property, it has many forward-facing windows, in this case to the south east facing, which let the light flood in! All have shutters to give you control of how bright the sunshine is!

The original fireplaces and features make you understand why this building has it's protected status, this is a work of art you can live in and cherish.

You can tell this has been a cherished family home, it is just waiting for a new occupier who would benefit from cash flow from the commercial unit and lower flat or some savvy home buyer who is willing to take on some work and very easily convert the building into a single dwelling.

The ground floor, formally retail unit is currently a large living room/diner, the kitchen is by the renowned designer Mark Wilkinson and features a fabulous mobile island and cleverly incorporates storage under the kitchen seats.

The two bedroom lower ground floor apartment has been recently renovated and follows the exemplary examples set by the other parts of the house.

Of the house and surrounding area, the current owner adds:” The combination of high ceilings and the many windows enhances the feeling of space when you look out. The area is also remarkably quiet.

You are two minutes from Paddington Station offering easy access to mainline trains, London Overground and nearby access to the: Bakerloo, District, Hammersmith and City and Circle tube lines. These transport links will soon be enhanced by the new Cross rail line, all in all providing direct transport to all corners of London and beyond.

We are within easy walking distance of Hyde Park, Kensington Park and Connaught Village to one side and Notting Hill and all its exclusive shops and street markets on the other.

On our immediate doorstep we have: The Frontline club/restaurant - the world-famous award-winning restaurant is less than a minute's walk away. Maroush and all the great Middle Eastern restaurants on the Edgware Road less than five minutes walk away

Plus, there are two rather handy (for me) Hilton Hotels nearby, which I like visiting for two reasons; one has a Casino the other a fabulous swimming pool.

I love it here, the only reason I am moving is because, at my time of life, 68, I would like to be living nearer my only daughter, my granddaughters and son-in-law.”

So, if you are looking for an amazing house boasting both amazing original features matched seamlessly with the addition of contemporary brilliance, with the option of two houses and a commercial dwelling, in a quiet, yet still in the centre of everything London can offer at its best location, we recommend an early viewing. Remember the current owners weren't even looking for a home for themselves when they viewed it, but somehow the house just caught them in its spell, we foresee this easily happening again!

Local Authority: City of Westminster

address: Sloane Court East, Chelsea, London SW3
detailedDescription:
A period six bedroom town house in a premier location, moments away from Sloane Square and Burton Court. This beautiful house is newly refurbished and has remarkably high ceilings and large windows offering a light and airy feel. The house provides direct access to the communal gardens to the rear and benefits from a roof terrace. The house is approximately 4389sqft (408sqm).

The principal rooms are generous in proportion and wonderfully light with good natural volume. With a southerly aspect, there are stunning views from the rear of the house towards the Royal Hospital Gardens and from the kitchen/breakfast room there is direct access to private communal gardens.

The house is well designed around a central staircase and offers generous reception space including casual and more formal areas as well as a flexible layout offering five or six bedrooms.

This is an excellent family home in the heart of Chelsea.

Sloane Court East is located in close proximity to Sloane Square and the Kings Road. Both of which offer many restaurants, shops and boutiques as well as excellent transport links. In particular the Sloane Square underground station provides access to both the District and Circle Lines.

In addition, the house is near to the many leading Private Schools- including Garden House, Sussex House, Hill House, Francis Holland and the Knightsbridge School.

In addition residents can apply for membership through the Royal Hospital for an annual pass to Burton Court. This includes access to tennis, personal tennis coaching (additional charges apply), children's tennis academy (additional charges apply), general walking, dog walking and access to cricket nets.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This charming two-bedroom flat with its own private south-facing garden is positioned on Sutherland Avenue, a quiet, tree-lined street in Maida Vale.

The Tour

Access is gained via its own private entrance at the lower ground level. The apartment unfolds in an exploration of expansive spaces with beautiful oak wood flooring. There is a sense of contemporary sophistication throughout, aided in part by the cohesive flow of interior spaces, which come together in an exacting mix of light, materials, colour and detail. (creatively designed by Susan Callery).

The spacious principal bedroom has character and retains ornate decorative cornices. It adjoins the bathroom and can be accessed by beautiful stained glass french doors. The bathroom makes a statement with its blue and white tiles, a walk-in shower and a freestanding bathtub. From the hallway, you are greeted with an expansive reception room with a beautiful fireplace. The galley kitchen is illuminated by sunlight and has leafy views. Of the garden.

The second bedroom is configured as an office/guest room featuring two clever murphy beds; it has views of the garden, as well as built-in storage spaces.

Outdoor space

The South-facing garden is made to entertain guests which holds a deluxe summerhouse garden pod - it certainly has the wow factor. There is also a summerhouse that can be used as a studio.

The Area

Sutherland Avenue is perfectly located close to Little Venice, Maida Vale; a thriving neighbourhood awash with cafes, bars and restaurants, as well as an Everyman cinema.

Regent’s Canal is a just short stroll away, a gateway to the rest of London and a lovely spot for a coffee at the Waterside Cafe, lunch on one of the many barge restaurants, such as Darcie & May Green, dinner at Summer House or an alfresco drink at Pergola Paddington. The green spaces of the Rembrandt Gardens is a short walk away. Warwick Avenue and Maida Vale (Both Bakerloo lines) are within a short 7-minute walk.

We are proud to present this exceptional 3-bedroom apartment which has recently undergone a high specification renovation with meticulous attention to detail throughout. Chalfont Court is located a stone throw away from one of London's most popular Royal Parks, Regent's Park. This period block benefits from a day porter and lift access to all floors.

Situated on the first floor of this traditional red brick building, you are welcomed with high ceilings (Circa 3m) and wooden flooring upon entrance of the apartment, to the left of the front door is a storage cupboard which doubles up as a Coat Room.

This spacious property further boasts three double bedrooms which all overlook Baker Street and feature built-in storage, newly fitted carpet and double-glazed windows, a large Northeast facing double reception room with an adjoined fully fitted kitchen allowing plenty of room for dining and entertaining. The main bathroom has been completely reconfigured offering generous amounts of space and the benefit of underfloor heating and the dual usage of a separate bath and shower, with a separate guest cloak room just next door. An amazing feature of this apartment is it's generous storage space throughout.

Located just moments away from the open green space of Regent's Park, Chalfont Court is in close proximity to Marylebone Village and Baker Street; where you have access to a variety of shops, restaurants, hotels and cultural institutions.

The nearest transportation links are Baker Street tube station (Hammersmith & City, Bakerloo, Jubilee, Circle and Metropolitan, Zone 1), Regents Park tube station (Bakerloo line) and Marylebone underground and railway station (Bakerloo line & National Rail, Zone 1).

detailedDescription:
From the outside, yellow London stock brick trimmed with matt black woodwork strikes a contemporary tone that’s echoed throughout the interior. Inside, the ground floor entrance is a spacious reception room, where Crittall walls, exposed concrete, steelwork and multi-toned herringbone parquet floors are interwoven with impressive effect.

Sharing the ground floor is an adjoining garage, with its own set of timber double doors leading out onto the mews. Separated from the reception room by an integrated Crittall glass panel, it’s every classic car enthusiast’s dream and the most spectacular focal point for visiting guests. The garage floor features a unique design detail: A crevice in the concrete, paved over with glass, offering a glimpse into the kitchen the basement, the thoroughly modern open-plan kitchen and dining space has an industrial feel with exposed steel beams and a large raw concrete island flanked by floor lights. A reassuringly private space for entertaining, with a spacious pantry room to the side. Plus, a wine cellar beneath the floor.

On the first floor, two light-filled double-bedrooms, one with a set of doors onto a Juliet balcony. Both well equipped with storage and make for comfortable guest quarters or a home office, serviced by a shared shower room. On the top floor, the master suite. A light-filled room with design-led touches set this space apart: A large wooden platform bed, stained wood cabinetry and an immaculately finished en suite with freestanding boat bath.

Interior Crittall glazing creates a seamless connection with the light-filled stairwell. Here, a glass-tread staircase leads up to the large roof terrace, spanning the entire top floor of the house, with wide panoramic city views to greet you.

Located on an attractive, quiet cobbled mews, there’s no shortage of green space in close proximity to this beautiful home. Hyde Park is just 10 minutes away if a dip in the Serpentine Lido calls, or stroll to the Italian Gardens. The buzzing thoroughfare of Westbourne Grove is a 15-minute stretch, with Diptyque, Sandro and Modernity to browse in. For an evening of entertainment, make your way to the Royal Albert Hall, only 15 minutes away. Bayswater Tube Station is your closest [Circle and District Lines] and Paddington [Circle and Hammersmith & City Lines] only 10 minutes-walk away.<br /><br />

agency_name: Savills - St. John's Wood & Regents Park
address: Avenue Road, St John's Wood, London NW8
detailedDescription:
Unique and captivating villa located on one of London’s most prestigious roads.

Location

Avenue Road is one of London’s most prestigious addresses due to the calibre and size of the houses
and it’s close proximity to the West End and Central London. Recently dubbed the most expensive road in London, houses along here benefit from generous plot sizes and excellent garden provision which is often not achievable in Central London. 69 Avenue Road is in the best location on Avenue Road, facing South West (The Goldilocks Zone). The house is on one of the widest plots on the road with the largest frontage, carriage driveway and off street parking for more than 10 cars.

Located on the desirable East side of St John’s Wood the property is ideally situated for the local amenities of St John’s Wood High Street (approximately 0.6 miles walk), Primrose Hill (approximately 0.8 miles walk) and Regent’s Park (approximately 0.5 miles walk) where one
can find an abundance of shops, cafes, restaurants and green spaces. Mayfair is approximately 12 minutes’ drive (approximately 2.2 miles) from the property which is where one can find some of London’s finest shops and restaurants. There are many independent schools in the surrounding area that are easily accessed including The American School in London which is approximately 9 minutes’ walk (approximately 0.4 miles).

Description

First time on the market in 63 years, 69 Avenue Road presents an excellent opportunity to expand on the existing plot size (approximately 0.5 acre) through the creation of a lower ground floor and rear extension at ground level. The newly formed lower ground floor would house some exceptional facilities including a swimming pool, spa, sauna, games room and generously sized cinema room. The ground floor extension includes a new, substantial, and state of the art kitchen and dining area with a flat green roof which the master bedroom looks onto. This area will benefit from vast amounts of natural light along with garden views. The main body of the house is also extended to the rear, gaining extra square footage to the main living room and formal dining room. This extension also creates a new first floor terrace that serves bedrooms three and four. The proposed extensions will take the total gia up to approximately 18,036 square feet (approximately 1,676 square meters).

Square Footage: 9000 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Set within a stucco-fronted period property, this timeless three-bedroom apartment is a peaceful retreat from the vibrancy of Notting Hill on its doorstep. Enter on the first floor and ascend the stairs to the generous reception room on the second floor, where large sash windows bathe the room in natural light. Herringbone wood flooring and soft-pink walls, create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for lively conversations with friends over digestifs or simply siting back with a morning coffee. The south-facing, open-plan kitchen and dining area is meticulously finished; deep-hued fitted cabinetry, sleek, marble countertops and a multi-tonal backsplash. Cook up a storm and enjoy in the dining area as the sun goes down; the most inviting spot for evening dinners and family get-togethers. Sharing the floor, an inky blue shower room, clad in encaustic tiles. Upstairs, three spacious bedrooms. In the master, soft, tonal colours and reams of light create a restful space to immerse yourself in a good book and unwind for the evening. The en suite is steeped in the contemporary; light herringbone tiling, a mirror-framed bath and a scalloped backsplash. Along the corridor, find two further bedrooms. One – all duck-egg blues and lofty proportions – makes the perfect guestroom; a tranquil escape for visiting friends. Reimagine the other as a quiet home office, the ultimate location to tune out the world and focus.

A quiet, leafy enclave, Sunderland Terrace is within easy reach of the many amenities of Westbourne Grove and Ledbury Road, whilst retaining that all-important sense of peace and privacy. Browse the Serpentine Gallery before taking in the tranquil surroundings of Hyde Park over a picnic. Or, head to Farmacy, just an eight-minute walk away, for a rejuvenating brunch and superfood smoothie. address: Elgin Avenue, Maida Vale, London W9
detailedDescription:
The allure of this three-bedroom family home makes itself felt well before you step inside. It's housed within a remarkable building that was once part of the Warwick Farm Dairy.

In its 19th Century heyday, the site supplied milk to Queen Victoria - and the structure exudes historical charm. The exterior is just as it appeared in adverts of the time: It still has the same large windows, as is immediately apparent upon opening the front door of this welcoming apartment. You enter into a strikingly light-filled room that has been exceptionally refurbished to incorporate traditional features into a stylish decorator scheme - light colours and contrasts are used throughout to conjure a modish edge. Yet you never lose the sense of place. Take the capacious master bedroom: Sunlight cascades in through an attractive bow window that's set into the building's corner turret.

Indeed, light and space are the defining motifs of this flat. It has windows on three sides which, coupled with wide streets to the south and west, produce a wonderfully bright environment. And the floorplan isn't limited to the bare essentials - there's also a sizable laundry room, a rare luxury in central London, and an outside terrace.

Walk around the apartment and you'll find splashes of modernity, but these are focussed where they most earn their place: The kitchen, bathroom and showeroom. The refurbishment of these areas was carefully informed by current interiors trends. They embrace clean lines and minimalist fittings, but stand out, like the rest of the property, for their sophisticated use of colour. The dark blue and mustard of the shower room, the pink walls of the bathroom and the chic black of the kitchen fittings are set off beautifully by the neutrality of the other spaces. The design work is full of clever detailing, such as the way the handles of the kitchen units blend away against the cupboard doors, or how the statement beading around the bathroom tiles quotes the black lines of the taps.

From the windows, you can gaze down onto the attractive environs of Maida Vale. Little Venice is but a 10 minute stroll away; you can get to the green expanse of Paddington Recreation Ground, a Conservation Area of 27 acres, in around five. The flat is also approximately eight minutes from Maida Vale tube station and around 15 from Westbourne Park. But with its expansive 1,470 sq ft of floor space, you won't need to worry about feeling cooped up.

detailedDescription:
This rare and luxurious five bedroom three bathroom apartment of 1,584 sq ft / 147.2 sq m is available for sale in this prestigious and excellently located development, The Courthouse, through Prime London. The property also comes with two secure parking spaces.

This bright and spacious apartment has been finished to the highest standard offering tiled flooring with underfloor heating and comfort cooling. The property comprises of an open plan modern luxury integrated kitchen with miele appliances and sizable reception room with access to two private balconies, one being a corner facing south east aspect and there are fantastic views onto St Johns Gardens. There is a large main bedroom suite with a walk in wardrobe and further balcony. There are four additional bedrooms all with fitted Poliform wardrobes.

This exciting new addition to Westminster features a 24 concierge service, landscaped gardens and a resident's fitness centre, making this the ideal home or London base.

The Courthouse is in a superb Westminster location surrounded by iconic London landmarks with Big Ben, Houses of Parliament and the Tate Gallery all on your doorstep. There is easy access to a selection of amenities, eateries and retails shops which include Shepherds restaurant, The Goring, St Ermins' and The Ivy Victoria. The transport of links of Victoria, St James Park and Westminster are just a stone’s throw away.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
In this apartment, pared-back style lays the foundations for a light-filled and tranquil home. The living area is divided between two floors; a spacious, double-height reception and dining room on the fifth and an intimate snug tucked into the mezzanine – the overhead projector makes it the perfect spot for movie nights. On the main level, invite friends and family to spread out around the table as the sun sets through the west-facing windows. Serve mains prepared in the polished kitchen next door, where ergonomic design makes light work of mealtimes with high-spec appliances and clutter-free counters, thanks to the generous runs of cabinetry. Take a seat on the decked balcony when the temperature rises.
The atmosphere in the three bedrooms is equally as serene. In the master – with built-in wardrobes and a work-from-home desk– sapphire accents and open shelving make it a pleasant space to recuperate. The adjoining bathroom has a deep-seated bathtub and shower while two further bedrooms share a family bathroom with a shower.

Around the corner from Notting Hill’s most cosmopolitan road, Porchester Terrace is a quiet retreat from the thrum of city life. On your doorstep, Porchester Square offers a spot to sit and press pause after retail therapy on Westbourne Grove. To really escape, head to Kensington Gardens, only a stone’s throw away. Scope out the Palace before crossing the Serpentine and strolling through Hyde Park. Don’t miss the Serpentine Gallery, where the annual Pavilion is designed by a selected architect every year.<br /><br />

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This exquisite three-bedroom apartment is brilliantly located in a portered mansion block on a quiet, northern section of Queensway, just off Westbourne Grove in Bayswater. It has been the subject of a transformational renovation to an exemplary design by architects Sforza/ Heah, combining excellent spatial consideration with an exuberance of materials and colour across almost 1,400 sq ft of light-filled interiors.

The Tour

The apartment is situated on the second floor of Arthur Court, a handsome red-brick mansion block completed in 1939, and is accessed via lift or stairs. A once-communal hallway has been incorporated into the footprint of the apartment to create a large private hallway, where a black composite ceramic floor leads from the front door to a dramatic atrium – the heart of the home.

This central hall is surrounded by a perimeter of bespoke shelving in Klein blue, defining and delineating the space while offering a glimpse through to the expansive living room. Original hardwood parquet flooring extends throughout, providing a natural grounding to the bold coloured gloss on the walls. The internal doors – which are predominantly sliding pocket doors – are all full-height, contributing to the overall sense of volume.

The double reception exceeds 23 ft in length and occupies a two-bay window frontage, where original steel-framed windows flood the room with morning and afternoon light. The kitchen is partially open to the living and dining space, positioned behind custom cabinets in a Mondrianesque lattice that allows light to flow between the zones. A terrazzo worktop is set against black cabinets and a tinted mirror splashback appears to extend the room beyond its generous limits.

The attention to detail throughout is remarkable and opportunities to incorporate bespoke elements have been taken at every level; from brass ironmongery to integrated picture lights, plus a wonderful marble heptagon set against a backdrop of impeccably painted five-layer black gloss.

Three bedrooms are spread along the western aspect. There are two similarly sized double bedrooms, one currently used as a yoga room with built-in oak wardrobes, the other as a study/studio for painting. The main bedroom opens to its own corridor formed by the perforated steel walls of an en suite bath and shower room clad in marble. Built-in wardrobes rest behind a wall of tinted glass sliding doors, reflecting the calming tone of the ceramic floor.

The Area

Westbourne Grove is one of west London’s most desirable destinations, celebrated for its restaurants, cafes and boutiques. On the doorstep are Franklin’s Wine, Sally Clarke Bakery, Provenance Butcher and The Notting Hill Fish and Meat Shop. The immediate area has many excellent restaurants such as the three Michelin-starred Core by Clare Smyth and Ottolenghi. Further bars, restaurants and pubs can be found throughout Notting Hill, as can The Electric Cinema and the popular Notting Hill Arts Club.

Next to Arthur Court is the Porchester Centre; a well-equiped gym with a 30m swimming pool. The green open spaces of Kensington Gardens are a short walk away.

Notting Hill Gate (Central Line) and Bayswater (District and Circle Lines) are close by and Royal Oak (Circle and Hammersmith and City Lines) is a few minutes’ walk. The Westway provides an easy route out of the city by road, for swift access to Heathrow Airport and the south-west.

Tenure: Share of Freehold
Lease Length: Approx. 980 years (999 years from 2002)
Service Charge: Approx. £8,000 per annum

Description

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
23 Grosvenor Crescent Mews is a beautifully designed, brand new house of approximately 4,779 sqft, arranged over only 4 floors and discretely positioned in one of Belgravia's most central and secure addresses.

The house is over 18m/59' ft wide and is arranged around a central hall with over 35' ceiling heights. The result is a house with exceptional communication between all four floors which combined with a large lift has delivered a house ideal for either relaxed family living as well as a unique space and volume for formal entertaining.

The large roof-terrace has been designed to be accessible via the lift from every floor. It is over 35ft wide and affords a high degree of privacy from the c.300+ sqft, south-facing garden.

The front door opens to an entrance and reception hall. The kitchen / breakfast room is ideally located for easy living, complete with a dumb-waiter that serves the entertaining spaces below. There is also a utility room and a guest cloakroom.

The stairs rise to the first floor with a grand proportions and a ceiling height over 3.1m. Opposite the central hall, is a study/office and beyond a guest bedroom with a dressing room and a private patio/terrace.

The second floor is centred around the wide landing and full height grazed sliding doors that open onto the south-facing terrace. The principal bedroom suite is beautifully designed and finished with superb joinery and matched marble.

Across the landing is a further guest bedroom with a dressing room and access to the roof terrace.

The lift is glass and can comfortably carry 5 passengers but is weighted for 8. Every 12 minutes it automatically relocates to the lower ground floor where it opens to the dining hall. This is uniquely impressive both in design and volume with a 35' ceiling height to a glass roof. There is a cinema/media room that has been arranged for entertaining with a bar and dumb-waiter. A wine room leads from here through to the dining hall.

Opposite is a further guest bedroom/dressing room suite. In addition there is a gym and a further shower room/guest cloakroom. Behind the gym is a plant room.

Off-street Parking:
The garage is over 17ft long and is accessed via the entrance hall and is immaculately presented with a further store room behind. There is also off-street parking across the front of the house.

Grosvenor Crescent Mews is a private gated mews located between Belgrave Square and Hyde Park Corner, surely one of the most central locations in Prime Central London.

The world renowned shopping and restaurants of Knightsbridge are within easy reach, as well as the Berkeley Hotel, the newly renovated Lanesborough Hotel and of course the 500 acres of of Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens.

There is a superb roof terrace that is accessible via the lift from all floors as well as directly from guest bedroom 2. This is south and west facing and very private. In addition there is a private terrace off guest bedroom 3.

Belgrave Square is only a short walk and provides a beautiful communal garden with a tennis court. Access to this is possible, subject to application via the Grosvenor Estate.

detailedDescription:
With their prized position within Regent's Crescent, The Garden Villas are truly beautiful modern homes designed to enhance Nash's glorious architecture and surroundings.

Location

Situated between Regent's Park and Portland Place

A remarkable address in the epicentre of the capital, where royal park meets royal crescent

A short walk to some of London's finest restaurants and cultural attractions

Description

Originally built in 1820 for the Prince Regent, later George IV, and designed by famed architect John Nash, Regent's Crescent offers residences of the grandest proportions, situated in one of London's great historical landmarks.

Surrounded by private gardens, the 67 Grade I listed new build apartments and 9 garden villas are the epitome of regal elegance. With ceiling heights up to 4.25m, and one of London's largest resident amenities comprising over 9,000 sq ft of entertainment, spa and business facilities. This fully gated development will also have 24-hour concierge and security services, offering valet parking as well as on-site storage.

With unsurpassed levels of modern luxury, finished with a level of skill and detail that match those of the master craftsmen who built the originals. Regent's Crescent offers a one-of-a kind masterpiece in modern living.

address: Walpole Mayfair, 4-5 Arlington Street, London SW1A
detailedDescription:
This stunning penthouse apartment extends over the top three floors of this historic period conversion once occupied by Prime Minister Sir Robert Walpole. If entered on the fifth floor you are greeted by the elegant lobby, basking in natural light. A bespoke floating marble staircase sweeps around a glistening Swarovski Crystal Light that cascades down from the double height ceiling. Three lavish bedroom suites are also arranged over the fifth floor, all offering luxurious en-suite bathrooms and custom-made sliding wardrobes. The principal bedroom suite boasts a dressing room and sizable marble en-suite bathroom.

Unique to this beautiful property, there is an option to enter the apartment on the sixth floor from the personal secure lift. As the lift doors open you are met by the extravagantly spacious living and entertaining space with floor to ceiling windows and doors flooding the room with natural light. The ultra-modern open plan kitchen is beautifully crafted joinery by Boffi with worktops in absolute black zodiac Quartz. The state-of-the-art kitchen appliances by Gaggenau include a full-height wine cooler, built in coffee machine and Quooker hot water tap.

The magnificent roof terrace occupies the whole seventh floor of the Walpole Mayfair with spectacular views over the city. The catering island with an integrated sink and BBQ is ideal for hosting private roof-top summer gatherings. The Walpole is a prestigious development from Oliver Burns and offers 24 hours portage.

Arlington Street is one of London's most sought-after addresses located moments from the Ritz Hotel, Green Park and Buckingham Palace. The property is surrounded by many world-famous eateries such as Hide Piccadilly and the Wolseley. An array of designer retailers can be found along Old Bond Street and New Bond Street. Green Park Station is the nearest tube station (0.2m).

title: 5 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Situated in the very heart of London's vibrant West End, 4 Henrietta Street is a classic stucco fronted Grade II listed Georgian building dating from circa 1780. Located on Covent Garden's iconic Piazza and just stone's throw from the iconic Royal Opera House, there are a plethora of truly world class shopping, dining, leisure & cultural opportunities literally on the doorstep.

Arranged over the second & third floors, this well proportioned split-level apartment features a generous main living space on the lower floor with original hardwood floors, a period fireplace and three handsome Georgian sash windows providing fantastic natural light and uninterrupted views across Covent Garden's world famous Piazza.

Full of character and period charm, traditional finishes and beautiful period details feature in every room throughout this unique and characterful home that offers classically proportioned spaces and a rare opportunity to live in the very heart of London's cultural centre.

A spacious, well appointed kitchen is situated to the rear of the lower floor, perfect for the enthusiastic home cook, featuring another beautiful period fireplace, central island unit with integrated wine fridge, modern integrated appliances and a handsome freestanding stainless steel range.

The principal bedroom faces front with three attractive Georgian sash windows and another period fireplace. A raised deck allows uninterrupted views across the Covent Garden rooftops from the comfort of bed, perfect for lazy weekend mornings. A well proportioned second/guest bedroom is located to the rear of the upper floor featuring yet another handsome period fireplace. A separate study is situated off the main staircase, ideal for home or flexible working.

One of London's most popular and recognisable landmarks and designed by renowned architect Inigo Jones in the mid-1600's at the request of the 4th Earl of Bedford, Covent Garden's Piazza and the surrounding buildings were created in a classical architectural style synonymous with Italy's great cities, with St. Paul's Church (nowadays commonly known as the Actor's Church) and its handsome portico as the centrepiece.

London's first formal square was originally conceived as a residential area to attract wealthy tenants, and through extensive investment & development in recent years the Piazza has once again become a desirable and genuinely world class residential address.

Being located in the very heart of London, residents are perfectly positioned to travel and explore on foot. The West End, Mayfair, the South Bank, River Thames and many of London's wonderful parks and open spaces are within easy reach, as well as the City of London and some of London's top educational institutions such as Kings College, University College London and the London School of Economics & Political Science (lse).

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Originally designed as an extension of the Bayswater Athenaeum by architect Arthur Billig, Westbourne Grove was once the beating heart of Notting Hill’s cultural scene. And it shows. Inside, this third-floor apartment elevates its traditional architecture with a thoroughly modern design. An open-plan layout makes the kitchen and living area the social hub of the home. Subtly zoned, there’s a seamless flow of light and space here. Move easily between pouring coffee at granite counters to flicking through the channels on the sofa. Gather around the dining table with mains prepared in the streamlined kitchen – high-spec, integrated appliances make cooking effortless and there’s plenty of storage for organic produce from nearby Planet Organic. Note the wine cooler built into the wooden island. In the bedrooms, soft light and pared-back aesthetics create a sense of peace and quiet. The master enjoys wall-to-wall storage, space for a dressing table and an en-suite with twin vanities, a shower and a bath. The second is served by a family bathroom and is perfect for overnight guests. Or reimagine it as a home office or gym. It’s a property that’s hard to miss from the outside too. Theatrical effigies – from Queen Victoria to Dante – gaze out from above Italianate-style, arched windows. Sculptured pilasters topped by decorative capitals frame the stucco-fronted facade. A home carved with history.

Wandering down Westbourne Grove, you’ll find a string of upscale boutiques, artisan cafés and lively restaurants that capture the essence of Notting Hill’s cosmopolitan spirit. Start the day with brunch at Granger and Co. Before browsing the shelves at Diptyque. A quick personal training session at Bodyism before biodynamic middle-eastern plates at Ottolenghi. In ten minutes, you could be strolling the Italian Gardens near Kensington Palace or browsing the vintage stalls on Portobello Road in less than 15.<br /><br />

address: Christchurch House, 5 Caxton Street, Westminster SW1H
detailedDescription:
**3D Virtual viewing ** Refurbished Two Bedroom Apartment | World Class Location | 798 Sq Ft |Fourth Floor | Lift access | Double Aspect Reception Room Overlooking Christchurch Gardens | Double Aspect Principal Bedroom Overlooking Historic Caxton Hall |Central heating |Refitted Kitchen & Bathroom | Guest Cloakroom | Chain Free | Two Year Service Charge Paid Incentive

A well-presented and interior-designed two-bedroom fourth floor modern apartment in a world-class location in the heart of Westminster.

The apartment features well planned living accommodation with a modern fitted kitchen that opens to a double aspect living room overlooking the redesigned and historic Christchurch Gardens.

This chain-free long lease apartment also features a guest cloakroom, quality wooden flooring, a double aspect principal bedroom overlooking Historic Caxton Hall and a double second bedroom.

Having undergone a renovation in recent years, the kitchen, bathroom and guest cloakroom have been refitted, the apartment refurbished throughout with new flooring and lighting. Ready to move into or accept tenants.

On top of the refurbished interior, the communal hallway have recently undergone a refurbishment adding to the modern and quality feel.

The location of Christchurch House will be a talking point for all your friends and visitors. Not only is it located close to St James’s Park Underground and St James’s Park itself but it is located adjacent to Christchurch Gardens, an historic park, now an oasis of calm, but is renowned for being the resting place of a number of notable figures including Colonel Blood, the only person to have ever successfully stolen the Crown Jewels from the Tower of London in 1671.

Christchurch Gardens was the formal burial ground for St Margaret Church dating back to 1625 and was replaced by Christ Church in the 19th century, which was then destroyed in the blitz in 1941.

The space was then converted to a public garden in 1950, designated a conservation area in 1985 and following a £2.5m refurbishment and reopened in 2020.

The gardens are also home to The Suffragette Monument which was erected in 1970 and adjacent to the garden is a bronze statue commemorating the composer Henry Purcell.
Opposite Christchurch House is Caxton Hall, a grade II listed building with a historical history like no other! Its varied history is fascinating;
The building was the location of the First Pan-African Conference in 1900.

The Women's Social and Political Union (wspu), part of the British Suffragette movement, held a ‘Women's Parliament’ at Caxton Hall at the beginning of each parliamentary session from 1907, with a subsequent procession to the Houses of Parliament and an attempt (always unsuccessful) to deliver a petition to the prime minister in person.

Caxton Hall's central role in the militant suffrage movement is now commemorated by a bronzed scroll sculpture that stands nearby in Christchurch Gardens.

On 10 October 1925, Harry Pollitt, founding member of the Communist Party of Great Britain was married here to Marjorie Brewer. Their best man and witness was Percy Glading, who would later be imprisoned for spying for the Soviet Union’s secret police.

During the Second World War, Caxton Hall was used by the Ministry of Information as a venue for press conferences held by Winston Churchill and his ministers. This wartime role is marked by a commemorative plaque.

On 12 May 1960, over 1,000 people attended the first public meeting of the Homosexual Law Reform Society and The National Front was formed at a meeting in Caxton Hall, Westminster on 7 February 1967.

Caxton Hall was also used as a central London register office for weddings from October 1933 to 1978. Notable people who were married there include; Elizabeth Taylor, Diana Dors, Peter Sellers, Bernard Bresslaw, Roger Moore, Orson Welles, Joan Collins, Adam Faith, Barry Gibb and Ringo Starr. On 18 August 1952, future Prime Minister Anthony Eden married Clarissa Spencer-Churchill, the niece of the then Prime Minister Winston Churchill.

Along with being adjacent to Christchuch Gardens, Christchurch House is under 400m to St James Park, the beautiful 57 acre Royal Park with Buckingham Palace to one boundary & Horseguards Parade to another.

An amazing apartment in a sublime location.

Step through into the entrance hallway, continue straight ahead, turn left into the main, open plan living area, ideal for entertaining. Immediately on the right is the open planned kitchen/dining room. Flat K is a well laid out lateral apartment of 2,749 square feet on the favoured Northern side of the building on the third floor, with views over both Park Street as well as the hidden Green Street Gardens.

With a well-considered 'original' layout, the apartment offers a grand entrance hall, 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, and 'eat-in' kitchen and a double reception room almost 40 ft in length.

Park Street is a well-regarded address, conveniently located to benefit from the impressive selection of world renowned restaurants, bars and hotels, as well as the diverse retail offerings in the immediate vicinity.
