An elegant first floor, three bedroom apartment situated in a highly sought after red brick mansion block with a lift and a porter.

Location

Upper Montagu Street is excellently situated just moments from Portman Village, Marylebone High Street and the West End, together with the greenery of Regent’s Park.

The transport links are excellent from nearby Baker Street (0.3 miles), Marylebone (0.3 miles) and Marble Arch (0.6 miles) underground stations, and Paddington (0.9 miles) train stations, and access to the West and Heathrow via the A40.

Description

A beautifully presented first floor apartment set in this popular Edwardian block, located on the corner of Upper Montagu Street and York Street. This elegant home with almost 3m high ceilings and wonderfully large windows has interconnecting, south facing light filled reception rooms with marble fireplaces and gas fires. The kitchen/breakfast room has bespoke units and granite worktops. The apartment has 3 double bedrooms all with built in wardrobes. There is a wonderful dressing room leading through to the en-suite bathroom in the principal suite. The second bedroom also benefits from an en suite and the apartment further benefits from a spacious family bathroom and a utility room.

Square Footage: 2291 sq ft

detailedDescription:
This stunning and spacious 2 bedroom apartment in the heart of Holborn has been designed in light and grey neutral tones reflecting the Victorian Gothic style buildings surrounding the area, offering elegance, peace of mind and the security of an iconic address in the true heart of historic London.

This generously sized living room is enhanced by floor-to-ceiling windows and designed for entertaining, featuring spacious dining area with premium engineered timber flooring and open-plan fully fitted kitchen with Miele appliances and stone worktop. Peaceful and welcoming master bedroom offers generous fitted wardrobes with the perfect balance of spacious storage and exceptional finishes to include concealed automatic lighting. A luxury en suite limestone bathroom offers a bath and walk in shower and is finished with high-quality white goods and luxury polished chrome taps, smart wooden fixtures and huge mirrors with discreet downlighting for instant relaxation. Larger than average second bedroom benefits from fitted wardrobes to include concealed automatic lighting and floor to ceiling windows. A family bathroom offers the same luxury design with a bath and overhead shower. There is further storage in the hallway that houses a washer/dryer.

This building sits within walking distance of many of London's finest and oldest educational institutions in Holborn

London School of Economics is located just on the doorstep of Lincoln Square. King's College London, the fourth oldest university in the UK is just five minutes away, whilst University College London in Bloomsbury is within 20 minutes from Lincoln Square. A number of London's best primary and secondary schools such as St Paul's Cathedral School, City of London School for Boys and Girls are also within easy walking distance.

Just 2 minute walk from Holborn underground station, the cobblestones of Covent Garden with its historic market square, world famous opera house and endless places to shop, eat and drink makes it one of Londoners favourite leisure spots.

Please call to arrange a viewing while the flat is still available!

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Walk into this light, airy flat and you will be struck by the sheer level of craftsmanship on display.

The oak floor alone is a work of art. Completely bespoke, it was sanded, stained and polished by hand on site; its chevron pattern creating a chic sense of attitude and continuity throughout the space. And what a space. With two bedrooms, a bathroom, a shower room and the huge living area, it already spans 1,151 sq ft - but the shrewdly designed sight lines between the rooms make it seem 20 percent bigger. This is enhanced by the leafy trees outside, and the views down to the playing fields of Vincent Square.

Those playing fields are a splash of countryside in the middle of town and speak to the village-like quality that residents love about this neighbourhood. The area is full of independent shops, local restaurants and quiet residential streets. Yet it's also a stone’s throw from the purr of central London life. You can amble to the West End in twenty minutes or to the tranquility of St. James's Park lake in fifteen; you can be at Victoria station in under ten.

It's such an inviting prospect, that many prospective buyers find themselves accepting properties with obvious drawbacks. This flat is not one of those - everywhere you look, clever design touches help it perform at its best. Take the door to the living area, which folds back flush with the wall to create a perception of flow into the entrance hall. If you do wish to shut it, however, it reveals a stylish bookcase built into the wall. And then there are the aesthetic elevations that show just how much care has got into every detail: The Carrara marble kitchen worktop has been sanded to create an inconspicuous gradient down to the sink; the grain across the Macassar ebony kitchen cabinets runs straight from one to the next; the artworks on the living room walls are picked out by individual spotlights.

The whole environment is so agreeable that, for everything that's on the doorstep, it might just become your favourite place in town.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Half Moon Street, Mayfair, London W1J
detailedDescription:
Imagine the perfect Mayfair pied à terre. It would be bright, smartly laid-out, replete with storage, and finished to the utmost level of quality. It would, in fact, be just like this beautiful, high-ceilinged apartment three minutes from Green Park tube station.

Step inside and the first thing you notice is its sunniness. Its orientation is ideal - the bedroom faces east, the reception west - and it is blessed with an enormous six-lite bay window. This not only floods the living room with light but makes for a stylish design feature in its own right. The place also feels wonderfully enabling. Many West End flats suffer from awkwardly shaped nooks and crannies, or unusably long corridors, but in this property not a single square foot is wasted. The sense of space is only amplified by the large mirrors in the reception, and the sight line that connects it across to the bedroom.

The property holds secrets that extend it yet further. The double bedroom has ample cupboards, but panels open to reveal even more storage. Or take those reception room mirrors. You would never realise to look at them, but the one on the right is actually a door. Slide it away and it reveals an exquisitely finished kitchen - the continuation of the grain from one cupboard door to the next is something that can only be achieved when the units have been made bespoke.

This emphasis on quality is the defining feature of the flat. Its very fabric, from joinery to stonework, has been elevated to the nth degree. The custom-made floor, for instance, is superlative: It was all sanded, stained and lacquered on site. Or look at the fireplace. The regularity of its horizontal lines look almost man-made but it is actually completely natural, lovingly crafted from sumptuous striato marble. The effort that has gone into the interior extends even to the smallest details: The dark bronze electrical fittings, say, the fine cornicing, and the dark wenge wood detailing that stylistically unites the mirrors and the bookcases. It is Mayfair through and through.

The building itself is no different. The flat is on the top floor of a proud, Victorian red-brick building with a grand central staircase (and a lift, of course). It is also a classic Mayfair address - Algernon Moncrieff in Oscar Wilde's The Importance Of Being Earnest famously lives on Half Moon Street - and a stone's throw from all the major touchpoints. The road connects with the quieter end of Piccadilly to the South, leading straight onto the calm of Green Park. In seven minutes you can get to Mount Street, where you'll find restaurants such as Scott's. And for a lower key evening, you can always head around the corner to Shepherd's Market, a little enclave of pubs and restaurants that seems to evade the attention of the tourists.

See? Told you it was perfect.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Is there such a thing as a perfect flat? We don't mean one that's merely well decorated, but ideal in its very fundamentals.
This first-floor Bayswater apartment on the broad tree-lined avenue of Westbourne Terrace would surely be a leading contender.

Spread across 1,555 sq ft, including three bedrooms, three bathrooms and a utility room, it has an enormous footprint. The sense of volume is only exacerbated by the 3.8m-high ceilings and the large rectangular spaces; no awkward angles or L shapes here. The layout really could not be better: The bedrooms face east and the living areas west, meaning that sunlight pours into the right places at the right moments throughout the day, and none of those bedrooms are next to each other. What's more, that huge reception room leads onto a stunning kitchen dining room, creating a chic contemporary feel and pleasing sense of flow.

All that alone would make any apartment compelling, but this one goes a step further: Every single room has its own outside space. No matter how long you spend refurbishing a place, such qualities are either there or they're not, and this property has them in spades.

It is of course, as you would expect, impeccably decorated too. The best period features have been preserved, such as the attractive cornicing in the reception, kitchen-diner and bedrooms but the interiors have been updated to feel stylish, warm and unostentatiously beautiful. All the work has been done to the highest quality and care: Take the bespoke wall cabinets in the kitchen-diner that employ wood marquetry to create a chic, eye-catching feature. Or look at the carefully sourced light fittings which provide those large rooms with cohesion and a modern edge.

The property's final virtue is another that you can't contrive: Its location. With its majestic facade and private access road, the grand structure that houses this flat is one of those characteristically magnificent Westbourne Terrace buildings. Living in Bayswater is enviably central, putting you in walking distance of the West End, Hyde Park and Notting Hill. There are also a host of first-rate schools nearby and Crossrail is due to arrive at nearby Paddington station over the next few years.

Seriously, show us a better London apartment. We'll wait.

detailedDescription:
Introducing The Ebury Street Apartments, a prestigious development designed by award-winning architects Squire and Partners, interior designed by Martin Goddard, and delivered by one of finest developers – Berkeley Homes in 2014.

Measuring 1,830 square feet (170 square meters) the apartment provides spacious lateral living on the ground floor of this boutique development. It features an elegant living area with floor to ceiling windows, the main bedroom with a walk-through dressing area and an en-suite bathroom with marble finishes. There are two further large bedrooms incorporating quality fixtures and fittings, soft lightning and plentiful storage space, second bedroom also comes with its own shower room.

Across the hallway, you have a stylish kitchen/breakfast room featuring high-quality cabinetry, Marble worktops, Gaggenau & Miele appliances. There’s an additional guest WC and a cloakroom. There’s an integrated audio & TV system, a comfortable cooling/heating system and a gas fireplace complimenting the space to unwind.

Amenities include a 24-hour concierge, secure underground car parking (parking place can be purchased separately) and an on-site fitness studio.

Belgravia is renowned for its village-like clusters of boutiques, jewellers and fine restaurants, sitting alongside elegant and historic private homes and embassies. A short walk from Ebury Square is Belgravia’s fashion boutiques, spanning Motcomb Street, Elizabeth Street and West Halkin Street. This highly polished part of London is a magnet for people who are looking to be in the epicentre of fashion, culture, history, intimate and stylish cafes, Michelin star restaurants and world-class shopping. Some of the famed fine dining establishments in the area include Motcombs bar and restaurant, the first Michelin starred Thai restaurant in Europe - The Nahm, and Mosimann’s, home to seven private dining rooms.

Situated in close proximity to Sloane Square and Victoria Stations, you have easy access to all London destinations and beyond – whether by car, taxi, train, London Underground, London buses or bike. Heathrow airport is just under an hour away and Paris is within easy reach by Eurostar.

On the ground floor is an open plan kitchen reception room has underfloor heating, plenty of storage with a study area, which is ideal for working from home. Leading off the ground floor area and a really useful addition, is the utility room with a washer dryer and space to dry clothes. This room also offers a toilet and sink. Upstairs is a light and airy large bedroom with a walk in wardrobe and a modern ensuite bathroom.
This unique property whilst in the heart of Central London, enjoys a quiet refuge away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The independent shops and restaurants of Crawford Street are a short distance away whilst a little bit further but still within walking distance, you will find Marylebone Village with its acclaimed shops and dining options along with the renowned department stores of Oxford Street. For leisure, Hyde Park is a 10 minute walk away and the beautiful Regents Park slightly further. Transport links are excellent with Edgware Road, Marylebone, Baker Street and Marble Arch stations within a short walking distance. For connections to Heathrow, Paddington station is a 10 minute walk away where journeys to Heathrow take 20 minutes.

detailedDescription:
An incredible opportunity to purchase a prestigious two bedroom apartment within the most popular local development, 9 Millbank, for reassignment through Prime London.

Set facing the tranquil landscaped gardens, this 1,124sq ft / 104 sq m two bedroom apartment is going to make an ideal central London getaway. The spacious reception room enjoys views over the peaceful, private landscaped gardens, and the open plan kitchen with Küppersbusch appliances and expertly crafted finishes complete the entertaining space. Both bedrooms are well proportioned doubles and are finished in a warm neutral palette to create a calm retreat where you can relax and rejuvenate. The property also benefits from having two bathrooms, one of which is en-suite.

For residents’ comfort, all properties in 9 Millbank have underfloor heating throughout, and comfort cooling to all reception rooms and bedrooms.

Leisure facilities exclusive to the residents at 9 Millbank include a 24-hour concierge, a state-of-the-art gym, luxurious swimming pool with spa and treatment room, private cinema screening room, meeting rooms, and landscaped gardens.

Standing proudly on the banks of the river Thames, in the beating heart of historic Westminster, 9 Millbank encapsulates British luxury and style. Now a Grade II listed building, Millbank Residences’ grandeur still stands tall in Westminster’s iconic skyline.

detailedDescription:
Located in the prime area of Queen Anne's Gate, SW1, London, this vast seven-bedroom apartment is one of the largest currently on sale in super-prime London and covers 11,487 sq ft.

Arranged over three floors, the standout rooms are the huge kitchen with an island centre, and the bathroom with golden walls and wood panelling.

The apartment has a private entrance, access to a private rear garden, which is directly next to St James' Park, and exclusive views over Horse Guards Parade and Birdcage Walk.

The property has also been the home of London's elite since the 18th century and has housed royal residents and high-end political figures. Its luxurious interiors, impressive façade and positioning between the Houses of Parliament and Buckingham Palace, have made it the perfect choice for these individuals.

Period features can be seen throughout the luxury apartment, such as fireplaces, high ceilings, coving and cornicing. There is a superb entrance hall, a magnificent 40 ft ballroom and a 60 ft family room.

The apartment, within the fully portered building, also has a master suite with a study and en-suite, six en-suite bedrooms, a sauna room and separate staff accommodation.

address: Westbourne Park Road, Westbourne Park, Notting Hill W2
detailedDescription:
*** rare triplex maisonette *** | Three Large Bedrooms | Three Bathrooms of which two are Ensuites | Two Roof Terraces | Private Street Entrance | 1550 Sq Ft | High Ceilings | Spacious with Ample Storage | Notting Hill Location | Spectacular Views | 0.1 Miles To Westbourne Park Station | 0.2 Miles To Portobello Road

129 Westbourne Park Road has been sensitively refurbished to the highest standards, having been previously owned by the celebrated musician Nick Cave for many years before - his unique creativity and talent still informs the house’s atmosphere. Located in the heart of Notting Hill, the diverse shops, bars and restaurants of Portobello are all within easy reach, as are Golborne Road and Bayswater. In the immediate area popular watering holes such as The Cow, The Oak and The Westbourne are all within one minute’ walk from the front door. Portobello road is just 0.2 miles away or 3 minutes walk.

This well appointed triplex maisonette has its own street entrance and four floors which includes a full-sized roof terrace. The renovation has created a large, open-plan kitchen and sitting room on the first floor with a tall corniced ceiling, and sash windows overlooking Westbourne Park Road that create a bright, naturally lit space - pole position for watching The Notting Hill Carnival procession from the comfort of home. The working (gas) fireplace has a vintage fire surround, flanked by sturdy oak bookcases and cupboards with ample storage. The kitchen, with a non-demise flat roof space outside to the rear with floor-to-ceiling sash windows is equipped with great quality appliances and cupboards, including a full-sized dishwasher and fridge/freezer.

The large Master Bedroom and en-suite bathroom, with a small guest loo outside, takes up the whole second floor, the bathroom fully tiled in white marble and includes a very useful steam room shower. Custom made oak cupboards from the wood-floored bedroom into the bathroom create a dressing room area, and custom-installed cupboards and bookcases filling two whole walls of the bedroom also create ample storage for even the most extensive wardrobes.

Two further bedrooms occupy the third floor, one of which is a large, airy room currently set up as a media room with an automatic drop-down screen and projector, but could also serve as another full-sized bedroom. The other has an en-suite bathroom and shower. Both have solid wood flooring.

Further storage exists in an easily-accessed under-stair compartment, and a washer/dryer is located in a discreet closet on the third floor. There is triple glazing throughout on the front-facing windows.

Accessed by a drop-down ladder, the fourth floor full-sized roof terrace is decked in teak and has a wicker surround for privacy, with spectacular 360 degree views across West London.

129 Westbourne Park Road is a rare find in an ideal location, brought back to life with love and a renovation of the highest stands, flexible enough to suit a young couple, small family or as a luxurious West London pied-à-terre.

This spectacular two bedroom apartment extends over 1,600 square feet of living space and is located within this beautiful Georgian house. The property has been elaborately refurbished to extremely high standards and leaves a finish that is second to none.

Comprising of a truly stunning double reception with a breath-taking open plan ‘Ghost Kitchen' by Fendi imported from Italy, finished in solid Ebony with Gaggenau appliances located within. The large west facing windows bathe the reception room with natural light.

There is also a terrace directly off the kitchen/dining area, providing an outdoor space.

The apartment features under floor heating, a Lutron lighting system, air conditioning, acoustic insulation and fully tanked vaults. Other features include original marble fireplace surrounds, Carrara marble bathroom tiles imported from Italy with Catalano sinks and toilets, anti-steam crystal mirrors, Dornbrachht rose gold taps and an alarm to the walk in wardrobe.

The apartment is part of a gated development set amidst landscaped gardens with mature trees and herbaceous planting. St George's Fields is known as an oasis within central London, with its two and half acres of private tranquil woodland gardens. Nearby is Connaught Village with its array of cafes, restaurants and boutiques. Larger stores can be found in Oxford Street and Marble Arch.

Hyde Park is opposite with its green spaces, walks and cycle routes and the Serpentine River and Gallery.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This smartly composed apartment sits on the first floor of a regency townhouse on Cambridge Street, part of the residential grid that forms the heart of Pimlico, which was laid down by the planner Thomas Cubitt in 1825 and the following years. Sleek interiors cleverly contrast with the traditional exterior to create a modern haven in the much-admired Conservation Area.

The Tour

The apartment has been cleverly reconfigured, with a large sunny bedroom at the front that opens to a south-west facing balcony. Entry is to the living spaces, with concealed storage along one wall. On the left-hand side is a bathroom, with a small hidden utility room.

The living space has a kitchen designed by Norbert Wangen for Boffi that functions with Swiss Army knife-like precision. The rooms are flooded with light from huge windows at either end and the interiors have been carefully reconsidered using a minimal palette of bare plaster, mahogany-hued recycled leather on cork floors, steel and bold dashes of colour.

The bedroom is demarcated by a step and a huge sliding door. It has wonderful proportions, with high ceilings complete with cornicing and ceiling roses that contrast with the bare plaster finish of the walls. The bedroom has two sets of floor-to-ceiling glass doors, fitted with contemporary shutters, which open onto a Juliet balcony that overlooks quiet gardens.

The Area

Cambridge Street is quietly positioned within the attractive Pimlico Grid. While in close reach of both the river and the centre of the city, Pimlico has a wonderful, village-like atmosphere. Green space can be found a few minutes walk south, in the beautiful St George’s Square, which leads directly onto the Pimlico Garden, and the Shrubbery, a peaceful park directly overlooking the River Thames. Slightly further west is Ranelagh Gardens, an extensive 18th-century set of gardens and lawns, home to the Chelsea Flower Show. The house is within easy reach of Battersea Park, as well as the shops and restaurants of Victoria, Chelsea and Belgravia.

There are outstanding transport links within close proximity: The Underground is available at Pimlico (Victoria Line) and Sloane Square (Circle and District Lines), while Victoria station offers mainline rail services including direct trains to Gatwick Airport.

Tenure: Leasehold with Share of Freehold
Lease Length: Approx. 997 years
Service Charge: Approx £800 per annum

The apartment comprises a stunning open-plan living area that opens onto a private terrace that spans the full length of the property. The main kitchen has been designed with all-Miele appliances and breakfast bar. There is a separate adjoining kitchen, ideal for use when entertaining.

The master bedroom has a spacious walk-in wardrobe, with a modern en-suite bathroom that has his & hers vanity units and jacuzzi bath. All bedrooms benefit from views out onto the terrace, full heigh fitted storage and en-suite bathrooms. The property further comprises a guest cloakroom and storage room.

Residents enjoy access to a beautiful indoor courtyard with landscaped garden, 24h concierge service and secure car parking. A contemporary interpretation of a classic London mansion block, Marylebone Square seamlessly blends into its historic surroundings where distinctive red-brick Georgian architecture are well preserved. The nearest station is Great Portland Street, which gives access to the Metropolitan, Circle and Hammersmith & City lines.

Completing Summer 2023.

Features
  • Property Size (sqft): 2335

Upper Berkeley Street is a luxurious residential area just off Edgware Road and is close to the London's best shops, bars and restaurants as well as Oxford Street, Baker Street and the famous Hyde Park.

detailedDescription:
Located just off Edgware Road is a well presented one bed apartment in the popular building of Park West, a secure, portered purpose built block.

The flat is offered in good condition, fitted with wooden flooring throughout and benefits from a spacious reception room, fully fitted kitchen, one double bedroom and a bathroom suite.

Park West is ideally situated only a short walk to the amenities of Edgware Road, many transport links and within 10 minutes to shopping on Oxford Street. Viewings are highly recommended.

address: Gloucester Terrace, Lancaster Gate, London W2
detailedDescription:
This newly refurbished one bedroomed property is located on the sought after Gloucester Terrace, moments from Hyde Park. Entered on the first floor floor, the flat has a beautiful westerly facing reception room with open plan kitchen and balcony, At the rear is the large bedroom with fitted cupboards and bathroom.

Gloucester Terrace is within close proximity of both Hyde Park and the amenities of Queensway. Local transport links include Paddington mainline (Network Rail and Heathrow Express) and underground (Bakerloo, District, Circle and Hammersmith and City lines) station and Lancaster Gate underground (Central line) station. GloucesterTerrace is also perfectly positioned for the imminent arrival of the Elizabeth line which will offer faster journey times into the City and Canary Wharf.

detailedDescription:
A wonderful duplex apartment situated on the ground and lower ground floor of a charming Grade II Listed period conversion.

This well-presented apartment comprises a bright, spacious reception room with a striking 3.96 metre ceiling height and a modern, fully-fitted kitchen on the ground floor. Downstairs features a large master bedroom with ensuite and built-in storage, second bedroom with built-in wardrobe, family bathroom and a separate, large walk-in wardrobe. Further benefits of the apartment include stunning high ceilings, wooden flooring and large windows capturing plenty of natural light.

Located in the heart of Marylebone, Wimpole Street sits just two streets over from the shops & restaurants of Marylebone High Street, and the green open spaces of Regent's Park

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Description

A charming investment opportunity with planning permission to add a basement floor, increasing the overall footprint by approximately 50 percent. This light and spacious, triple-aspect mews house has been stripped out ready for the buyer to put their stamp on it.

Set within this very pretty mews, unusually for a house within this development there are windows on almost every side of the house, either facing into the mews itself, or onto West Warwick Place and Clarendon Street. The house is ideally situated for access to both The City and the West End, and within close proximity to an increasingly sophisticated range of local amenities in nearby Victoria and Belgravia (theatres, restaurants, retail outlets), with Victoria mainline (to Gatwick) and Underground stations both nearby.

- Two bedrooms
- Two bathrooms
- Triple aspect
- Spacious reception room
- 969 sq ft
- Share of freehold
title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

address: Asquith House, West End Gate, Marylebone W2
detailedDescription:
A simply stunning 2 bed apartment (790 Sq. Ft. With balcony) situated in Asquith House on the 10th floor of Berkeley Home's West End Gate development.

Asquith House benefits from a sweeping vantage point over the peaceful gardens and is a place of classical tranquillity and beauty. The properties themselves are a delightful composition between elegance and precise craftsmanship, the generous and bright living spaces create a truly contemporary ambiance which offer the perfect way to entertain esteemed guests.

Bringing brand new homes to one of London's most prestigious postcodes, the development is a modern interpretation of the much loved, traditional mansion block.

A treasure trove of fine art and culture, the creative scene that surrounds West End Gate introduces ample opportunities to explore London’s historic temples of art, music and design – from the world leading Victoria & Albert Museum, to the vast Royal Albert Hall. The neighbourhood offers a window into contemporary visual culture, spotlighting pioneering artistic talent across influential spaces including the Lisson, Saatchi and Serpentine Galleries. Here, you can enjoy the arts in a deeper way and discover a rich mine of design inspiration.

Asquith House is superbly located, travel by foot can be found to Edgware Road in two minutes, Paddington in eight and Marylebone is just a further ten minute walk away. By train access can be gained to Regent's Park in four minutes, Kings Cross in nine minutes and the business hub of Canary Wharf is just a seventeen train journey away.

These particulars are not intended to form part of any contract. Photographs may be general images of the development and not be the apartment.

address: Clarence Gate Gardens, Glentworth Street, London NW1
detailedDescription:
A generously proportioned, four bedroom, apartment set on the first floor of an attractive, red brick, mansion block located moments from Baker Street and Regent’s Park.

The property requires modernisation, thus giving an incoming purchaser the wonderful opportunity to create their perfect home. The accommodation comprises a double reception room, kitchen, four bedrooms, one bathroom and a guest W.C.

Clarence Gate Gardens is a peaceful street located just a short walk away from the fashionable shops, bars and restaurants of Marylebone High Street, the open spaces of Regent’s Park and the transport facilities provided by Baker Street underground and Marylebone mainline railway stations. EPC rating D.

address: Dolben Court, Montaigne Close, London SW1P
detailedDescription:
A highly desirable spacious and secure first floor, two bedroom lateral apartment presented in excellent condition with parking.

Location

Dolben Court is part of the Regency Apartments development accessed from Regency Street, which runs between Horseferry Road and Vauxhall Bridge Road.

The local area is extremely well connected with transport links at Victoria railway station providing national mainline services including the Gatwick Express, and underground stations at Victoria, St James's Park, Westminster and Pimlico all within convenient distances.

The extensive selection of shops, restaurants and cafes, along with a Curzon Cinema and notable theatres, combined with renowned and iconic landmarks such as St James's Park, the Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey and the Tate Britain Gallery, all contribute to making this is a thriving location providing an exceptional lifestyle experience in Central London.

Victoria mainline Station approximately - 0.8 miles
Pimlico Underground Station approximately - 0.3 miles

Description

This is a very impressive apartment which is considerably larger than most in this development.

Presented in good condition, the accommodation briefly comprises two double bedrooms, two bathrooms (one en suite), a spacious reception room with a private west facing balcony overlooking beautiful landscaped gardens and a separate contemporary style fitted kitchen.

Amenities within the development include secure underground garage parking with one allocated parking space, a private residents gym and 24 hour concierge security team.

Square Footage: 1082 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 980 years remaining

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Wellington House, 70 Buckingham Gate, London SW1E
detailedDescription:
Beautiful two bedroom flat in popular building near St. James's Park.

Location

Wellington House corners Buckingham Gate and Petty France, sitting opposite the iconic Taj Hotel and near the Wellington Barracks.

This is an exceptionally convenient location for access to Prime Central London, with close proximity to the world renowned landmarks, including Buckingham Palace, St James's Park, Westminster Abbey and the Houses of Parliament.

Victoria and Westminster in recent years has benefitted from a substantial and ongoing redevelopment, becoming a hub for fashion and food, with restaurants from Michelin starred chefs such as Michel Roux Jnr, Tom Kerridge, Jason Atherton, and Andrew Wong, to The Ivy and an array of cafes and boutiques in Cardinal Place and at Nova.

Coupled with the extensive historic and cultural amenities ranging from the Tate Britain Gallery to Victoria Palace Theatre there are also contemporary venues such as a Curzon cinema, and Andrew Lloyd Webber's 'Other' Palace, this is a thriving location with an exceptional lifestyle offer for local residents.

Finally this is a location renowned for its transport connections. With Victoria Station providing mainline network services including the Gatwick Express; Llocal underground services are also convenient with the Victoria Line at Victoria Station, District and Circle Line at St James' Park and Jubilee Line at Westminster Station.

Description

This is a beautiful two bedroom, sixth floor apartment of over 932 sq ft. The apartment features two bathrooms (one en suite), a high quality contemporary kitchen, wooden floors and good built-in storage.

The specification throughout this building is renowned, with benefits to all apartments including comfort cooling, integrated AV and lighting systems, underfloor heating and attractive hardwood and stone finishing as well as Gaggenau appliances.

The building enjoys a dedicated 24 hour concierge team and passenger lifts to all floors.

In our opinion this property will appeal greatly to buyers looking for a regular home or pied a terre as well as potential investors too.

Square Footage: 932 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 990 years remaining

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Spread across 5 floors, this 2,285 sq ft home has natural wooden flooring throughout and an abundance of natural light from its large sash windows.

Upon entering the fully-panelled Georgian house, your eye is drawn to the leafy and secluded garden beyond, with its travertine paved patio and borders lushly planted with mature shrubs and trees perfect for a spot of outdoor entertaining.

Leading off the entrance hallway is the dining room with its marble fireplace and window shutters, which is open plan with the kitchen complete with bespoke stainless steel units and island with integrated appliances, with the utility room with bespoke joinery concealing a Miele fridge-freezer and further appliances, as well as ample storage space, beyond.

On the lower ground floor are one double bedroom, one bedroom with large fitted cupboards and en-suite shower room, two large vaults and a small courtyard.

The dog-legged staircase with its half-landing overlooking the garden leads up to the first floor and its reception room with high ceilings, fireplace and large windows with window seats. On the same level are the spacious study and a panelled bathroom.
On the second floor is the media room/additional reception with shuttered windows and surround sound cinema system and a double bedroom with en-suite shower room.

The principal bedroom suite is located on the peaceful top (third) floor. It features bespoke fitted wardrobes and a built-in TV unit, electric blinds, reading lights and air conditioning, and a bathroom with a large spoon bath, which opens onto the south-east facing roof terrace filled with gorgeous greenery.

Meard Street runs roughly east to west between Wardour Street to the west and Dean Street to the east. The west half is pedestrianised, while the east half is a narrow single lane road. The property is perfectly positioned for all the entertainment amenities of the West End, as well as the boutique shops and restaurants of nearby Mayfair and Marylebone. Leicester Square underground station (Northern and Piccadilly lines) is approximately 0.3 miles away, and Tottenham Court Road underground station (Central and Northern lines, Crossrail link) is approximately 0.4 miles away.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A stunning five bedroom freehold house with the rarity of substantial garaging and a terrace in the heart of Marylebone Village.

Location

Salisbury Place is superbly located for the world class restaurants, cafés and shopping amenities of Marylebone and the West End, together with the greenery of Regent's Park. Transport links are superb with Marylebone Station (Bakerloo Line and National Rail), Baker Street Station (Circle, District, Metropolitan, Jubilee and Bakerloo Lines) within easy walking distance. Paddington for the Heathrow Express and St Pancreas for the Eurostar are also easily accessible from this central location.

Description

This substantial low built town house benefits from a secluded roof terrace, a large garage and occupies an enviable corner position with access from both Salisbury Place and Thornton Place. Offering approximately 3,974 sq st of bright accommodation and 239 sq ft of outside space, the house has a lateral feel owing to it being far wider than average with a flexible layout. The current owner has utilised the space as two separate dwellings, however the property is fully connected and the layout could be altered further, subject to the relevant consents. The unique vault-style reception, integrated garage and private terrace make this property a rare proposition.

There is a second garage available by a separate negotiation.

Square Footage: 3974 sq ft

title: 5 bed mews house for sale

address: Harland House, 30-34 Woodfield Place, Maida Vale, London W9
detailedDescription:
Stylishly presented two bedroom flat in a modern development within walking distance of Portobello market.

Location

The development is located only two miles North West of central London and benefits from fantastic transport links that will soon be enhanced by Paddington's new Crossrail station. This ambitious project will see journey times around the capital significantly shortened, making property in the vicinity of one of the new stations an astute investment.

Description

Harland House was built in 2014 and this second floor apartment, with lift, is presented to the highest standard of decoration and style throughout. An impressive open-plan reception room with wooden flooring leads to a modern bespoke white kitchen with integrated appliances by Bosch. The bright double bedrooms both benefit from access to the private balcony and the principal has a lovely modern en-suite bathroom. The property also benefits from residents parking.

The modern Harland House development is perfectly located in Maida Vale, moments from the beautiful canal but also from the local amenities of Harrow Road, Elgin Avenue and the famous Portobello Road. Westbourne Park Tube station (Circle and Hammersmith & City lines) is around the corner, and Maida Vale (Bakerloo line) is only a short walk away.

Square Footage: 801 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 994 years remaining

title: 4 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautiful three bedroom apartment on the third floor within a new development, Lincoln Square, located within Lincoln‘s Inn Fields; the surrounding area is a calm and quiet sanctuary, surrounded by academic, legal and cultural institutions, whilst also offering easy access to the cultural hub of Covent Garden WC2.

Lodha UK has brought together a world class team who has conceptualised an exclusive residential enclave set around a private garden square.

The development features architecture by plp Architecture, landscape by Gustafson Porter, interior design of the public and amenity areas by the celebrated interior designer, Patricia Urquiola and residential interiors by the award-winning Bowler James Brindley.

Lincoln Square is a unique offering for residents to own a high quality residence in one of London‘s finest neighbourhoods. Complete with 24 hour concierge, security, secure underground car parking, landscaped gardens in addition to 17,000 square feet of amenities for the exclusive use of residents.

Located on a rare island site, Lincoln Square has views of the adjacent Royal Courts of Justice, New Court chambers and the old Land Registry building in addition to the Thames and Lincoln‘s Inn Fields.

The most famous sites of London are within walking distance allowing residents to embrace the surrounding heritage in addition to the City‘s ever evolving skyline. Some of these include:
- Lincoln Inn Fields (2 minute walk)
- Holborn Tube Station (6 minute walk)
- Convent Garden (12 minute walk)
- Trafalgar Square (18 minute walk) and
- Leicester Square (19 minute walk)

Lodha UK is an established London-based development company with a strong in-house development team with capabilities in planning, design and procurement, as well as marketing, sales and customer support. Lodha UK is the development subsidiary of Lodha Group, a multinational premium real estate developer with a tradition of creating world-class developments.

address: Marylebone Square, Moxon Street, London W1U
detailedDescription:
Luxury Living Homes International present this This stunning 1 bedroom is located on the third floor and is 890 sqf with a 60 sqf terrace..

This bespoke development of 54 crafted homes including 14 Penthouses, high quality retail and restaurants, 24 affordable homes for Westminster‘s key workers and a community hall to house the Marylebone farmers market, exhibitions and recitals. Marylebone Square will become a hugely renowned and desirable retreat to live or to unwind for the whole Marylebone community.

The development borrows an art deco feel with its anodized bronze aluminium and granite retail façade to its ceramic cladding with 4 glaze colours and powder coated aluminium supports and balconies. The cladding will hold concealed lighting to emit a soft glow at night. Internally there is a 6 storey internal atrium lined with plantings of trees and shrubs to create an inner garden similar to the famous Squares of Marylebone but protected from the elements by an apex glass roof and offering a haven to relax and meet your fellow residents.

1,2,3 and Penthouses available
12 Penthouse Apartments with Terracing ranging from 1,389 sq ft to 3,671 sq ft
Prices from £2,693,000

Estimated Completion Q1/Q2 2023

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Greater London Properties presents
A once in a lifetime opportunity to acquire this stunning Grade Two star listed freehold townhouse on one of the most desirable streets in Soho. This rare early 18th century street was initially developed by John Meard Junior, a Master Carpenter who worked on many great London churches, including St Paul's Cathedral, with Sir Christopher Wren.

Dating from 1732, this superb property is steeped in history and benefits to this day from an abundance of period features including bracketed staircases, architrave doorcases, flush-framed sash windows, and wood paneled walls, fireplaces, cornices, dado rails and window shutters.

The Property
Extending over 2,494 sq. Ft., this impressive townhouse has been wonderfully renovated to its present contemporary incarnation sympathetic to the historic nature of the building.

The ground floor entrance opens up to a spacious hallway, which leads on to a beautifully presented dining room, a contemporary, bespoke kitchen with breakfast bar and utility room, and a wonderful, quiet garden at the rear of the house. The garden has a travertine paved patio and borders lushly planted with mature bushes and trees. Back inside, climbing the historic stairs you are greeted by a landing flooded with natural light, a striking reception room facing Meard Street encompassing three symmetric period windows and high ceilings, in addition to a study with guest bathroom. The second floor holds another reception/media room with cinema system with surround sound, and a bedroom with en-suite bathroom. The top floor features the master bedroom with air conditioning, an abundance of fitted wardrobes and a bathroom with separate wc which provides access to a private south-east facing terrace. Additionally, the lower ground floor contains a private patio, two bedrooms, one of which is en-suite, and plenty of vault storage. Most of the main rooms still have their original built-in cupboards.

This is an opportunity to purchase a historic 300-year-old property in the heart of one of the most vibrant locations in London – to enjoy the characterful space and to be its guardian for future generations.

The Location
Meard Street is one of the few surviving streets in London from the early 18th century and is partly pedestrianised. The townhouse offers easy access to the City of London, Heathrow and City airports and mainline railway stations including St Pancras International (Eurostar), as well as several of the world's best universities. It is a short walk from Carnaby Street, Oxford Street and Regent Street, as well as numerous West End theatres, and is very well connected in terms of buses and tubes. The nearest Underground stations are Piccadilly Circus (Bakerloo and Piccadilly lines), Leicester Square (Northern and Piccadilly lines), Oxford Circus (Central, Victoria and Bakerloo lines) and Tottenham Court Road (Central and Northern lines and the soon-to-be opened Elizabeth line (Crossrail)). Even four of London's Royal Parks are within walking distance.

Notice
Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

detailedDescription:
Greater London Properties Presents
An impressive studio apartment with underground parking in this very sought-after portered block in the heart of fashionable Soho. This stunning, bright first floor flat offers unrivalled access to all of London's entertainment in the heart of the West End.

The Property
Extending over 463 sq ft, this superb apartment features a stunning, large dual aspect studio room with gorgeous wood floors, ample storage and double-glazed windows which bathe the property in natural light. There is a beautiful kitchenette with breakfast bar and a contemporary bathroom with spacious walk-in shower, a toilet, sink, wall hung bidet and an electric heated towel rail. The flat is ideal for owner-occupiers looking for tranquillity in this exquisite location.

The Location
Upper John Street is seconds away from the popular shopping facilities of Carnaby Street, Regent Street and Oxford Street and is surrounded by a wealth of attractions including some of London's finest restaurants, theatres, bars and cafes. The apartment offers easy access to Mayfair, the City of London, airports and to many of the world's best universities and is very well connected in terms of buses and tubes. The nearest Underground stations are Piccadilly Circus (Bakerloo and Piccadilly lines), Oxford Circus (Central, Victoria and Bakerloo lines), Leicester Square (Northern and Piccadilly lines) and Tottenham Court Road (Central and Northern lines, Crossrail).

The Owner Says
When we moved from Hampstead to Surrey we realised that we would miss the proximity to London with all the shopping, restaurants, night life and theatre and so were delighted to find this Studio apartment in the heart of Soho.
We never wanted to live there full-time, so we remodelled with the idea of creating a luxury air-conditioned hotel style suite with a fabulous wet room.
Mission accomplished and with the almost unbelievable amenity of our own basement parking place we have enjoyed a day or three here every week since.

The apartment benefits from a long lease, a day-porter and underground parking! Call today to arrange a viewing!

address: Central St Giles, Tottenham Court Road WC2H
detailedDescription:
Looking for a place in the city with a generous size and a private balcony view – just moments from Oxford Street, Covent Garden, and the Tube?

This immaculate, large 1-bed (663 sq ft) on the 7th floor of the unique Central St. Giles development comes with wooden flooring and floor-to-ceiling windows, a north-facing balcony with views over the central skyline, and access to a ground-floor piazza with a selection of popular restaurants and eateries.

As you step through onto the wooden flooring of your new entrance hall, you'll find a pristine white bathroom through a door on your left, complete with an extra-wide, feature-lit mirror over a bowl-style hand basin, a wall-mounted heated towel ladder, and a walk-in, glass-screen shower enclosure – all of it finished beautifully with a bright white colour scheme contrasted against the large-format dark tiling on the floor.

Next to the bathroom, you'll come to the apartment's northwest-facing master bedroom, with an integrated triple wardrobe, and the bright natural light of its floor-to-ceiling windows stretching from wall to wall, with private views out over the charming Covent Garden skyline below.

As you explore further down the hallway, this luxury apartment opens out into a bright and spacious open-plan living, dining and kitchen area. And the first thing you'll notice is the full natural light pouring in through the wall-to-wall glass of its 7th-floor balcony.

To your right, you'll find a fully equipped integrated kitchen in white, including an extractor over an induction hob, an under-counter oven, an integrated overhead microwave, and a full-height, integrated fridge-freezer.

Across the bright and spacious living room, you'll open the extra-wide glass door to the fresh air and natural light of your own private north-facing balcony. It's the perfect relaxing spot to admire the bustle of the city below – and it's a welcome extra space for when you're entertaining guests.

Beyond the walls of your pristine new home, you couldn't ask for a better location:

You'll be just a 4-minute walk from the Northern and Central Lines at Tottenham Court Road Station, giving you quick links through the city centre in two key directions: Including direct links to King's Cross, Camden, Waterloo, Bank, and Hyde Park.

It's less than 10 minutes' walk to either Leicester Square or Covent Garden – and only 15 minutes down to Waterloo Bridge and the sweeping bends of the Thames itself.

And of course, an apartment with such a prime central location means you'll be just moments from all of the local city amenities you'd expect – with the famous shopping of Oxford Street, the culture of the British Museum, and a number of classic green London squares and gardens all within 5 minutes of your doorstep.

This bright and spacious balcony 1-bed comes with central skyline views, immaculate interiors, and a wealth of local conveniences from its unmatched location in the cultural and shopping hub of the city.

And that means a desirable property like this won't be around for long.

So if you're looking for luxury living in the heart of Covent Garden – with your own private, 7th-floor balcony and a ground-floor Piazza available every day – give us a call and we'll show you everything life at Central St. Giles has to offer

address: Lincoln Square, Portugal Street, Holborn, London WC2A
detailedDescription:
This luxury 2 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment in Lincoln Square has been designed in light and grey neutral tones reflecting the Victorian Gothic style buildings surrounding the area, offering elegance, peace of mind and the security of an iconic address in the true heart of historic London.

This generously sized living room is enhanced by floor-to-ceiling windows and designed for entertaining, featuring spacious dining area with premium engineered timber flooring and open-plan fully fitted kitchen with Miele appliances and stone worktop. Peaceful and welcoming master bedroom offers generous fitted wardrobes with the perfect balance of spacious storage and exceptional finishes to include concealed automatic lighting. A luxury en suite limestone bathroom offers a bath and walk in shower and is finished with high-quality white goods and luxury polished chrome taps, smart wooden fixtures and huge mirrors with discreet downlighting for instant relaxation. Larger than average second bedroom benefits from fitted wardrobes to include concealed automatic lighting and floor to ceiling windows. A family bathroom offers the same luxury design with a bath and overhead shower. There is further storage in the hallway that houses a washer/dryer.

Lincoln Square boasts over 17,000 sqft of exceptional private residents' facilities, including:

5* 24/7concierge
Private residents' cinema
25 metre lap pool
Gymnasium and spa facilities
Residents' club room and library
Two flexible private dining rooms
Snooker room
Games/kids' room
Private meeting rooms

Lincoln Square sits within walking distance of many of London's finest and oldest educational institutions in Holborn

London School of Economics is located just on the doorstep of Lincoln Square. King's College London, the fourth oldest university in the UK is just five minutes away, whilst University College London in Bloomsbury is within 20 minutes from Lincoln Square. A number of London's best primary and secondary schools such as St Paul's Cathedral School, City of London School for Boys and Girls are also within easy walking distance.

Just a ten minute walk from Lincoln Square, the cobblestones of Covent Garden with its historic market square, world famous opera house and endless places to shop, eat and drink makes it one of Londoners favourite leisure spots.

Chancery Lane Underground Station (Central line) - 0.3 miles
Holborn Underground Station (Central and Piccadilly lines) - 0.5 miles
Covent Garden Underground Station (Piccadilly line) - 0.6 miles

detailedDescription:
Charming Freehold five bedroom house in the heart of the Moreton Triangle.

Location

Moreton Terrace forms one side of a pretty enclave (the Moreton Triangle) being one of the most desirable locations in Pimlico. With an array of boutiques and cafes this is a 'village-like' location in the heart of Central London, renowned for its proximity to transport links, many iconic landmarks and local amenities.

Pimlico tube station (Zone 1) is just 0.2 miles away. Victoria Station is also close by, with main line services including the Gatwick Express, and Underground services via the Victoria, District and Circle Lines. Nearby landmarks include the Houses of Parliament and Tate Britain, but it is the local lifestyle culture, with artisan cafes and wine shops, antique and fashion boutiques, combined with bespoke contemporary design companies and fashion outlets that make this a charming and vibrant location in Central London.

Walks down the river and into the local garden squares can be found nearby as well as larger green spaces, such as St. James' Park and Battersea Park.

Description

This charming five bedroom house, with excellent proportions throughout is located within the Moreton Triangle, one of the most sought out areas in Pimlico.

The imposing home showcases period features and exudes elegance and charm, which makes it perfect for family living and entertaining. There are high ceilings and mouldings in the double connecting reception room and formal dining room. The quiet study overlooks the garden which provides a peaceful space to work. The principal suite is an impressive space and incorporates a beautifully appointed en suite bathroom as well as extensive storage, which exists throughout the property. The lower ground floor offers ideal space for guests, children, or a nanny, and can easily become self-contained. It has a fully modernised utility room, which can be made into an additional kitchen.

The house is in the unique position of not being overlooked from the ground floor half landing and up. Its outside space includes both a separate terrace and a garden, and its position on the street provides ample light and sunshine both at the front and the back of the house.

Square Footage: 2530 sq ft

address: St. George's Square, Pimlico, London SW1V
detailedDescription:
Impressive first floor apartment on popular garden square in Pimlico

Location

This is a popular residential district in Central London, convenient for iconic Westminster landmarks, such as the Houses of Parliament and Tate Britain Gallery.

The area is well provided for in terms of transport connections, with Victoria Station offering national mainline services including the Gatwick Express, and underground services from nearby Pimlico Station on the Victoria Line.

There are numerous renowned restaurants and boutiques locally in Denbigh Street, Churton Street and Wilton Road, as well as theatres, markets, a Curzon cinema in Victoria Street, all of which are contributing to a thriving and active local scene which is increasingly enjoyed by residents.

Coupled with the extensive redevelopment seen around Victoria and Westminster there is no question that Pimlico has been revitalized as a highly attractive and sought after residential destination with Prime Central London.

Description

This remarkable apartment really needs to be viewed to be believed. The staggering volume in the reception room is very impressive - this room leads directly onto a private south-west facing balcony and has views across St George's garden square. The refurbishment that was completed here has delicately restored some beautiful period features, whilst integrating contemporary fixtures and fittings.

The property, of approx 678 sq ft, comprises: One bedroom (with mezzanine sleeping area and storage), one bathroom, reception, kitchen, balcony and access to communal gardens.

Square Footage: 678 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 119 years remaining

address: Union Lofts, Grand Union Canal, Maida Vale W9
detailedDescription:
Garrison Estates are excited to launch a remarkable collection of 20 unique warehouse style apartments set along the banks of the Grand Union Canal in the heart of Maida Vale.

Union Lofts is positioned in the heart of West London. Maida Vale, Hyde Park, Notting Hill, Regent’s Park, Paddington and a number of other popular locations are well within 30 minutes walk. The Grand Union Canal is bursting with bustling locks, peaceful walks, areas of living history and wildlife. Alive with colourful houseboats, walkers, cycle trails, anglers and day trippers. As well as the impressive main canal, many smaller branches make great diversions if you have time to explore.
Maida Vale is a tranquil suburban district in Zone 2 just outside central London. An affluent, safe residential district well known for its peaceful and picturesque setting of wide tree lined streets, large communal gardens, beautiful Edwardian architecture and the infamous Little Venice canal on your doorstop makes this a highly sought after and desirable location.

Close by are London’s favourite Royal Parks & the city’s leading cultural experiences. Just an easy walk or ride from Union Lofts, London’s famous Royal Parks provide beauty & inspiration throughout all four seasons of the year.

Offering close proximity to Central London with excellent transport links in the vicinity, numerous restaurants, coffee shops and markets close by, it offers the perfect location for those who want to be close enough to Central London but away from the hustle and bustle.
The details


20 Brand new smart & contemporary apartments with canal views.
South facing, with the majority of the apartments enjoying either a private balcony and or terraces.

detailedDescription:
A perfect and traditional family home in the highly desirable “Moreton Triangle”, offering a wonderful village atmosphere paired with excellent transport links in the heart of Pimlico and Victoria

Located in one of Pimlico’s most sought-out areas, the “Moreton Triangle", this striking five-bedroom mid-terrace house is arranged over five storeys and offers a patio garden, a roof terrace and excellent proportions throughout.

The imposing home on Moreton Terrace showcases period features and exudes elegance and charm, which makes it perfect for family living and entertaining. There are high ceilings and moulding in the double connecting reception room and formal dining room. The quiet study overlooks the garden providing a peaceful space to work. The principal suite offers an impressive space and incorporates a beautifully appointed en-suite bathroom as well as ample storage. The lower ground floor is ideal for guests, children, or as staff accommodation, and can easily become self-contained. It has a fully modernised utility room, which can be made into an additional kitchen. The house and its unique orientation further benefits from plenty of privacy as it is not overlooked. Its outside space consists of both a separate terrace and a garden. Its position on the street provides an abundance of light and sunshine at the front and the back of the house.

Moreton Terrace is one of Pimlico's finest, most picturesque residential streets and is quietly set back from the main road. It has a fantastic village community and atmosphere. It is conveniently located within easy reach of the shopping and transport facilities of both Pimlico and Victoria. Moreton Triangle has an array of boutiques, cafes and restaurants, such as the brand-new Nova Food Court, Tachbrook Street Market & St George's Square within 15 minutes walking distance, all the while being close to Belgravia, Chelsea and Westminster. Walks along the River Thames and into the local garden squares are close by, as well as the larger green spaces of St James’ Park and Battersea Park.

detailedDescription:
We are pleased to offer for sale this 2 bedroom apartment located on the 2nd floor of this well maintained red brick Grade II listed development in the heart of the extremely popular Millbank Estate. The property is offered with vacant possession with accommodation comprising of a reception room, separate kitchen, 2 double bedrooms, bathroom and a separate WC. Internal viewing is highly recommended to capture the essence of the natural light and outlook from all of the principle rooms.

Morland House is located along Marsham Street and was named after the distinguished British painter George Morland. The building is accessed via a secure gate with keypad entry which then leads through an internal courtyard which has been decorated with plants, flowers and a seating area. The development is situated by The Tate Gallery and is only moments from the River Thames and other London attractions such as the Houses of Parliament, Big Ben and The London Eye. The transport links of St James's Park, Pimlico, Westminster and Victoria are all within walking distance. The surrounding area also offers a variety of retail stores, a Curzon Cinema following on from the extensive regeneration of Victoria street a selection of many new restaurants which include Aster, M Victoria, The Ivy Victoria, Flight Club Victoria and many more

address: Fielding Court, 28 Earlham Street, Covent Garden, London WC2H
detailedDescription:
A fantastic opportunity to purchase a penthouse flat wedged perfectly between Covent Garden and Soho in Seven Dials.
The flat is spacious (internal 2,440 sq ft) and set over two floors with 3 private roof terraces (south and west-facing) which total over 2,000 sq ft.

Entering on the fourth floor (with direct lift access), you are greeted by a bright and stylish kitchen dining area with Miele and Gaggenau appliances, 4 double bedrooms which include a large principal bedroom with en suite and its own terrace. There is also a family bathroom, separate WC, a separate utility area off the main bathroom and plenty of built-in storage. There is also the added benefit of having the most up-to-date Crestron lighting and entertainment system throughout the flat.

Going up the stairs to the fifth floor, you have a large reception area leading onto a fantastic roof terrace with views over Covent Garden and beyond.

Finally, you have a little staircase up to the sunroom where you can relax and enjoy the view.

It was once the former home of Eurythmics co-founder Dave Stewart (who commissioned the bespoke '7 Dials' entry door) and hosted some of the most famous faces in music during the 1990s and 2000s - artists including (amongst others) George Harrison, David Bowie, Madonna, Joe Strummer, Lou Reed, Damon Albarn, Sinead o'Connor, Gwen Stefani, Tracy Emin, Jeff Koons, Damien Hirst, Sam Mendes, Robbie Williams, the list goes on.

Seven Dials boasts a bustling village feel in the heart of the West End, with cobbled streets, boutique shops, popular eateries and cafes. Excellent numerous transport links and easy access to the City, make this an ideal central London location.

address: King Street, Covent Garden, London WC2E
detailedDescription:
One of Covent Garden's grandest apartments with spectacular period features and iconic south facing views over the world famous piazza

Location

Situated in the heart of the culture rich West End on a charming cobbled street, the property is perfectly positioned for the area's upmarket boutiques, restaurants, theatres, museums and hotels. Covent Garden, having benefitted from a significant investment and development programme in recent years, is now one of London's finest and most picturesque retail and restaurant neighbourhoods.

Local transport links include Covent Garden underground station (0.1 miles) and Tottenham Court Road underground station (0.5 miles).

Description

Steeped in history and grandeur, this exceptional apartment is one of the finest in Covent Garden. Having been carefully restored, the apartment has been designed to provide luxurious modern day living whilst preserving its many original period features. Occupying the entire first floor, the apartment boasts seven grand sash windows across the full width of the building's façade allowing wonderful natural light into the kitchen / dining room and two reception rooms, with south facing views over the beautiful Covent Garden piazza, including the historic St. Paul's church, which dates back to 1633 and was designed by the notable architect Inigo Jones.

The period features in the spectacular central reception room are exquisite, including Baroque plaster decoration, bolection mouldings, panelling and cornice detailing across the walls and ceiling. The spacious kitchen / dining room comes with fully integrated appliances and a beautiful feature fireplace, and there is a further reception room / study also with a feature fireplace. The impressive principal bedroom suite includes a dressing area with fitted wardrobes and en suite bathroom with a bath and separate shower. There is a further generous double bedroom with en suite bathroom, and a separate guest cloakroom. This unique apartment offers exceptional ceiling heights in excess of 4 metres and further benefits from air-conditioning.

Square Footage: 2741 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 109 years remaining

address: Hamilton Drive Development, St John's Wood, London NW8
detailedDescription:
Hamilton Drive is a stunning collection of ten newly constructed Georgian townhouses, designed and executed to an exceptional standard.

Location

Set in the heart of St John’s Wood, home to the famous Lords Cricket Ground Hamilton Drive is enviably located within close proximity of the beautiful waterways and towpaths of Little Venice, and some of London’s best open spaces, Regent’s Park and Primrose Hill. With the West End of London only five minutes’ drive, world class shopping and Michelin Star restaurants is within easy reach.

Description

Hamilton Drive is a stunning collection of ten newly constructed Georgian townhouses, designed and executed to an exceptional standard. Utilising a world class team of design professionals, including Robert Adam of adam Architects, Natalia Miyar interior design and Bradley-Hole Schoenaich landscape architecture, the result is an extraordinary and unique gated residence where privacy and security can be enjoyed within the highest quality surroundings.

Each beautifully presented Georgian style residence features grandiose interiors complemented by the latest technology throughout, private rear gardens, secure underground parking, with bespoke luxury concierge services provided by Harrods Estates.

address: Asquith House, West End Gate, Marylebone W2
detailedDescription:
A simply stunning 1 bed apartment (403 Sq. Ft. With balcony) situated in Asquith House on the 4th floor of Berkeley Home's West End Gate development.

Asquith House benefits from a sweeping vantage point over the peaceful gardens and is a place of classical tranquillity and beauty. The properties themselves are a delightful composition between elegance and precise craftsmanship, the generous and bright living spaces create a truly contemporary ambiance which offer the perfect way to entertain esteemed guests.

Bringing brand new homes to one of London's most prestigious postcodes, the development is a modern interpretation of the much loved, traditional mansion block.

A treasure trove of fine art and culture, the creative scene that surrounds West End Gate introduces ample opportunities to explore London’s historic temples of art, music and design – from the world leading Victoria & Albert Museum, to the vast Royal Albert Hall. The neighbourhood offers a window into contemporary visual culture, spotlighting pioneering artistic talent across influential spaces including the Lisson, Saatchi and Serpentine Galleries. Here, you can enjoy the arts in a deeper way and discover a rich mine of design inspiration.

Asquith House is superbly located, travel by foot can be found to Edgware Road in two minutes, Paddington in eight and Marylebone is just a further ten minute walk away. By train access can be gained to Regent's Park in four minutes, Kings Cross in nine minutes and the business hub of Canary Wharf is just a seventeen train journey away.

These particulars are not intended to form part of any contract. Photographs may be general images of the development and not be the apartment.

address: Asquith House, West End Gate, Marylebone W2
detailedDescription:
A simply stunning studio apartment (403 Sq. Ft. With balcony) situated in Asquith House on the 5th floor of Berkeley Home's West End Gate development, offering showstopping views across Regent Park, zsl Zoo, Lords Cricket Ground and beyond.

Asquith House benefits from a sweeping vantage point over the peaceful gardens and is a place of classical tranquillity and beauty. The properties themselves are a delightful composition between elegance and precise craftsmanship, the generous and bright living spaces create a truly contemporary ambiance which offer the perfect way to entertain esteemed guests.

Bringing brand new homes to one of London's most prestigious postcodes, the development is a modern interpretation of the much loved, traditional mansion block.

A treasure trove of fine art and culture, the creative scene that surrounds West End Gate introduces ample opportunities to explore London’s historic temples of art, music and design – from the world leading Victoria & Albert Museum, to the vast Royal Albert Hall. The neighbourhood offers a window into contemporary visual culture, spotlighting pioneering artistic talent across influential spaces including the Lisson, Saatchi and Serpentine Galleries. Here, you can enjoy the arts in a deeper way and discover a rich mine of design inspiration.

Asquith House is superbly located, travel by foot can be found to Edgware Road in two minutes, Paddington in eight and Marylebone is just a further ten minute walk away. By train access can be gained to Regent's Park in four minutes, Kings Cross in nine minutes and the business hub of Canary Wharf is just a seventeen train journey away.

These particulars are not intended to form part of any contract. Photographs may be general images of the development and not be the apartment.

address: Place, Great Portland Street, Marylebone W1W
detailedDescription:
Enjoy the best of modern design and refined traditions on Great Portland Street, Marlyebone with this luxury 1-bedroom apartment spread over (634 Sq. Ft.) boasting East aspect! Completions from Q3 2023.

Marylebone is renowned for its village feel. Fitzrovia weaves historic sites and contemporary charm, creating a unique urban fabric. Today, their differences are smaller but the subtleties remain. The roads that branch off Great Portland Street are home to everything from pubs to parks, florists to famous institutions; even a number of embassies are proud to call Portland Place their home away from home. Impressively individual but perfectly complementary, both areas offer central city living at its finest.

Great Portland Street station connects you to all of London’s major transport hubs – whether you’re jetting off, hopping on a train, or heading somewhere more local. Whatever you need, it’s right on your doorstep!

Modern layouts that are designed from the inside out, and with an enviable central London location, W1 Place is perfect for the discerning indivual, the professional couple and the modern family.

Modern Elegance
Light pours in through the floor-to-ceiling bay windows, creating a sense of both openness and warmth with its bright, natural limestone façade, bronze framed lantern bay windows and cast aluminium balustrades. Inspired by the disctinctive glaze of Japanese porcelain, the building's balustrades introduce both additional texture, and artistic flair and frame the windows graciously from the outside in.

W1 Place is perfect for the discerning individual, the professional couple, and the modern family. Light pours in through the floor-to-ceiling bay windows, creating a sense of both openness and warmth, while the open-plan living and kitchen areas provide a thoroughly modern space to host your friends or enjoy a cosy night in.

These particulars are not intended to form part of any contract. Photographs may depict general images of the development and may not show the actual flat for sale

detailedDescription:
AAZA Estate Agents are proud to present this truly stunning new development on Great Portland Street.
W1 Place acts as the unifying line between Marylebone and Fitzrovia, two vibrant neighbourhoods filled with striking architecture and an abundance of cafés, pubs, bars and eateries and with the beautiful Regents park moments away.
Connected between Oxford Street and Euston Road, Great Portland Street is at the heart of these two historic districts, indeed London itself. Great Portland Street station, which connects you to London's significant hubs, is a short walk away.
Completion date from Q3 2023.
This thoughtfully designed building is a welcome addition to the storied street and reflects the best of both areas while remaining authentic and unique. With spacious apartments, curated retail, and a prime location, you are perfectly placed to enjoy all that London has to offer.

detailedDescription:
A unique and vast three bedroom apartment with stunning wraparound private roof terrace.

Location

Overlooking Battersea Park, Vista at Chelsea Bridge Wharf is fantastically located for the green open space of Battersea Park with the river beyond.

Chelsea is just a short trip over the bridge with the popular Kings Road and Sloane Square walking distance away. The development has easy access to transport links with Battersea Park and Queenstown Road stations just 0.2 and 0.3 miles away offering direct links to Waterloo and Victoria stations.

Description

This stylish penthouse apartment within the boutique development, Vista at Chelsea Bridge Wharf. The apartment offers 1,891ft of accommodation comprising three bedrooms, three bathrooms, a large open plan kitchen/reception room and a spectacular wraparound terrace. The large reception room is flooded with natural light due to wall of floor to ceiling windows, allowing for the sunshine all afternoon. Doors open on to an exceptionally large terrace offering beautiful uninterrupted views of Battersea Park and London Skyline. The integrated kitchen provides a good range of wall and base level units with built in appliances and a breakfast bar. The principal bedroom offers access to the private balcony, integrated dressing room and luxurious en-suite bathroom. communal gardens.

detailedDescription:
Introducing a contemporary 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment with N & W facing balcony, situated within the brand new 12 Elgin Avenue W9, located in Zone 2.

12 Elgin Avenue is a 4 storey building offering a luxury residential of 15 apartments. Contemporary living at its very best, the apartments are finished to the highest specification. Light and spacious kitchens, bright and elegant bathrooms and stylish and modern open-plan living areas, making 12 Elgin Avenue apartments the ideal place to live.

Features include engineered oak flooring to lounges and hallways, wool carpets to all bedrooms, porcelain tiles, and white gloss Italian kitchens or similar, saving recessed lighting in the kitchen, bathrooms and lounges.

Located on the south side of Elgin Avenue, the principle road which runs from Maida Vale to the Harrow Road. The property is situated 0.75 miles from the amenities of Maida Vale with its many shops, bars and restaurants. It is 1km from the green open spaces of Paddington recreation ground and the canal walks of Little Venice. Further benefiting from the amenities of Westbourne Park and the famous Portobello Road.

Nearby travel options include Westbourne Park Tube station (Circle and Hammersmith and City lines), Maida Vale Tube station (Bakerloo Line) plus frequent buses on tfl network.

Images are of show apartment and for example/illustration only.
