detailedDescription:
An exceptional three bedroom apartment

Location

Located in the heart of Westminster, SW1P, it is ideally positioned for proximity to the Tate Britain, the University of Arts, the Houses of Parliament, and Westminster Abbey. Pimlico Underground station just 0.3 miles away, offering easy access into Central London via the Victoria Line.

Description

This exclusive apartment is situated on the 7th floor of Riverwalk, the prestigious riverside development by Ronson Capital Partners. Finished to an exacting standard throughout, it offers an open plan reception room and state of the art Boffi kitchen with integrated Miele and Gaggenau appliances. The sunny South-East facing balcony enjoys East & West panoramic views of the River Thames and of the sis building, headquarters for the secret intelligence service, famous for featuring in the modern Bond films. The principal double bedroom, fit for 007 them self, is complete with a stunning built in dressing room and a luxurious en-suite bathroom. There are two further double bedrooms with built in wardrobes and appointed en suite bath/shower rooms. The apartment is fitted with Crestron lighting and home automation system, comfort cooling and underfloor heating. Residents of Riverwalk will benefit from excellent 24 hour security and Harrods
concierge service, as well as an onsite gymnasium and yoga studio overlooking the river.

*These photos were taken in 2019*

Square Footage: 1925 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 995 years remaining

An exceptional four bedroom top floor apartment, located on the fourth floor (with lift) and forming part of this beautiful Grade II listed building.

This impressive apartment’s reception room and outside space overlooks one of London’s finest garden squares. This property also offers exceptional space to include a bright and spacious 28’11 x 20’5 reception room/ kitchen. In addition, there are four bedrooms, an ensuite shower room and an additional family bathroom. With great natural light, access to beautiful communal gardens and super smart and well maintained internal common areas, this apartment is well worth an internal viewing.

The apartment is ideally situated for the many shops and restaurants of fashionable Westbourne Grove. detailedDescription:
This prestigious three bedroom front to back apartment, set within the most popular local development, 9 Millbank, is available for reassignment sale through Prime London.

Set facing both the tranquil landscaped gardens and front of the development, this is the ideal three bedroom apartment within the development as you benefit from both the bay window and gardens. The spacious reception room benefits from the heritage of the building, but with the hight of modern elegance, and the open plan kitchen with Küppersbusch appliances and expertly crafted finishes complete the space.
Two of the three double bedrooms are set at the rear of the property and enjoy views over the peaceful, private landscaped garden. The main bedroom set at the front of the property also features a large walk-in wardrobe. All bedrooms are finished in a warm neutral palette to create a calm retreat where you can relax and rejuvenate. The property also benefits from having three bathrooms, two of which is en-suite.

For residents’ comfort, all properties in 9 Millbank have underfloor heating throughout, and comfort cooling to all reception rooms and bedrooms.

Leisure facilities exclusive to the residents at 9 Millbank include a 24-hour concierge, a state-of-the-art gym, luxurious swimming pool with spa and treatment room, private cinema screening room, meeting rooms, and landscaped gardens.

Standing proudly on the banks of the river Thames, in the beating heart of historic Westminster, 9 Millbank encapsulates British luxury and style. Now a Grade II listed building, Millbank Residences’ grandeur still stands tall in Westminster’s iconic skyline.

*Images are computer generated, and are only intended to show the example specification of the finishes throughout.

address: Queen Anne's Gate, St. James's Park, London SW1H
detailedDescription:
An exceptional and rarely available seven bedroom property of grand proportions and fantastic views over Horse Guards Parade and St James’s Park located moments from Buckingham Palace. At just over 11,600 square feet, it is currently one of the largest residential properties available on the open market in Prime Central London. This listed property is arranged over three floors with its grand private double door entrance leading onto an inviting stone pillar lined entrance hall and further comprises a magnificent 40” ball room, 66” reception room, a further reception room and library, seven bathrooms, large kitchen and laundry/utility room. This luxury residence has numerous features including a grand spiralling staircase, a number of fireplaces, private lift, use of daytime porter and exclusive use of private courtyard and garden accessed directly from the property.

Queen Anne’s Gate runs parallel to Birdcage Walk with the tranquil green open spaces of St James’s Park immediately behind. The street is within a conservation area with a number of listing buildings renowned for their heritage and elegance and the central location allows for easy access to some of London’s most famous landmarks including The Houses of Parliament, Buckingham Palace, Tate Britain and West End’s Theatre Land. There are a number of cafes, bars and restaurants in and around the continuously redeveloped Victoria Street as well as a number of excellent transport links including St James’s Park underground station (Circle and District lines) and Victoria (Victoria, Circle and District underground lines, Mainline Station and Gatwick Express).

detailedDescription:
Fantastic 3-bedroom penthouse apartment located at an elegant residential building (with concierge) just opposite Grosvenor Square Garden. The property can be accessed on the third floor (via lift) and features a beautiful reception room with wood flooring, semi open plan kitchen with integrated appliances and bespoke worktops and a great breakfast table. The four large windows create a great natural light feel throughout.

The spacious hallway connecting the front of the property to the rear bedrooms benefits from a utility cupboard, guest WC and access to the large rooftop terrace with views over Mayfair. The main bedroom benefits from generous proportions, fitted wardrobes and luxury marble finished bathroom with freestanding bath and walk in shower. The second bedroom is also a great size with fitted wardrobes and en suite shower room.

This property boasts a private underground parking spot as well as a separate studio apartment (3rd bedroom) with kitchen and a shower room.

Grosvenor Square is a world-famous central location in the heart of Mayfair and is moments away from London's best shops and restaurants as well as nearby Hyde Park, Oxford Street and Bond Street Tube Station.

detailedDescription:
Classic and inviting neo-Georgian architecture meets the finest interior design, modern and chic with a charming feel and set on one of the most exclusive roads within one of the most exclusive postcodes in London.

This beautiful home is set over five floors of luxurious and generously proportioned accommodation in excess of 12,400 sq ft. The south-facing front leads you to a reception room and dining area following on to a contemporary kitchen with integrated state of the art appliances looking out onto the beautifully landscaped gardens.

The lower ground floor is home to extensive entertaining space including a home cinema with a 120" acoustically transparent fixed screen and a Crestron digital media high-definition video distribution system. There is also a 14-metre heated indoor swimming pool that bathes in natural light. The pool area also boasts a spa pool and elegant lounge area with low mood lighting.

The fully-equipped gym features Kenesis and Technogym equipment as well as a giant HD screen and integrated audio systems.

The bedrooms are nothing short of luxury with the master bedroom suite featuring his and hers dressing rooms and en-suite bathrooms encompassing the entire first floor leading to its own private roof terrace.

There are extensive staff quarters with own kitchen and bathroom facilities.

Off street parking by way of 266 sq ft garage and carriage driveway.

detailedDescription:
Set on the fourth floor (with lift-access), in an impeccably maintained modern development in the heart of Westminster near Victoria and Pimlico. This fantastic property comprises a large open-plan kitchen/living area, a large double bedroom with ample storage and a contemporary bathroom. The property allows light to flood in with views of Westminster Cathedral!

Rochester Row is fantastically located within the heart of Westminster and right next to the charm and character of Pimlico, offering everything from bars, restaurants, pubs and hairdressers to Sainsbury’s, Waitrose and Tesco for your convenience. The property backs onto the famous Vincent Square allowing a rare slice of nature and greenery. The exciting, developing area of Victoria is right around the corner with its ever growing collection of amenities including the popular Victoria Street with some of London’s best dining options.

Local sights include Westminster Cathedral, Parliament Square, Whitehall, Buckingham Palace and St. James’s Park. The nightlife and energy of London’s theatre land is just a 20 minute walk away or easily accessed via Bus (24). Transport links are found with Victoria Station (District, Circle and Victoria Lines as well as National Rail Services and the Gatwick Express), St. James’s Park (District and Circle Lines) and Westminster (District, Circle and Jubilee Lines) all within walking distance.

detailedDescription:
A contemporary, lateral warehouse apartment comprising 1,177 Sq Ft across the first floor, presented in excellent order making an ideal purchase for anyone looking to live within a quiet district of the West End. This central location is ideal for commuting throughout The City during the day, offering an enviable position of an evening with a vast array of culture, art and entertainment within walking distance.

A grand communal entrance includes the concierge’s office with the lift providing direct access into the apartment. The entrance hall serves each of the rooms with two generous double bedrooms and two bathrooms (one en-suite to the principle bedroom). A large semi-open plan living space boasts a West facing aspect to the rear, an ideal entertaining space with ample room for living and dining without the kitchen encroaching on the living space.

With neutral décor throughout, washed oak hardwood flooring, high ceilings and integrated appliances this property present a ‘turn-key’ option, perfect for anyone seeking a Pied A Terre of London home without the hassle.

Situation
Kean Street is named after Sir Edmunds Kean (1787-1833) who was considered to be the greatest Shakespearean actor of his day and is discreetly located just off Drury Lane, tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Covent Garden. Straddling both The City and the West End, this superb location offers excellent access to The Piazza, Theatreland, The Legal Quarter, lse and King’s Universities as well as The Delaunay, Balthazar, Somerset House and The Royal Opera House.

Local transport links include Temple for the Circle and District lines, Covent Garden (0.4 miles) for the Piccadilly line and Holborn station (0.3 miles) for the Central and Piccadilly lines.

The property is located on the fourth floor (with lift) of a highly prestigious Georgian building, and offers exclusive residents-only access to a spectacular landscaped garden. The stylish interior has been maintained to the highest of standards and offers well balanced family accommodation in a peaceful setting.

Hyde Park Gardens is a monumental terrace of grand, stucco-faced town houses in W2, dating back to 1836, and designed by architect John Crake. Their principal front is to the south, facing landscaped gardens and overlooking Hyde Park. The terrace has been designated a grade II listed building by English heritage and lies within the Bayswater conservation area.

Located within close proximity of Lancaster Gate and Paddington Stations. The numerous cafés, restaurants and boutique outlets of Connaught Village are also within walking distance.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A well proportioned one bedroom flat on the ground floor of this period stucco fronted building located in the Pimilco 'Grid'.

The bedroom boasts a large window and additional sky light which illuminates this room with wonderful morning sunlight, ample built in storage from wall cupboards over the bed and tall wardrobes. The reception room has wonderful high ceilings, gas fireplace (not tested) and gets the afternoon sun, The separate fully fitted kitchen offers a sizable work surface with granite work tops, breakfast bar and room for a proper fridge freezer. Further there is a cleverly designed bathroom, again with a healthy amount of storage and yet more storage is provided by a under stair cupboard.

The property is situated on the southern section of Gloucester Street and as such is close to local shops, popular restaurants and the Tachbrook Street market. Transport links of both Pimlico underground and Victoria underground and mainline stations are within easy walking distance.

The terrace houses on Gloucester Street were built from c.1848 onwards and designed by Thomas Cubitt who was the prolific Victorian master builder responsible for creating Pimlico, most of Belgravia and the east front of Buckingham Palace. As with much of Cubitt's work, the original Gloucester Street houses are built in the classical style out of brick overlaid with the stucco rendering that is so recognisable.

address: Park Place, St James's, London SW1A
detailedDescription:
An immaculate town house located in the heart of St James's, which seamlessly blends contemporary design, luxurious materials and unique charm, all set behind a striking black brick façade.

Location

Park Place is a discreet cul de sac situated in the heart of St James's, just off St James's Street. The property is closely located to a selection of London's finest restaurants, private members' clubs and internationally renowned shops. Famous destinations such as St James's Palace, Bond Street, The Burlington Arcade and Fortnum & Mason are a short walk away, as are the green open spaces of St James's Park and Green Park.

Many of London's finest and most illustrious establishments are to be found within St James's. With a quintessentially British charm and a heritage stretching back over 4 centuries, this refined area offers the finest craftsmanship, elite brands and an unparalleled commitment to quality, luxury and style.

The property benefits from excellent transport links including Green Park tube station (0.2 miles) for the Jubilee, Piccadilly and Victoria lines. (all distances are approximate)

Description

This prestigious residence has been finished to an exceptional standard, using the finest of materials, bespoke finishes and luxurious furnishings. There is an abundance of impressive features, including a stunning staircase which runs through the heart of the house, a fabulous clubroom, cinema, spa, sky lounge with retractable roof and a 5 person lift to all floors.

The audio visual installation at 12 Park Place incorporates the very latest in whole-home automation and smart home integration. The house benefits from a prestigious high-end control system from leading manufacturer Crestron. This includes lighting, audio and TV distribution, heating and ventilation, door entry, and CCTV. There is also a state-of-the-art cinema room, fitted with equipment by high-end manufacturers such as jvc, Bowers & Wilkins and Oppo, and air conditioning throughout.

Square Footage: 8356 sq ft

title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This stucco-fronted townhouse may be steeped in Notting Hill’s grand architectural heritage but spread across its third and fourth floors, this three-bedroom duplex is undeniably modern. Stained oak floors, steel girders and exposed brick walls lend an industrial flavour to the interiors. The expansive open plan reception on the lower floor channels natural light between the north and south facing windows, carefully zoned into kitchen, dining and sitting areas. Fitted tessellated shelving spans one side of the room, while the matt copper and black granite kitchen, with its sleek integrated appliances and discreet cabinetry blends in seamlessly. Tucked away to the back of this floor, past a shower room, you’ll find a guest double-bedroom.

Upstairs, a second reception room with bare brick walls and exposed beams provides a more intimate space for socialising, serviced by its own kitchen and a skylight that floods this space with natural light. On this floor, the master suite sits at the back of the property, accessed via a skylit en suite with generous double vanity. A second guest bedroom and family bathroom share the floor, together with fitted storage cupboards that keep the space clutter-free.

An impressive industrial-style staircase leads up to the roof terrace – a wonderfully large space which rises and falls with stepped decking and seating areas, glass balustrades and topiary that zones the space for intimate gatherings. From here, west London’s wide skies are uninterrupted.

Linden Gardens is a pretty and desirable tree lined enclave, located close by Notting Hill Gate. The independent shops and vintage stalls of Portobello Road are within a five-minute walk north, and Notting Hill's clusters of restaurants and bars: Take your pick of Granger and Co, Jusu Brothers and Daylesford for lunch. Linden Gardens is also blessed with the vast open space of Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park on its doorstep, when a breather from the bustle of city life beckons. The well-connected Notting Hill Gate station [Central, Cirle & District] offers links to the rest of the city.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Occupying two floors of this imposing period building, this generously proportioned three bedroom, two bathroom duplex apartment offers a level of space rarely available in Covent Garden.

Buckingham St is an oasis of calm located between Embankment Gardens and The Strand. The apartment is entered through a grand private entrance from the street. The upper floor is made up of a spacious entrance hall leading to a well-proportioned reception room which is perfect for entertaining. There is a good feeling of light and space as the ceilings are very high and the room benefits from large west facing sash windows. Other period features include feature fireplaces and wooden floors. There is a well equipped kitchen which has ample space for family dining. There is also a guest cloakroom conveniently located on this floor.

The spacious lower level has three bedrooms and two bathrooms. This apartment benefits from a large amount of well-planned storage which includes a large space under the stairs which would be perfect for luggage.

Buckingham Street is peaceful residential location made up of beautiful period buildings, many of which date back to the 1660's. Being a no-through road there is very little traffic noise and the river Thames and Embankment Gardens are at the end of the street. Covent Garden's bustling Piazza is within easy reach (as well as its tube station) and along with it the many dining and retail attractions of the West End. Countless restaurants, boutiques, luxury retailers, coffee shops, bars, clubs and more are to hand, not to mention the excellent transport links from nearby Charring Cross and Embankment stations.

The apartment benefits from residents parking and there is secure underground parking that can be negotiated separately.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This bright two-bedroom apartment lies on the second floor of a handsome building on Randolph Crescent, a quiet, tree-lined street in the heart of Little Venice, Maida Vale. Creatively reconfigured and refurbished by Openstudio Architects, the apartment extends over 915 sq ft and offers an open-plan layout of versatile living spaces. It has access to immaculate and peaceful communal gardens and is minutes away from Regent’s Canal.

The Tour

The houses on Randolph Crescent are characterised by their well-proportioned brickwork, white stucco-fronted porticos and bays, generous sash windows and black and white chequerboard-tiled entranceways. A striking pillar-box red panelled door, with a crowning fanlight overhead, gives access to the shared hallway and stairway of this apartment.

The apartment unfolds in an exploration of linear forms and spatial manipulation, offering flexible living and plenty of opportunities for adaptability. There is a sense of contemporary sophistication throughout, aided in part by the cohesive flow of interior spaces, which come together in an exacting mix of light, materials, colour and detail.

The layout of the apartment is wonderfully open, with each room looking through to the adjacent rooms. Interior walls have been cleverly arranged so as not to touch the exterior walls, allowing an excellent flow of light throughout. The living area is illuminated by sunlight and has leafy garden views, with defined areas for relaxing, working and eating. A magnificent full-height, teak veneered sliding door separates it from the beautifully detailed kitchen.

The two bedrooms overlook the treetops of Randolph Crescent and have expansive views over the tree-lined street. The main bedroom, replete with a wall of floor-to-ceiling storage, overlooks a lovely, plant-filled balcony. The second bedroom, awash with sunlight, is lined with shelving and further storage.

The generously sized bathroom can be accessed from either the hallway or the main bedroom. Its detailing is restrained and minimal, the muted grey glass mosaic tiling adding a hint of sparkle. Utility facilities are neatly located along the hallway, along with additional cloakroom storage.

Outdoor Space

Mature communal gardens lie at the rear of the house, accessed via a secure gate located at the end of Randolph Crescent. The gardens are laid to lawn, with mature shrubs and several seating areas, and are incredibly tranquil. Shade-giving trees are dotted all around, creating ideal spots for an afternoon of reading or an evening picnic. Local residents also gather in the gardens to enjoy community events.

The Area

Randolph Crescent is brilliantly located in Little Venice, Maida Vale; a thriving neighbourhood awash with cafes, bars and restaurants, as well as an Everyman cinema. Clifton Road is close by and has a number of independent boutiques and delis.

Regent’s Canal is a just short stroll away, a gateway to the rest of London and a lovely spot for a coffee at the Waterside Cafe, lunch on one of the many barge restaurants, such as Darcie & May Green, dinner at Summer House or an alfresco drink at Pergola Paddington. Other dining delights include delicious fare at Kateh and Maguro, a wonderful local Japanese restaurant off Clifton Road. The green open space of Paddington Recreation Ground is a three-minute walk away, and Westbourne Park and Notting Hill are a short distance to the south across the canal. Golborne Road and Portobello Road are also easily accessible. Less than a mile away are Kensington Gardens, Hyde Park and Regent’s Park. Lord’s Cricket Ground is also within easy reach.

There are plenty of transport options locally. The nearest Underground stations are Warwick Avenue, a three-minute walk away and Maida Vale, which is a five-minute walk away (both Bakerloo line), while St Johns Wood (Jubilee Line) is within easy walking distance to the northeast. The Westway provides access out of London and towards Heathrow Airport; Heathrow can also be reached within 15 minutes on the Heathrow Express, which runs regularly from Paddington.

Tenure: Leasehold (Share of Freehold)
Lease length: Approx. 85 years remaining (lease expires 2106)
Service Charge: Approx. £2,000 per annum
Ground Rent: Approx. N/A

detailedDescription:
A magnificent two-bedroom duplex apartment, set in a small Georgian building located on Mayfair's exclusive Park Street. This property has undergone an impressive refurbishment whilst still retaining its original features, featuring a colour scheme of 'eggshell cloud white' walls paired with dark solid French polished wood flooring.

The ground floor presents a grand reception room complimented with high ceilings, two large bay windows that look out onto Park Street and a Japanese style terrace paved with large grey marble slabs. The room also boasts the famous open plan 'Ghost Kitchen' by Fendi, including top of the range appliances from Gaggenau, which can be closed off with a large library of handmade solid Ebony Wood. A beautiful wooden staircase with floor lighting leads to the lower ground floor which comprises a floor to ceiling Carrara marble cloakroom. A double bedroom which features an en-suite bathroom, dressing area and glass doors that open onto a small patio which allows natural light to flow throughout. The principal bedroom features a spacious walk-in wardrobe and a large luxury spa inspired bathroom also panelled with Carrara marble. The apartment benefits from home automation, Lutron lighting, air conditioning, and underfloor heating in all marble flooring.

Park Street is located between London's Grosvenor Square and Park Lane and is excellently positioned for access to the World class restaurants and shops of Mayfair.

Resident's off-street parking permits can be applied for through Westminster City Council website, subject to approval.

An exquisite three bedroom lateral apartment newly renovated to an exceptionally high standard, offering sleek and spacious interiors that incorporate the latest in modern technology.

address: Falmouth House, Hyde Park, London W2
detailedDescription:
Offered in impeccable condition throughout this super two bedroom flat extends to almost 1,400 sq ft and is located on the third floor (with lift) of a sought-after block ideally overlooking Hyde Park. Originally a three bed flat, the current owners have reconfigured the internal layout to offer an indulgent two bedroom apartment with a superb walk-in dressing room for the master suite.

Accommodation briefly comprises; central entrance hallway with storage leading to a modern kitchen and a generous reception room, both of which benefit from direct views of Hyde Park. From the reception room is granted access to a large south-facing balcony. There are two double bedrooms (with walk-in dressing room and en-suite to master) and a further bathroom.

The property benefits from contemporary finishes throughout, an innovative lighting system, air conditioning and a share of the freehold.

Transport links from Lancaster Gate and Marble Arch tube stations are located close by and afford easy access to the City, West End and Canary Wharf. There are superb shopping and dining opportunities in the area and the boutiques of Oxford Street and Mayfair are within easy walking distance. Hyde Park itself offers a wealth of sporting facilities including tennis, cycle paths and horse riding.

Offered with a share of the freehold.

A well-proportioned three bedroom apartment situated on the first floor of this highly regarded landmark development on the Strand.

Location

190 Strand is in an area of central London internationally acknowledged as the Capital's theatre and cultural heartland close to the River Thames.

190 Strand overlooks Sir Christopher Wren's Grade i-listed St Clement Danes church, and is flanked by the Courtauld Gallery, Somerset House and two of the world's finest universities - King's College and the London School of Economics & Political Science.

Local transport links include Temple underground station (0.1 miles) for the Circle and District lines and Covent Garden (0.6 mile) for the Piccadilly line. All distances are approximate.

Description

This wonderful first floor apartment offers brilliant entertaining space with a bright and spacious open-plan kitchen/reception room, complete with integrated appliances, breakfast bar and fireplace feature. The principle bedroom includes an en suite bath/shower room and boasts superb storage with a walk in wardrobe. There are two further bedrooms, one with an en suite bathroom, a separate shower room and a utility room.

190 Strand is a flagship development by St Edward, and offers a fantastic range of lifestyle amenities to residents, including 24 hour concierge, luxurious swimming pool and spa, gym, cinema and secure underground parking.

Square Footage: 1537 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 990 years remaining

detailedDescription:
A south facing 3 bed-3 bath 1721 sqft new build lateral penthouse located on one of London's most prestigious garden squares, Gloucester Square.

The newly constructed penthouse has direct lift access, 6 French doors which open onto a south facing terrace which stretches the length of the apartment (14.17 m), kitchen with Quooker tap and Miele appliances from which there is access to the rear terrace, 6 skylights overhead ensuring the property is naturally well lit throughout, air-conditioning, bespoke fitted joinery and ironmongery throughout, powered remote control blinds and an audio-visual package with Sonos Surround Sound.

The apartments 3 bedrooms are all doubles with the master and second bedroom both being ensuite. The master bedroom has a walk-in wardrobe and access to the front terrace.

Gloucester Square is just north of Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens, two of London's best parks. Oxford Street, Marylebone, Portman Village and the boutique shops and restaurants of Connaught Street are also nearby.

Marble Arch (Central Line) and Paddington (Heathrow Express, National Rail, Circle, District, Bakerloo, Elizabeth Line and Hammersmith & City Lines) stations are within a few minutes' walk of the property, providing convenient access to all parts of London and beyond.

detailedDescription:
A impressive townhouse in the heart of Belgravia. This six bedroom home situated in between Eaton Square and Belgrave Square has close to 4500sqft of internal space spread over 6 floors with the benefit of a great size passenger lift and air conditioning.

The raised ground floor has a beautiful new kitchen with large island, solid stone counter tops, integrated appliances and a pantry cupboard, This space is also open to a large dining area with more built in storage that leads through to a snug Tv area over looking the terrace garden to the rear.

The lower floor has an excellent garden summer room and bar with bi folding doors that open out on to the terrace area which has also been finished immaculately with fireplace and panelled fencing and excellent lighting. This floor also has a cinema room, wine room and guest / staff suite,

The first floor is home to an elegant reception room that is front to back with high ceilings, two fire places, a front balcony and rear terrace with solid wood chevron flooring along with the large windows this is a very bright and airy room that is perfect for entertaining.

The second floor is where you can find the impressive master bedroom with huge amounts of inbuilt storage, its own large bathroom suite with freestanding bath, walk in shower, his and hers sinks and finished with breath-taking marble.

The fourth and fifth floor hold four more bedrooms, both of the fourth floor rooms have en suite bathrooms whilst the top floor shares a jack and Jill bathroom.

The current owner totally remodelled and refurbished this property from top to bottom and has made it a perfect modern period town house in the most ideal location with plenty of restaurants and shops almost on your doorstep.

detailedDescription:
Situated on the Hyde Park Estate this south facing, high specification new build penthouse with direct lift access and exceptional outside space is constructed atop two beautiful newly restored white-stucco buildings on a prestigious garden square near Hyde Park. With astonishing views to the front and rear, this unique lateral property has plenty of natural light with French-style doors spanning the entire frontage of both buildings providing access to the main terrace, with numerous skylights overhead and large feature sash-windows to the rear with access to a second roof terrace. The penthouses high specification features include air-conditioning, underfloor heating, two large retractable skylights, remote control blinds and a Sonos surround sound audio/visual package. The accommodation is well balanced with an exceptional open-plan front-to-back reception with high-end kitchen, three spacious bedrooms, three bathrooms and a study area. The principal bedroom suite has a separate dressing area and overlooks the charming communal gardens of Gloucester Square, to which the penthouse enjoys access.

Gloucester Square is conveniently located close to Lancaster Gate Underground (Central Line) and Paddington Mainline (Network Rail and Heathrow Express) and underground (Hammersmith & City, District, Circle, Bakerloo lines and new Elizabeth Line stations) are also within close proximity. The open spaces of Hyde Park are also close by.

detailedDescription:
This fabulous two bedroom duplex apartment has been recently refurbished to an impeccable standard. The property is located on Bedford St, a sought after central Covent Garden address.

The lower level has a sleek open plan kitchen reception which is perfect for entertaining. There are large west facing sash windows, wooden floors and very high ceilings.

A feature staircase leads to a large double bedroom with vaulted ceilings and plentiful storage. A good sized second bedroom has a beautiful period fire place. Bedrooms are served by a luxurious shower room which has a bright modern feel.

The apartment is accessed through a secure gate on Exchange Court.

Covent Garden is globally recognised as London's premier cultural, retail, leisure & entertainment destination. Notable restaurants include Balthazar, The Ivy Market Grill and Sushi Samba, as well as the much lauded Frenchie, Oystermen, Cora Pearl and Taiwan's legendary Din Tai Fung. The Henrietta Hotel has a fantastic cocktail bar & restaurant, with nearby Floral Court providing a tranquil oasis with fantastic al-fresco dining at Petersham Nurseries La Goccia and The Petersham.

High end fashion & beauty retailers rub shoulders including Tom Ford, Gucci, Tiffany & Co, Aesop, Polo Ralph Lauren, London's flagship Apple Store and Paul Smith's eponymous boutique on nearby Floral Street.

The Royal Opera House dominates the piazza with world renowned residents the Royal Ballet & Royal Opera, plus many of the world's most popular stage shows can be found at the numerous theatres within a few minutes walk. Hidden away between Henrietta Street & King Street is the quiet public space of St. Paul's Church gardens, providing the perfect antidote to the hustle & bustle of the Piazza, with the open space of Embankment Gardens and the river Thames only a short stroll across the strand, and the Southbank just a short trip across the river via either Waterloo or Hungerford Bridge.

Period features.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
The grandeur of Notting Hill’s exclusive architectural pedigree. The design sensibility of a 21st-century home. This lofty two-bedroom apartment has been taken back to the drawing board. Enter on the third floor, where an open-plan kitchen and reception room is united by ashen floors, neutral tones and bright light – an open archway channels the sun from the dual-aspect windows. The kitchen is streamlined – ergonomic and polished – with clean-lined marble countertops and integrated, high-spec appliances. There’s room for a dining table beneath the low-slung chandeliers. Understated style continues to quietly impress in the formal reception area with its high ceilings, very social layout and vast windows that make the most of its third-storey vantage point. A balcony is accessed from the hallway, where leafy trees create a curtain of privacy. Two bedrooms are carved into the gabled eaves of this period property – one with an en suite. Considerately placed widows catch the glow of the sunset in the master. It’s a peaceful affair with built-in storage that keeps it clutter-free. It’s served by a fuss-free bathroom with a curved shower and marble tiling. A further bedroom has access to a second balcony and shares a family bathroom. Wake up to chimney-top views, here.

A wide, tree-lined street of stucco-fronted townhouses with portico entrances – some of the most handsome architecture in Notting Hill – sets the scene for Durham Terrace. Spend days dipping between the boutiques of Westbourne Grove and strolling along the Grand Union Canal. Stride out and reach Portobello Market in 15 or Hyde Park in 20.<br /><br />

Sole Agent: Approached via its own private entrance, this bright, immaculately presented, three bedroom duplex garden apartment, spanning approximately 1715 sq ft / 158 sq m, (including summer house/office), set on the raised ground and garden levels of a red brick Victorian conversion on this popular tree lined avenue in Maida Vale.
The apartment, further comprises a 40 ft open plan kitchen/reception/dining room, leading directly onto an exceptional 75ft south facing landscaped private garden, which has the rare benefit of a superb summer house/ office at the end of the garden.
Further benefits include, a family bathroom, an en-suite shower room, high ceilings, wooden floors, utility room, an abundance of useful storage throughout and a share of freehold.

The apartment also has the benefit of planning permission for a single storey rear extension. (Plans available upon request).

Elgin Avenue has easy access to the shops and restaurants of Maida Vale, Little Venice and Notting Hill, as well as Paddington Recreation Ground, Paddington Train Station and both Warwick Avenue and Maida Vale Underground Stations (Bakerloo Line).

detailedDescription: A spacious three bedroom, three bathroom apartment (1300 sq ft / 120 sq m) situated on the ground floor of this well maintained mansion block set behind a carriage driveway. The property is well presented and comprises entrance hallway, three double bedrooms, two en suites and a further family bathroom, large reception/dining room and separate fully-fitted kitchen. Rodney Court benefits from 24-hour porterage, passenger lift and is ideally located only a short walk from the fantastic array of local amenities in Clifton Road and St Johns Wood. It also benefits from excellent transport links nearby at Warwick Avenue (Bakerloo line) and St John's Wood (Jubilee line) underground stations and Paddington Station with its national and international connections.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautiful three-bedroom new build mews house is situated within a brand-new development in the thriving community of Westbourne Park. The property is arranged over two floors, comprising of three well-proportioned double bedrooms, three bathrooms, one of them being an en-suite to the principal bedroom and an open plan living and dining area. The open plan living space is coupled with a bespoke fitted kitchen with integrated appliances designed by Miele and bosch as well as kitchen cabinetry supplied by Wilson Fink. This unique mews house has been meticulously designed to provide residents with a luxury home of the highest specification. The living areas of the house are complimented with underfloor heating and comfort cooling throughout, engineered timber flooring in the living, dining and hallway areas, and remote-controlled LED mood lighting in the kitchen and bathroom.
Measuring at approximately 1,407sqft, the house further benefits from a private patio garden and floor-to-ceiling windows throughout, filling the house with an abundance of natural light.
The Brick development is located in one of London's most desirable neighbourhoods, a stone throw away from Notting Hill, Portobello Road, Westbourne Grove and some of West London's most classic and established destinations, including Portobello Road Market, the Electric Cinema and the popular Notting Hill Fish Shop.

Notice
Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

detailedDescription:
A stunning 3 double bedroom 7th floor flat of approx. 1211 sq.ft (112.5 sq.m), located in the heart of Westminster and only moments from the River Thames, Houses of Parliament and Buckingham Palace. This bright and spacious apartment further comprises of an open plan reception room, fitted wardrobes to all bedrooms, two luxury bathrooms (1 en-suite) and 2 balconies with views of the historic St Johns Gardens. Further benefits include lift access to all floors, the use of a 24 hour concierge, underfloor heating through-out, air-cooling, superfast broadband (up to 1 gigabit) and a fully equipped fitness suite as well as access to an attractive landscaped courtyard garden and allocated secure underground parking.

The Courthouse benefits from fantastic Westminster location, being only short walk from St James' Park (District and Circle lines) and Westminster (Jubilee, District and Circle lines) underground stations, as well as Victoria mainline and underground station (Victoria, District and Circle lines). There is a great selection of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants on Victoria Street and the surrounding area.

Ideal to live in, as a pied-a-terre or as short and long term rental investment. Crossrail, West End Project & The Post Building are only some of the new developments which make this property very desirable.

This spacious first-floor property features a large, well-proportioned living area, semi open-plan kitchen, laundry room/wardrobe, 2 good size bedrooms with fitted wardrobes and a good size bathroom.
Possibility to conver laundry room into second bathroom, as plumbing is already in place.
Very long Lease (over 900 years) and low service charge, compared to most properties in the area. The property faces the quiet rear of the building and is within a 5-minute walk to Tottenham Court Road, Covent Garden and Holborn tube stations.

detailedDescription:
A stunning and beautifully presented four-five bedroom house, occupying approximately 2,280 square feet moments from Kensington Gardens.

Four years in the making, no compromises have been made in the design and specification of this newly built house. In collaboration with renowned interior designer Giacomo Rossetti and his expert team, the house has been custom designed to maximise the available space and light, combining the elements of luxury and personal space.

The house is uniquely positioned where Kensington meets Notting Hill and a stone’s throw from Kensington Palace. This quiet residential road, lined by trees and redbrick buildings, is in one of the most sought-after areas of London within walking distance to Kensington Gardens.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Exquisite two bedroom apartment with private patio in a stylish boutique development with concierge.

Location

33 Greycoat Street corners Greycoat Street and Rochester Row, between the renowned locations of Victoria Street and Vincent Square. It is just 0.2 miles (approx.) to St. James Park station.

Victoria Street has seen a significate transformation in recent years following a £4billion development of Victoria and now offers an array of high quality lifestyle brands from the likes of Jason Atherton, Jamie Oliver, Hugo Boss, Jo Malone and Vidal Sassoon.

The iconic world landmarks such as Houses of Parliament, Buckingham Palace and Westminster Abbey and Cathedral are all close by as is beautiful and tranquil St James Park, there is also a Curzon Cinema, and Andrew Lloyd Webbers recently acquired 'Other Palace' Theatre.

Transport connections are superb; Victoria Station offers mainline national railway connections including the Gatwick Express as well as the Victoria Line underground. The District and Circle Line is accessed from St James's Park, and Jubilee Line at Westminster Station too.

Description

Exceptional contemporary two bedroom duplex apartment within this beautiful modern development.

Benefiting from an exquisite luxury design & build quality, the apartment features a stylish kitchen by Varenna Poliform, Italian designer wardrobes, oak wooden flooring, comfort cooling and underfloor heating.

The apartment comprises two double bedrooms (both with built-in storage), reception room, open-plan fully fitted kitchen, two luxury en-suite bathrooms and a private patio.

33 Greycoat Street is serviced by a 12 hour concierge and has bicycle storage available for the residents.

Square Footage: 1042 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 995 years remaining

address: St Edmund's Terrace, St John's Wood, London NW8
detailedDescription:
4-6 St Edmund's Terrace (by renowned developer Linton) combines the best of elegant contemporary living with an unparalleled location.

Situated in the heart of one of London’s most sophisticated and serene neighbourhoods, St Edmund's Terrace is a striking collection of nine luxury apartments, all of which have been finished to a discerningly high specification.

Floor-to-ceiling windows provide an abundance of natural light throughout the generously proportioned living spaces, and kitchen and bathrooms feature Miele, Quooker and Hansgrohe fixtures and fittings.

Apartment 8 is the Sub-Penthouse which occupies the entire third floor and provides 2,037 sq ft (189 sq m) of luxurious living accommodation. The open plan reception room, which incorporates a dining area and fully fitted kitchen benefits from a double aspect and six floor-to-ceiling windows.

The interior designed apartment is conveniently serviced by first come, first served underground parking, a daytime concierge service and passenger lift, and benefits from a wealth of modern amenities including comfort cooling, underfloor heating, smart lighting system, and is provisioned for both high-speed internet and integrated ceiling speakers.

St Edmund's Terrace is enviably located between two of London’s finest Royal Parks (Primrose Hill and Regent's Park), and further benefits from being within close proximity to all of the cosmopolitan amenities of both Primrose Hill Village and St John’s Wood High Street.<br/><br/><b>Amenities:</b><br/>Three Private Terraces, Daytime Concierge Service, The Right to Park in the Underground Car Park on a First Come First Serve Basis, Residents Permit Parking

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

We are proud to bring to market this cool two bedroom two bathroom apartment in the heart of Victoria's new vibrant restaurant district.

This fabulous and bright apartment is located on the 4th floor, looking out onto Buckingham Palace Road and measures 1140 sq ft.

The apartment has been fully interior designed and is ready for immediate occupation and comes with one secure underground parking space.

Residents at the Nova benefit from a bouquet of facilities such as a private screening room, a fully equipped gym, a lounge perfect for business meetings or just relaxing and a roof terrace with breathtaking views of the capital!

Furthermore, literally on your doorstep are an array of restaurants, bars and coffee shops so you will never be short of places to dine and wine!

address: Shirland Road, Maida Vale, London W9
detailedDescription:
A stunning and beautifully finished three bedroom upper maisonette spanning approximately 1350 square feet. Positioned on the top two floors of a converted Victorian building with wood flooring throughout.

With plenty of interesting features and an abundance of natural light throughout, the accommodation comprises a bright open plan kitchen and reception, master bedroom with a plethora of storage and en-suite bathroom, a second large double bedroom with its own en-suite and a third large double bedroom served by a spacious family bathroom.

The location on the corner of Sutherland Avenue and Shirland Road is ideal to take advantage of the local amenities. These include the canals of Little Venice, Paddington Recreation Ground and the shops/cafes of Formosa Street. The property benefits from excellent local pubs and restaurants including the Waterway and the Hero of Maida pub.

The property is near Warwick Avenue underground (Bakerloo), with direct trains to Paddington and the West End. Royal Oak (Circle and Hammersmith and City) and Maida Vale (Bakerloo) are both a short walk. On street resident parking is available from Westminster City Council.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Bright and spacious one bedroom flat on the sixteenth floor of an imposing building in Westminster, served by two lifts. Off street parking by separate arrangement.
You will enter into an exquisite chequered designed black & white mosaic floor, spreading into the bathroom and kitchen. The fully tiled bathroom is elegantly finished and with some contemporary fittings. The bedroom with white washed floorboards is elegantly finished with an amount of daylight reflecting into the full height fitted wardrobes.
The black fitted kitchen units with matching kitchen appliances stands well against the black and white chequered mosaic floor, with an abundance of natural light from a large window. A raised long counter provides for a modern living dining/ breakfast area.
The black tiled floor in the living room contrast beautifully with the white painted walls and recessed ceiling side lighting. Four large panes of glass slide in the middle to give access into a delightful balcony and a lit fish tank to be appreciated in the evenings. From the south-facing balcony one can enjoy the glorious views of London from this delightful flat on the sixteenth floor of this well kept building.
There is access to a beautifully landscaped private garden with relaxed sitting areas. The property is well served with Pimlico and Victoria stations extensive network and St James Park. Excellent shopping facilities along Victoria street with good quality restaurants all close by. Separate negotiable off-street parking arrangements are facilitated, rare in Westminster.

detailedDescription:
Offered for sale and arranged over approximately 664sqft. Is this two bedroom apartment. Located on the second floor, with lift access, the apartment has an abundance of natural light.

The reception room itself benefits from five large windows with views to the rear of the communal garden and is a great space for entertaining and dining. The separate kitchen is fully functioning with added storage for utilities.

There are two good sized bedrooms, one having access to an ensuite shower room whilst the second bedroom has access to the family bathroom.

The property is sold with a share of freehold, has lift access, well maintained communal parts and also has a communal garden.

address: Tothill House, Page Street, Westminster, London SW1P
detailedDescription:
A bright 2 double bedroom apartment available for sale and sold with vacant possession in the heart of Westminster, this building is part of the popular Grosvenor Estate. The well presented property is located in this Iconic development, which is a grade II listed building, designed by famous architect, Edward Lutyens. The living space comprises of a reception room, a separate smart kitchen with lovely pretty tree lined views, modern shower and two good size double bedrooms. It also benefits from a residents large communal courtyard and lift. Tothill House is located only moments from the Tate Gallery, River Thames and Houses of Parliament and transport links are excellent with Pimlico, St James's Park and Westminster tube stations all near by. title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Greater London Properties Presents
An impressive, bright apartment situated in this popular private residential building with optional parking. This stunning first floor flat (with lift) offers unrivalled access to all of London's entertainment in the heart of the West End.

The Property
Extending over 565 sq ft, this superb residence features beautiful wood floors, excellent high ceilings and large sash-windows which bathe the entire apartment in natural light. There is a spacious living room, a separate fully fitted kitchen with ample storage, a bedroom with built-in wardrobes and a contemporary bathroom with bath, sink and toilet.

The Location
Sandringham Court is a highly sought-after private residential block, quietly tucked away and just a short walk from Carnaby Street and the shops of Oxford Street and Bond Street. The property is very well connected and offers easy access to the City of London, airports and to many of the world's best universities. The nearest Underground stations are Oxford Circus (Central, Victoria and Bakerloo lines), Piccadilly Circus (Bakerloo and Piccadilly lines), Leicester Square (Northern and Piccadilly lines) and Tottenham Court Road (Central and Northern lines, Crossrail).

The Owners Say
We bought our flat in 1987 as a work/stay pied a terre and took advantage of a car parking space in the basement allocated to residents. Business colleagues were in walking distance and having a base in central London for all the family a great asset. We reconfigured the space in 2005 to a very high spec, prioritising the living space. Most of the underground system is within walking distance and the vibrancy of the area is on your doorstep, yet it is unique position in a cul de sac makes it very quiet. It has ticked all the boxes for us!

Notice
Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

detailedDescription:
Two bed apartment

Battersea Power Station views

First floor

Dawson House

Winter garden

In addition to concierge/ security, once completed Battersea Power Station is proposed to have on-site restaurants, food stores, a theatre, cinema, gymnasium and access to a 5,000 sq ft private residents' club.

Battersea Power Station is between Chelsea, Battersea and the regeneration of Nine Elms. When complete, Battersea Power Station will benefit from an extension to the Northern Line and a new Battersea Power station tube stop, the new us Embassy, two new public parks, 1.5m sq ft of retail space, up to 15,000 new homes and 2.5m sq ft of office space

One of London’s iconic buildings, Battersea Power Station occupies an area of c.40 acres opposite Chelsea, covering 400 metres of south bank river front. The site, master planned by the world renowned architect Rafael Viñoly, will deliver a new community.

The site is strategically located in a key waterfront position within the Nine Elms Opportunity Area- the last major regeneration zone in Central London which spans 195 hectares and is set to become a uniquely modern district. This area is intended to provide new jobs, new homes with access by new public transport facilities. There will also be new schools, health centres and community facilities and an 11 acre linear park linking Vauxhall to Battersea Power Station. Nine elms will also be the site of the relocated us Embassy- estimated 800 staff and 1,100 visitors each day

A spacious four bedroom purpose built flat that is set on the second floor of a secure building with lift access, forming part of the Alexandra and Ainsworth Estate and offered for sale in good condition throughout. Requiring some modernisation, it is the perfect opportunity to make this home your own!

Measuring approximately 838 sq ft, the property comprises an entrance hallway with storage cupboards, four bedrooms (three double bedrooms), a living room with access to a balcony, a bathroom with separate WC and a kitchen with access to a second balcony.

Features include double glazing, gas central heating, two balconies, entry phone system, lift access, residents permit parking and communal gardens. The property also benefits from being sold with no onward chain.

Viewings are highly recommended as this property must be seen to fully appreciate the size on offer and will make an ideal purchase for first time buyers, families and landlords alike.

Luxury living in a prestigious development close to the River Thames. A modern and elegant 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment with a private balcony moments from Battersea Park.

Measuring 844sqft, this attractive apartment has been tastefully decorated throughout and finished to a very high standard. The open concept kitchen/reception space features integrated appliances with a sleek, luxurious finish and is the ideal space for entertaining, with sliding doors leading to your private balcony overlooking the tended gardens below.

The incredibly spacious master suite has a wall of built-in wardrobes with integrated lighting as well as dedicated hanging, shelving and drawer storage solutions. The en-suite bathroom benefits from a full-sized bath and overhead shower, mood lighting and the suite has direct access to the sweeping balcony. The generously sized second bedroom also has luxury, built-in wardrobes and large floor-to-ceiling length windows, benefitting from the ample natural light which the entire property enjoys. A smart shower room, with additional low-level lighting, features a stunning walk-in, overhead rain shower and leads to the property's utility room.

Vista is a luxurious development with an enviable position next to Battersea Park, benefitting from a 24/7 concierge service, lift access, private gym, pool and spa, secure bike storage and access to well-tended communal gardens. The immediate area Is vibrant and constantly evolving thanks to the development of Battersea Power Station, where you will find grocery stores, luxury hairdressers, delicious restaurant options, cocktails bars, retail opportunities and more!

As well as wonderful bus and rail links, there is a Thames Clipper riverboat service to connect you from Putney to Greenwich. This beautiful flat is offered chain free. Viewings by appointment only.<br /><br />

address: Central Building, 3 Matthew Parker Street, London SW1H
detailedDescription:
A highly desirable one bedroom duplex apartment with parking near St James's Park and Westminster Abbey.

Location

Matthew Parker Street is located in the heart of Westminster, accessed from Tothill Street and Storeys Gate, near Petty France and Old Queen street.

This is an exceptionally convenient location for access to Prime Central London, with close proximity to the world renowned and iconic local landmarks, including Buckingham Palace, St James' Park, Westminster Abbey and the Houses of Parliament.

Victoria and Westminster in recent years has benefitted from a substantial and ongoing redevelopment, becoming a hub for fashion and food, with restaurants from Michelin starred chefs such as Michel Roux Jnr, Tom Kerridge, Jason Atherton, and Andrew Wong, to The Ivy and an array of cafes and boutiques in Cardinal Place and at Nova.

Coupled with the extensive historic and cultural amenities ranging from the Tate Britain Gallery to Victoria Palace Theatre there are also contemporary venues such as a Curzon cinema, and Andrew Lloyd Webber's 'Other' Palace, this is a thriving location with an exceptional lifestyle offer for local residents.

Finally this is a location renowned for its transport connections. With Victoria Station providing mainline network services including the Gatwick Express; Local underground services are also convenient with the Victoria Line at Victoria Station, District and Circle Line at St James' Park and Jubilee Line at Westminster Station.

Description

A beautiful one bedroom apartment over two floors (Fifth and sixth floor) boasting impressive ceiling heights and stunning large sash windows letting in ample light.

The apartment benefits from a open plan reception room and fully equipped kitchen and cloakroom. The staircase leads up to a large double bedroom with built in storage, and bathroom.

This popular building benefits from a 24 hour concierge and a long leasehold.

This is an ideal property to be used as a permanent or regular home, pied a terre or investment property.

Square Footage: 741 sq ft

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Chapter House by esteemed Central London developer Londonewcastle, comprises an intimate collection of 40 contemporary residential apartments housed in a dramatic Victorian building at the heart of Covent Garden, London’s most celebrated cultural neighbourhood.

Located on the first floor, this 826 sqft south facing apartment features an open plan living space, two double bedrooms, two bathrooms, one en suite, and benefits from wonderful character thanks to the sash windows and retained period façade of this 19th century building - a rare find in the West End.

The open plan living area is beautifully designed, featuring bespoke joinery, and impressive full height doors, with carefully considered rich finishes, including hardwood smoked oak flooring that runs throughout the space. The Italian Dada kitchens feature stone worktops with full splash backs, Hansgrohe mixer taps, concealed LED lighting and top of the range integrated Miele and Siemens appliances. The bedrooms comprise a colour palette of soft warm tones to create a calming atmosphere and feature cove lighting, matt lacquer finished wardrobes with interior lighting, plenty of storage. And sumptuous velvet wool carpets. Boasting large format porcelain floor and wall tiles, the sophisticated bathroom features built-in wall-hung vanity units, together with polished gun metal-finished fittings from iconic Italian brand Zucchetti and sleek frameless glass screened walk-in showers.

Additionally, the apartment also features underfloor heating, as well as a sophisticated air cooling system to principal rooms, keeping the apartments at a comfortable temperature all year round.

Residents will further benefit from a bespoke concierge service and intimate gym and training studio with specially selected walnut accessories.

Chapter House depicts an outstanding opportunity to live amongst the character, heritage and culture that Covent Garden has to offer. Tucked away down a quiet side street in the Seven Dials Conservation Area, this impressive development is home to a collection of unique apartments designed with the sophisticated and discerning in mind. Together with its secluded location, within an historic, eclectic and vibrant community at the heart of London’s West End, the reimagined Chapter House is a truly unique find.

Chapter House has some of London’s best restaurants, bars, coffee shops, boutiques, galleries and museums, as well as world-class theatre, opera and ballet, all within walking distance. Perfectly in a primary location, with underground stations within close proximity:
- Chancery Lane Station (0.1 miles - Central line)
- Holborn Station (0.5 miles - Central and Piccadilly lines)
- Farringdon Station (1.0 mile - Thameslink, Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines)

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Situated at the easterly end of Lancaster Gate and occupying a prominent corner plot, the two buildings are part of what was an outstanding mid 19th century urban design and residential development, structured around a wide street, originally titled Upper Hyde Park Gardens, since renamed Lancaster Gate, running east-west, parallel to and north of the Bayswater Road and Hyde Park/Kensington Gardens.

Originally designed as two individual homes and converted into one hotel in the 1930"s both are white stucco fronted buildings with classical detailing and portico entrances.

The five storey building with one-level basement and attic was formally known as the Averard Hotel and combined, both buildings total just under 25,000 sq ft of gross internal space, both containing original, ornate interior work, some of it unique.

The properties currently have C1 Hotel use but ceased to function as a hotel in approximately 2008 and have since been unoccupied.

An exceptional mid-terraced family house beautifully refurbished to the highest specification and moments from Hyde Park

This stunning, fully modernised townhouse in the heart of The Hyde Park Estate has been meticulously refurbished boasting extensive entertaining space, combined with four bedrooms, offering the discerning buyer refined luxury, comfort and style. With family accommodation of over 2600 sq ft and arranged over four floors, this house presents an extremely rare opportunity to purchase a turn-key property in one of London's most exclusive locations.
The ground floor comprises a spacious dining room leading to a bespoke, fully fitted kitchen, specially designed to suit all of your catering needs and with the latest Miele appliances. Concertina doors take you to a delightful rear decked garden complete with automatic watering system for plants. There is a further reception room located on the first floor adjacent to the master bedroom which benefits from built in wardrobes and an en-suite shower room, complete with underfloor heating. There are three further bedrooms, one en-suite and a family bathroom arranged over the second floor, all wet rooms with underfloor heating and built in storage in the second bedroom. One of the greatest assets of the house is the third floor media/entertainment room complete with built in bar, refrigerator and appliances. This air-conditioned room has doors leading to the sun-trap, south-west facing terrace with views over both Oxford Square and Norfolk Crescent.
Conveniently located for the transport links and local amenities in the popular Hyde Park Estate. Moments from Paddington Station (Heathrow Express) and nearby underground stations including Marble Arch and Lancaster Gate (Central line) and Edgware Road (District, Circle and Hammersmith & City lines). detailedDescription:
A 6-bedroom, 7-bathroom spanning 6908 Sqft (641.8 sq m) across 4 floors with a large private garden close to the world-famous American School in London.

For Viewings please quote #nmb or #dsz

This beautiful family home benefits from ceiling heights of up to 9ft & generous natural light from the floor to ceiling windows in the living/dining area, creating a sense of harmony for you and your loved ones.

The property layout is built with convenience in mind and is suitable for practical living. The grand marbled entrance hall houses ample built in storage leading into the kitchen/living areas with a direct access into the garage.

The vast living space with a formal dining area opens up to the beautifully maintained west facing garden connecting to the conservatory, currently used as a study/office space.

The kitchen is packed with space for entertaining, informal family dining and is fitted with Miele applicances, benefitting from an additional kitchenette for extra storage.

As you continue upstairs you will find all the bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms.

The master and second bedroom have their own walk-in wardrobe while the other bedrooms are fitted with built in wardrobes. This additional storage really offers that much needed space to store away your family's belongings.

For a truly luxurious & fully functional living, your new home comes with underfloor heating, air conditioning, home security system, garage and an additional off street parking space. On the lower ground floor there is the swimming pool, sauna, steam room, space for gym equipment and a large cinema area popular and enjoyed by the whole family.

The local area also houses many attractions such as Regents Park which is an 8-minute drive (1.5 miles), The zsl London Zoo is an 11-minute drive (1.7 miles), Paddington Recreation Ground which is a 7-minute drive away (1.3 miles) and the world-famous Abbey Road Crossing made famous by The Beatles is only a 10-minute walkway.

address: Ashley Gardens, Thirleby Road, London SW1P
detailedDescription:
A splendid two bedroom mansion flat in Westminster.

Location

Ashley Gardens forms a very highly regarded group of mansion blocks in the heart of Westminster, forming part of a peaceful residential area surrounding Westminster Cathedral. Located to the south of St James’s Park and to the east of Victoria, this is a prime location convenient for iconic landmarks including Buckingham Palace and St James Park, and Westminster Abbey, Houses of Parliament and the Tate Britain Gallery.

Transport connections are superb, with Victoria Railway Station offering mainline national connections and the Gatwick Express, as well as underground services. St James Park and Westminster underground stations are also convenient.

Victoria has recently seen a £2billion pound redevelopment which is now nearing completion. This has provided a significant enhancement of lifestyle living with a Curzon Cinema, and Andrew Lloyd Webber's 'The Other Palace' theatre accompanying the historical Victoria Palace Theatre which is currently hosting Hamilton and the Victoria Apollo.

Westminster and Victoria is also becoming a destination for food, with brands ranging from Sourced Market, Stix and Sushi, Jamie Oliver and Jason Atherton, to award winning and Michelin starred restaurants such as Quilon, Roux at Parliament Square, A Wong, and the Cinnamon Club; there are also artisan coffee houses such as Iris and June, and The Coffee Geeks, all contributing to a modern diverse and thriving local scene.

Description

A highly desirable two bedroom property located on the third floor of this sought after mansion bock in Ashley Gardens.

Presenting in excellent condition throughout, this property benefits from an impressive double reception room, separate kitchen, two double bedrooms, two bathrooms and ample of storage. The property is light, quiet and further benefits from a 24 hour porter and well-presented communal parts.

This apartment will be of interest to any buyer seeking a regular of permanent home, a pied a terre, or even an investment.

Square Footage: 1294 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A sizeable first-floor mews apartment, occupying the upper floor of a two-storey building. Moments from Cavendish Square and Regent Street, the property offers 82 square metres (883 square feet) of space, incorporating 2 bedrooms and 2 bath / shower rooms, one of which is ensuite to the larger bedroom. The mews itself is a very quiet and little-known corner of central London.

The property would benefit from some refurbishment, which represents an opportunity for an incoming buyer. There may also be the opportunity to extend the property above, adding another floor, subject to necessary consents.

The principal feature of the property is the huge reception and dining space, quite square in proportion and therefore extremely versatile. Through double doors from the reception space is the kitchen, and the entire apartment is wonderfuly bright as there are skylights above the kitchen, the living space and both bedrooms.

The property is in tfl Zone 1, and within London's Congestion Charging zone, allowing for a resident's discount for electric vehicles. Oxford Circus Underground station (Central, Bakerloo & Victoria Lines) is 8 minutes walk. The wonderful green space of Regents Park is similarly 8 minutes' walk. The range of shopping and amenities nearby is vast - Oxford Street, Regent Street, Baker Street, Marylebone and Soho are all within walking distance.

The property is offered chain-free, with a lease of nearly 900 years, and is serviced by Savills from 49 Hallam Street with porters present daily.

Greater London Properties are excited to present this stunning 1,137 sq ft two bedroom, two bathroom loft-style apartment situated in the prestigious Soho Lofts, a private portered development in fashionable Soho.

The Property
This impressive home boasts a very large living room, excellent high ceilings throughout, light coloured wooden flooring, and large Crittall-style windows which bathe the property in natural light. The striking open-plan kitchen has been designed with high-specification fittings and a stylish island. The spacious master bedroom boasts an en-suite bathroom and a fully fitted walk-in wardrobe. There is a well-proportioned second bedroom, a contemporary guest bathroom and an abundance of additional storage. The development benefits from a day-porter and lift access.

The Location
Soho Lofts is a highly sought-after development of 33 loft apartments and 4 penthouses House in the heart of fashionable Soho. The property offers easy access to the City of London, Heathrow and City airports and mainline railway stations including St Pancras International (Eurostar), as well as several of the world's best universities. The theatres of the West End, the shops of Mayfair, and the restaurants of Soho and Fitzrovia all lie within a short stroll. It is a short walk from Carnaby Street, Regent Street and Oxford Street and is very well connected in terms of buses and tubes. The nearest Underground stations are Piccadilly Circus (Bakerloo and Piccadilly lines), Leicester Square (Northern and Piccadilly lines), Oxford Circus (Central, Victoria and Bakerloo lines) and Tottenham Court Road (Central and Northern lines and the soon-to-be opened Elizabeth line (Crossrail)). Even four of London's Royal Parks are within walking distance.

title: 5 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A magnificent 4-5 bedroom lateral apartment with views overlooking the beautiful gardens of Portman Square, situated on the sixth floor of one of Marylebone's most prestigious buildings. The elegant home is finished to excellent standards, with high ceilings and eight windows overlooking the delightful garden square while allowing an abundance of natural light throughout. It comprises a spacious, grand entrance hall leading to an open-plan reception/dining room with a gas fireplace and air cooling. The dining room features sliding doors enabling two separate rooms to be formed, and the large, modern, eat-in kitchen is fitted with Gaggenau appliances and two dishwashers.The luxury master bedroom suite overlooks Portman Square Gardens and includes a cedar-lined dressing room and ensuite bathroom with a steam shower. There are a further three bedrooms, two of which share an ensuite bathroom and a playroom which could easily be used as a fifth bedroom. The apartment also offers a charming walnut panelled office/media room, guest bathroom, guest W/C and a cloakroom. Orchard Court is an exclusive purpose-built mansion block benefiting from exquisite communal areas, a lift and 24-hour porter service. Residents also have access to the green, manicured resident-only Portman Square gardens for a small annual fee.
Two secure parking spaces are also available.

Grange London is proud to present this beautifully presented one bedroom apartment situated on the sixth floor within a landmark and unique waterfront development 3 Merchant Square.

Other features include a generous balcony which provides water views, dining area, engineered wood flooring, open plan fitted kitchen with reconstituted stone work tops and integrated Miele appliances. 3 Merchant Square is elegant and confident 21 storey canal-side residential building.

Location

Tounson Court is part of the Regency Apartments development accessed from Regency Street, which runs between Horseferry Road and Vauxhall Bridge Road.

The local area is extremely well connected with transport links at Victoria railway station providing national mainline services including the Gatwick Express, and underground stations at Victoria, St James's Park, Westminster and Pimlico all within convenient distances.

This is also an ideal location for enjoying the many World renowned and iconic landmarks of Westminster, including Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey and Cathedral, Tate Britain Gallery and of course, St James's Park. Leisure facilities exclusive to the residents at 9 Millbank include a 24-hour concierge, a state-of-the-art gym, luxurious swimming pool with spa and treatment room, private cinema screening room, meeting rooms, and landscaped gardens.

Millbank Residences is a magnificent collection of Manhattans, one, two, three and four-bedroom apartments and penthouses in a beautifully restored 1920s building that retains many of its original details.

Featuring classical interiors designed by Goddard Littlefair along with world-class leisure facilities, these elegant homes provide the ultimate in sophisticated London living.

The impressive granite-and-stone façade of Millbank Residences is set back from the river behind Victoria Tower Gardens, a park that forms part of the Thames Embankment.

Just a short stroll from Westminster Palace, Millbank Residences occupies a coveted riverside location with views over the Thames.

detailedDescription:
Ready to move into now!

Don't miss out on this luxury architect-designed 2 bed apartment with the large terrace.

The spacious, open plan living and kitchen area is flooded with natural light and opens out onto a large terrace.

You can also relax and unwind in the tranquillity of the rooftop garden, one of the largest in London.

There is plenty of room for working from home in comfort, and the high-speed broadband will ensure you are always connected.

Designed by leading architects, Stiff and Trevillion, the luxury apartment is built to the highest specification.

Located just a 4 minute walk away from Westbourne Park Underground Station, it is also close to sought-after Notting Hill & Maida Vale, and a 12 minute walk to Portobello Road.

Underground parking available.

One out of collection of three houses. Newly refurbished 5-bedroom, 5-bathroom townhouse situated on a quiet street at the heart of Westminster. Property has just been renovated to the highest standards.

This 5-bathroom townhouse is situated on a quiet street at the heart of Westminster with spectacular views on St. John's Church in Smith's Square. The accommodation has just been renovated to the highest standards and comprises: An en-suite master bedroom with built-in storage unit, 4 additional bedrooms (two of them en-suite), and a living room with a fully-fitted modern kitchen accessing a private outside terrace.

The townhouse is perfect for families looking to settle in a quiet and tranquil environment with excellent connectivity and access to London's most reknown parks, landmarks and neighbourhoods including Tate Britain, Westminster Abbey, the Houses of Parliament, Buckingham Palace, St.James's Park and Hyde Park. The nearest underground stations include Westminster, St. James's Park and Victoria.
