A wonderfully bright one bedroom apartment with a lift and porter in the heart of St James's.

Location

St James's is home to many of London's most prestigious establishments and long established private members clubs including the East India Club on St James' Square and the rac Club on Pall Mall.

The property is conveniently located for the green spaces of Green Park (0.3 miles) and St. James's Park (0.3 miles), and the world class amenities, restaurants and flagship shops offered by St. James's and Bond Street.

The nearest underground stations are Piccadilly Circus (0.4 miles), for the Bakerloo, Piccadilly lines and Green Park (0.3 miles) for the Piccadilly line, Jubilee line and the Victoria line.
Please note all distances are approximate.

The well-proportioned accommodation comprises reception room, separate kitchen/breakfast room, double bedroom with a charming and unique octagonal shape and a bathroom with separate bath and shower. The apartment boasts a wealth of natural light throughout and is situated in this red brick building benefiting from a lift and porter.

Spacious, elegant intercommunicating reception rooms and a large kitchen breakfast room make this an ideal flat for entertaining. There are three generously proportioned double bedrooms all with bathrooms en suite, a guest cloakroom and a utility room. Situated in the heart of Westminster, convenient for the excellent amenities of revitalised Victoria which include, numerous restaurants, gyms excellent shopping, theatres, a Curzon 5 screen cinema, St James’ and Green Park. Nearby landmarks include Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey and Cathedral and The Houses of Parliament. Victoria mainline station provides excellent national connections and three underground stations with services on the Victoria, District Circle and Jubilee lines.

detailedDescription:
A fantastic four bedroom duplex penthouse with three terraces, two balconies and direct lift access.

Location

Situated between Bond Street and Regent Street, and offering easy access to Mayfair, Soho and the flagship stores of the West End. The property is surrounded by world famous restaurants, hotels and luxury retailing. The Royal parks of Hyde Park (0.8 mile) an Green Park (0.6 mile) are nearby.

The closest underground stations are Oxford Circus (0.1 mile) and Piccadilly Circus (0.5 mile).

Crossrail will be available at Bond Street station (0.4 mile)

Description

This wonderful penthouse is on the top two floors of a period building that was refurbished in 2016. There is direct lift access, Lutron lighting and comfort cooling.

The fourth floor has an entrance hall, generous master bedroom with en suite bathroom and dressing room, three further bedrooms (two en suite), a further shower room and a laundry room. The principal bedroom also has the benefit of a balcony. The fifth floor is dedicated to the dual aspect, open plan living room/kitchen which opens onto two of the terraces and one of the balconies. There is also a landing area which opens onto the third terrace and a guest cloakroom.

Square Footage: 2231 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 988 years remaining

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This very well proportioned flat is locate don the 1st floor of this prestigious devlopement, the property comprises of 3 bedrooms.

Marylebone Square development is a fantastic collection of 54 apartments, carefully selected boutiques, restaurants and a versatile hall. The scheme is due for completion in Q1/Q2 2023 and it combines traditional craft with 21-st century engineering, blending into its historic home with a subtle modernity that enhances its surroundings

At the heart of turants, and a vhis scene lies Marylebone Square, a collection of 54 high-end apartments, carefully chosen boutiques and restaersatile community hall. A modern take on a traditional London mansion block, this is refined London living at its very best. Marylebone Square offers classic yet contemporary design, and an authentic village feels – right in the city centre.
At Marylebone, you are perfectly placed. Paddington and Euston stations are a short ride away, while Baker Street and Marylebone stations are right on your doorstep. Bond Street underground is a five-minute walk down the road, where the Elizabeth line will connect you to Heathrow Airport or Paris via the Eurostar. For an evening of entertainment, hail a cab to The Royal Opera House or to London’s iconic West End – or for a spot of shopping Selfridges is your local department store. Weekend walks and relaxing summer evenings are always on the agenda with Regent’s Park a stone’s throw to the north, and Hyde Park to the south.

Ready for occupation in Q1/Q2/2023 Marylebone Square is an opportunity to acquire off-plan with a phased payment scheme.

In conjunction with Simon Bowden Architects, all residences will benefit from floor-to-ceiling windows and glass sliding doors insured with a 10-year build warranty by NHBC.

Leasehold: 999 Years

Service Charge: £6.91/Sq Ft

Parking available from an additional £150,000 per stall

Storage available upon request<br /><br />

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Designed and furnished to the highest and most exacting standards with painstaking attention to detail at no expense spared, this elegant west-facing two-bedroom, raised ground floor apartment provides modern, elegant interiors, state of the art appliances and direct access to the stunning, highly sought-after Crescent communal gardens through its own private balcony.

The accommodation offers two bedrooms, two bathrooms (including master en-suite) and open-plan kitchen / living room which leads to a private terrace.

The property boasts high ceilings, period features and a wonderful, bright living space which benefits from direct sunlight. Floor surfaces include Harwoods Herringbone wood and bamboo woven deep plush carpeting. The kitchen features a Rangemaster Elite stove, Miele integrated dishwasher / fridge-freezer and Caso wine cooler with under-counters brushed in stainless steel. The en-suite and guest bathrooms are underfloor heated and tiled in Italian Porcelain gloss. The living room is lit with an Italian Murano glass Chandelier, decorated with mural wallpaper by Andrew Martin with fully integrated Sonos sound system.

Located on the first floor of this stunning, period property ideally situated in the heart of Little Venice in close proximity to all the local amenities, including Warwick Avenue (Bakerloo line), the canals, waterside cafes and eclectic variety of shops along Clifton Road.

detailedDescription:
This magnificent two-bedroom apartment occupies the first floor of a handsome, Grade II listed, residential building in the heart of Bloomsbury, which overlooks the monumental Greek Revival portico of The British Museum. The internal spaces have recently undergone an intricate refurbishment in oak and poplar care of ooma design and are characterised by beautiful arched sash windows.

Setting the Scene

Museum Street runs through the heart of Bloomsbury, ultimately arriving at the handsome frontage of The British Museum (from which the street takes its name). The area is perhaps most renowned for its association with the bohemian group of 20th-century writers and artists including Virginia Woolf, Vanessa Bell and E. M. Forster, known as the Bloomsbury Set. It is one of London’s most desirable neighbourhoods, characterised by stately residential squares and its proximity to University College London, rada, the Architectural Association and Senate House Library.

Museum Street itself has its origins in the 14th century; however, it remained largely rural until the late 17th century when London greatly expanded. This included the establishment of the British Museum in 1753. In the early 19th century, the street became a fashionable area, with many prominent writers of the day gathering in its taverns, including Charles Dickens, John Keats and George Orwell, as well as the Bloomsbury Set.

The Grand Tour

The apartment is configured around a large open-plan kitchen, living and dining room lined with solid oak floorboards. Five beautiful arched sash windows frame exceptional views through a row of London Plane trees, towards The British Museum piazza. High ceilings and a curved aspect emphasise the flow of natural light across the plan, which illuminates the solid oak joinery and black Zimbabwean granite worktops. The kitchen is positioned at one end of the plan and has integrated Gaggenau appliances, oak-fronted units and plenty of storage space.

A large main bedroom with an en suite shower room lies off the main hallway. These spaces have been the subject of a sensitive intervention by John Griffiths, who has created bespoke shutters in poplar wood for each of the three arched sash windows in the bedroom, as well as refurbishing the shower room, which is now partially lined and fitted in beautifully aged teak.

Opposite is the second bedroom, used by the current owners as a home studio. It has bespoke polished plywood-fronted storage units and a concealed desk, perfect for working from home. A full bathroom is positioned next to the bedroom and has Fired Earth tiles throughout. A convenient cloakroom with further storage space can be found along the hallway.

The Great Outdoors

Residents of the building have a key for Bedford Square Gardens; a private garden square that is a lovely place to spend lazy, languorous afternoons. Bloomsbury Square Gardens – Bloomsbury’s oldest square, laid out in 1665 – is also nearby, as is the famous Russell Square. Lincoln’s Inn Fields are a 10-minute walk away, and are home to both tennis and netball courts, which can be hired by the public. Gray’s Inn Gardens and Coram’s Fields are also close at hand.

Out and About

Museum Street is in a fantastic position, right in the heart of London. Nearby Lamb’s Conduit Street is home to an interesting community of independent shops spread along a pedestrianised street. The Brunswick Centre, a short walk away, has a cinema and a Waitrose supermarket. The restaurants and bars of Clerkenwell, Exmouth Market, Covent Garden and Soho are all within walking distance, as are the colleges and institutes of the University of London. There are vast numbers of hidden pubs and restaurants in Bloomsbury; of particular note is the newly opened Café Deco on Store Street.

Kings Cross (Northern Line), Russell Square (Piccadilly Line), Holborn (Central and Piccadilly Lines), Chancery Lane (Central Line) and Farringdon Station (Circle Line, Hammersmith & City Line, Metropolitan Line and National Rail services) are all close by. Farringdon Station will also benefit from the imminent opening of Crossrail, which will run a direct route to Heathrow Airport. The Eurostar is available at St Pancras.

Tenure: Leasehold
Underlying Lease Length: Approx. 122 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £1,000 pa
Ground Rent: Approx. £200 pa

Set on the fourth floor of a very popular portered building, the apartment is located on a one-way street with a secluded entrance, making the apartment more private and extremely quiet. The building has an impressive communal entrance, a very good-sized lift and also benefits from secure underground parking for one car and a 24-hour porterage seated at front of house.

The apartment has been cleverly designed with attention to detail and an abundance of storage throughout, comprising three generously sized bedrooms, two large bathrooms, a double reception and dining area, large eat in kitchen and a separate utility area.
The bespoke Chire kitchen is fully fitted with top of the range appliances such as Miele, Quooker taps and also benefits from a luxury seating area allowing one to dine informally in the kitchen. The principal bedroom boasts a book-matched marble en-suite shower room as well as a bespoke walk-in wardrobe. The two remaining bedrooms also offer bespoke fitted wardrobes and great storage. Designed by Maison Arabella, the attention to detail coupled with the bespoke furniture and materials used throughout the apartment is extremely impressive. The apartment also benefits from features such as a nest Heating System, Opale security system, underfloor heating as well as central heating, a wine cooler and has the added benefit of two private balconies inclusive of decking, with one coming off the reception room and one coming off the large kitchen.

55 Ebury Street is considered one of Belgravia's best managed buildings. Belgravia is, bordered by Buckingham Palace, Harrods and Hyde Park and is moments away from the new Peninsula Hotel and the prestigious shops, boutiques and restaurants of Elizabeth Street.

detailedDescription:
Outside, Cleveland Square is a showcase of Bayswater’s classic architectural heritage, with one of London’s most beautifully landscaped communal gardens. But beyond its smart stucco fronts, this immaculate three-bedroom apartment has fine-tuned modern living. Its interior-designer owner has carved this single-storey home into a layout that’s at once inspired and intuitive. Open doorways amplify the flow between spaces. Or close when you want some privacy. Cleverly positioned skylights keep the lower-ground apartment naturally bright. Finishes are down to a T. The polished, private-patio entrance sets the tone for the rest of the apartment. Bespoke, floor-to-ceiling wooden cabinetry runs from the generously proportioned living room to the eat-in kitchen, with a cosy dining area and banquet. High-spec appliances are seamlessly integrated – a low-slung electric fireplace, ovens, wine fridge – and shelves backlit to display your favourite pieces. Streamlined design continues in the master bedroom with wall-to-wall wardrobes, a recessed TV and subtly zoned dressing area. Its private bathroom features twin vanities, a walk-in rainfall shower and a tub with a wide marble rim. The perfect perch for toiletries. Or a glass of red. A Jack-and-Jill-style family bathroom enjoys an over-bath shower, with direct access to a second bedroom on one side and a shelf-lined home office on the other. Should you need, this space could easily be reimagined as a third bedroom. A discreet utility room, separate from the main living space, features integrated Miele appliances and extra storage. Another thoughtful touch that makes life run smoothly in this family home.

The 19th-century Cleveland Square is one of London’s most beautifully landscaped gardens – manicured flower beds, mature plum trees and a play area for children. There’s a real sense of community here. Under normal circumstances, the residents’ association hosts midsummer drinks, Shakespeare performances and firework displays in the square. Hyde Park is within a 10-minute walk, as are the boutiques and bars of Westbourne Grove and Little Venice. Well-connected Paddington links up with the rest of London and beyond.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Charming duplex three bedroom penthouse on popular garden square.

Location

Warwick Square is situated in the heart of Pimlico, between St. George's Drive and Belgrave Road and is renowned as one of Pimlico’s most exclusive addresses.

A popular residential district in Central London, convenient for iconic Westminster landmarks such as the Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey and Tate Britain Gallery.

The area is well provided for in terms of transport connections, with Victoria Underground & Mainline station; offering national mainline services including the Gatwick Express, as well as underground services (Circle & District Line and the Victoria Line). Pimlico Underground Station is also close proximity for the property for the Victoria Line.

There are numerous renowned restaurants and boutiques locally in Denbigh Street, Churton Street and Wilton Road, as well as theatres, markets, a Curzon cinema in Victoria Street, and the traditional lifestyle and cafe culture of Sloane Square and Belgravia is of course only minutes away too; all of which are contributing to a thriving and active local cultural scene which is increasingly enjoyed by local residents.

Description

Arranged across the fourth and fifth floor, this exceptional penthouse comprises three well-proportioned bedrooms boasting artificial silk carpets, two bathrooms, separate cloakroom, a spacious kitchen fitted with Gaggenau and Miele appliances and a generous reception room, which leads on to a west facing terrace with views overlooking the private garden square.

The property further benefits from an abundance of natural light due to its large floor to ceiling windows. Bespoke joinery throughout and features such as integrated surround sound, ceiling speakers and a steam room in the principal en suite.

Warwick Square is a highly sought after address in Pimlico with excellent access to the West End, the City, and Victoria, from which there are extensive transport options.

Square Footage: 1739 sq ft

This is a thriving location in the heart of prime central London ideal for a home, pied a terre or investment.

With a bright reception room, the accommodation is well proportioned and comprises three bedrooms, two bathrooms (one en suite), fitted kitchen, and an open plan reception room.

This apartment absolutely will lend itself for use as an excellent permanent or regular home or a larger centrally located pied a terre.

The Brick is located in one of the most eclectic and desirable neighbourhoods in London. Residents can enjoy the bustle of Notting Hill, Portobello Road and Westbourne Grove, while the Grand Union Canal provides a serene balance to a busy life.

The Brick is also part of a wider, ambitious initiative to create a new mixed-use quarter in Westbourne Park. Close by, will be new social spaces, flexible working options, upgraded public areas and improved waterside access.

As well as an ever-evolving social scene, The Brick is within walking distance of some of West London's most established classics, including neighbourhood restaurant Seven Saints, Michelin-starred The Ledbury, Portobello Road Market and Electric Cinema.

The Brick is a new development located in Westbourne Park, comprising 1,2, and 3 bedroom loft-style apartments, mews houses and penthouses, with a large residents' landscaped rooftop.

detailedDescription:
A much sought after and extremely rare to the market detached Victorian House with gated off street parking for two to three cars and private 40 foot private multi layered garden with built in lighting, irrigation and useful store. The house is set over 4 floors and spans approximately 3,300 square feet.

With abundant natural light throughout and bountiful period features throughout, the accommodation comprises of an enormous double reception room on the raised ground floor leading through to a bright conservatory area and study space which gives direct access to the garden. The garden level is made up of a large country style family kitchen which also gives access to the garden, a separate reception room used as a family room, a very useful utility room, a study/bedroom and a bathroom. The large master bedroom with plentiful storage and spacious en-suite bathroom is positioned on the first floor. There are three further large double bedrooms on the upper floors. Two with their own en-suite bathrooms and the third served by a family bathroom. The ground floor also benefits from a cloakroom.

Sutherland Avenue is very well located to take advantage of the facilities of both Maida Vale and Warwick Avenue, which include Warwick Avenue underground (Bakerloo), the shops/cafes of Formosa Street and Paddington recreation ground.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Welcome to Faraday House and this stunning two bedroom, two bathroom luxury apartment. Set in the iconic Battersea Power Station Development. Set on the Seventh floor, this apartment boasts 740 square feet of living space, dual aspect huge balconies and an open plan living, dining and kitchen space with the highest of finishes. Perfection!

Faraday House is located in the vibrant Circus West Village, which is honestly one of my favourite places to visit. The location is right on the waterfront of the River Thames and hosts every amenity you could ever wish for. The area features world-class bars and restaurants such as Gordon Ramsay's Street Pizza, Megans and Fiume to mention but a few. If that wasn't enough, there are also incredible retail brands on offer as well as convenience personified in the way of Battersea General Store (your very own quality fresh and organic mini-supermarket) and Black Sheep Coffee. To top off the external amenities you also live right next to the picturesque Battersea Park, you just don't get this level of living in such close space anywhere else in London.

If the external amenities weren't enough to excite you... I'm sure the residents only amenities will. When you purchase this property you will get access to a 24hr Concierge, modern gym, swimming pool, sauna, steam room, treatment rooms, cinema, residents bar, meeting rooms and lounge area - you genuinely do not have to step foot outside this area to live happily and that is the best thing about this apartment.

The property also has incredible transport links as it is just a few minutes' walk to Battersea tube station, which is on the new Northern Line extension (opens later this year). Right outside the doorstep is the Thames Clipper stop which gives access to the City and Canary Wharf as well as much more. The property is also within walking distance of Queenstown Road, Battersea Park and Vauxhall Stations which gives access to pretty much the entirety of London

agency_name: Knight Frank - St John's Wood Sales
address: Hamilton Terrace, St John's Wood, London NW8
detailedDescription:
A magnificent 12,435 sq ft Georgian house built circa 1850 that has been the subject of a major renovation behind the period façade. EPC D.

An elegant period, detached, freehold house, refurbished and remodelled to the highest of standards, incorporating generous bedroom suites, luxurious entertaining spaces and magnificent lower ground level leisure facilities with swimming pool, bar area, gymnasium, Jacuzzi, sauna and home cinema.

The classical neo-Georgian architecture complements the finest interior specification of this wonderful property in one of the most sought-after locations in London. The south-facing front of the ground floor is given over to a sumptuous reception and dining area.

Large glass windows at the rear give the extensive, Tsunami-equipped kitchen a bright, summery feel while showing off a beautifully landscaped garden.
A highlight of the property is a 14-metre heated indoor swimming pool backed by a stunning natural stone wall bathed in natural light. The pool area also includes a spa pool and elegant lounge area with discrete lighting.

A luxurious master suite, with a 420sqft bedroom, his-and-hers dressing rooms and en suites, fills the entire first floor and leads out onto a 900sqft terrace. Above, three spacious and well-appointed bedrooms provide ample room for family and guests, while the third floor has been converted into a music room.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings, and enhanced comprehensive photography.

With its village - like ambiance, elegant regency and contemporary buildings, world famous cricket ground and established cosmopolitan atmosphere, St John's wood is one of central London's most sought-after addresses.

Just a short distance by road or underground to London's west end and City, yet set apart due to its unique architectural heritage and history, and The 400 acres of neighbouring Regent's Park and Primrose Hill, St John's
Wood has been a highly desirable place to live over the last 200 years.

detailedDescription:
This exceptional, 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom, prime location property extends to over 1089sqft/ 101.24sq.m. Of internal living space set on the top, 5th floor of a Grade II listed building in Westminster, a stroll from the iconic Trafalgar Square and Charing Cross Station. Contemporary and delightfully bright interior features high ceilings, recessed lighting, sash windows, good wardrobe and storage space as well as modern kitchen and bathroom fittings and fixtures. The entrance hall leads to a slightly elevated level configured with bedroom one, guest cloakroom and a spacious and fully integrated kitchen/ breakfast dining room. A few steps down are the expansive reception/ living room, master bedroom with an ensuite bathroom, bedroom three and the second bathroom/shower room. The property overlooks the historic Whitehall with Trafalgar Theatre and Trafalgar Square easily observed from both, the living room and kitchen, which share the westerly aspect.
25 Whitehall has a day porter and is located close to shops, restaurants and transport links of Trafalgar Square and Covent Garden. detailedDescription:
A highly desirable mansion flat near St James's Park.

Location

36 Buckingham Gate sits within a small private driveway off Buckingham Gate in close to the junctions with Wilfred Street and Castle Lane.

Renowned as the 'Birdcage Walk Conservation Area' this location has a long and prestigious history with its proximity to Buckingham Palace and St James's Park.

The area has benefited enormously from landmark investment and development, by Land Securities and others around Victoria, with substantial residential and commercial schemes combining to invigorate this most central location as a thriving hub for food and fashion. The lifestyle quality for residents has improved immeasurably in only the last 2 years, and future schemes, still under development locally, will only go further to escalate the desirability of living in this location.

Transport connections locally include Victoria Station with main line services, including the Gatwick Express; Underground services from Victoria (accessed at Cardinal Place) and nearby St James's Park.

Wider amenities include a Curzon Cinema; the 'Other Palace' Theatre; Taj Hotel; and restaurants such as Roux at Parliament Square, Caxton Grill, Hai Cenato by Jason Atherton, and Tom Kerridge's new 'bar & grill' restaurant at the Corinthia, all combine to make this an iconic district a destination that is fast being recognised as genuine extension of Prime Central London.

Description

This is a highly attractive and spacious one bedroom mansion flat, located on the raised ground floor within this renowned building close to St James Park, Victoria and Buckingham Palace.

Presented in good order and with accommodation briefly comprising an elegant reception room, separate kitchen, bedroom and bathroom, this flat is notable for its ceiling heights and sense of natural light throughout.

As a raised ground floor property it does benefit from privacy and a sense of tranquility, discreetly positioned in the building, allowing in our opinion for an ideal 'lock up and leave' pied a terre type property. It will appeal also to investment buyers seeking an excellent property to let.

Square Footage: 596 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A modern three bedroom house, exceptionally designed and with sleek finishes throughout. Close to Hyde Park and a wealth of transport links.

Location

Cleveland Terrace is ideally located and moments from the national and international connections at Paddington Mainline station (Heathrow Express), as well as the soon to be completed Crossrail and Victoria Line. Lancaster Gate (Central Line) is also nearby, as well as Hyde Park, Westbourne Grove and Queensway.

Description

Centrally and conveniently located is this modern three bedroom freehold house. Constructed just over 10 years ago, this unique triple aspect house and exceptional home offers wonderfully bright accommodation arranged over four spacious floors, the lower three of which are connected by a floating feature staircase that sits beneath an impressive sky light.

On the ground floor is the spacious reception room, complete with remote controlled fireplace, in addition to a welcoming hallway and a guest cloakroom. On the lower ground floor, a high specification kitchen with plenty of room for entertaining, a further guest cloakroom, a utility room and bi-folding doors that open up on to a patio area.

The luxurious principal bedroom is on the entire first floor, complete with impressive wardrobe space within a dressing area and a stunning en suite bathroom. On the second and top floor is an additional bathroom and two further bedrooms, one of which is currently used as a home office.

Additional features of this exceptional home include air conditioning, Lutron lighting, electric blinds and curtains and underfloor heating throughout, plus parking by separate agreement.

Square Footage: 2247 sq ft

The master bedroom has ample space for fitted wardrobes, a feature fireplace and an en suite shower room, while the second bedroom features an en suite washroom.

The first floor is the impressive living room, with full height sash windows, mezzanine storage space, high ceilings and wood flooring. There is also direct access to a balcony which has views onto the leafy garden square opposite. To the rear is the smartly fitted kitchen, with lots of storage space and contemporary cabinetry. There is also a smart family bathroom on this level with a freestanding bath and shower.

Porchester Terrace North includes transport links from Queensway (Central line) and Bayswater (Circle and District line). Paddington mainline (Heathrow Express and Network Rail) and underground (Circle, District, Bakerloo and Hammersmith and City lines) station is within easy reach. address: Faraday House, Battersea Power Station, Battersea SW11
detailedDescription:
**3D Virtual Viewing** Chain Free | Two Double Bedrooms | 741 Sq Ft | Comfort Cooling | Double Aspect – East & West | Luxury Kitchen With Siemens Appliances | Extensive Storage | Ensuite To Principal | Fitted Wardrobes | Wooden Flooring | Full Sized Dining Area | Two Balconies |

An impressive seventh floor double aspect two double bedroom apartment in the first phase of the world renowned and iconic development, Battersea Power Station.

The apartment, which measures some 749 Sq Ft, benefits from well-planned accommodation including a luxury fitted kitchen with a separate full sized dining area, separate living room, two double bedrooms with a full bathroom ensuite to the principal bedroom, two balconies, one facing East for the morning sun, one facing West for the evening sun and ample storage.

The apartment has been well cared for by the current owners and features include quality Siemens appliances, beautiful wooden flooring, and rain head showers to both bathrooms.
A wonderful apartment located in an incredible development nestled around the iconic Battersea Power Station.

Residents of Faraday House benefit from amazing facilities including a residents cinema, residents lounge and bar with private dining room, top class gymnasium sauna and steam room, 24 hour concierge.

The Northern Line extension, providing a new station at Battersea Power Station is on track to open this Autumn, but in the meantime, there is a shuttlebus service provided to Vauxhall Underground.

The Riverboat Service provides an easy commute to Blackfriars (approx. 25 mins) and to Canary Wharf (approx.. 40 mins)

Battersea Power Station is set to become one of the most amazing places to live in the UK. Sir Gilbert Scott’s original design for Battersea Power Station has been elevated from functional building into an Art Deco masterpiece. This will be a unique place to live.

Apple are due to take half a million sq ft of space at the development which is expected to be handed over by the end of 2021 and the fit-out will commence for the retail and restaurant elements inside the power station, with the building opening to the public from 2022.

The development already has a thriving social scene, with a range of restaurants and bars on the piazza along with a supermarket, florist, coffee shops and hairdressers.

You can use the footpath under Chelsea Bridge to link straight into Battersea Park, 200 acres of parkland with riverside promenade, large lake, children’s zoo, all weather sports ground and much much more.

Slightly further afield, Sloane Square and Kings Road are just 1.25km away with further shopping and dining opportunities.

address: Westmark Tower, West End Gate, Marylebone W2
detailedDescription:
A beautiful one bedroom apartment spread across 542 Sq. Ft situated in The Westmark Tower of Berkeley Home's West End Gate development, offering showstopping views across Regent Park, zsl Zoo, Lords Cricket Ground and beyond.

Westmark is the tallest of the buildings at West End Gate and provides dramatic views towards the City, Regent’s Park and Hyde Park. A sense of arrival is created by a sweeping entrance with water features at ground level that transitions into a grand lobby with secluded seating areas providing residents with pockets of privacy.

At the base of Westmark is the 24-hour concierge, residents’ private gym and pool, cinema screening room, and business lounge. With views of West End Gate’s beautiful landscaped garden, Westmark is designed to make the grandest of statements.

Bringing brand new homes to one of London's most prestigious postcodes, the development is a modern interpretation of the much loved, traditional mansion block. A treasure trove of fine art and culture, the creative scene that surrounds West End Gate introduces ample opportunities to explore London’s historic temples of art, music and design – from the world leading Victoria & Albert Museum, to the vast Royal Albert Hall.

The neighbourhood offers a window into contemporary visual culture, spotlighting pioneering artistic talent across influential spaces including the Lisson, Saatchi and Serpentine Galleries. Here, you can enjoy the arts in a deeper way and discover a rich mine of design inspiration.

A beautiful three bedroomed apartment with high ceilings, wonderfully light southern aspect and sleek interiors arranged over two floors in a period Grade II listed building near Hyde Park. Boasting a private roof terrace and access to communal gardens this recently renovated high specification apartment offers a striking example of contemporary style and period grandeur.

First floor accommodation comprises a stunning 3.8m ceiling high open plan drawing and dining room with a bespoke modern fitted kitchen with full width south facing balcony. Stylish glass stairs lead to the second floor which comprises three beautifully appointed bedrooms and two bathrooms, of which one is en-suite, and a spacious storage room. The property further benefits from access to peaceful rear private gardens and private road parking is available through local council at low annual charge.

Gloucester Gardens is ideally positioned within close proximity to both Hyde Park and the amenities of Queensway and Westbourne Grove, and the excellent travel links of Paddington, Lancaster Gate and Bayswater stations.

The area has excellent transport links to Warwick Avenue Station (Bakerloo line), Paddington Station (Heathrow Express and Crossrail) and strong bus links.
The Regents Canal is home to dozens of narrow boats, water cafes, an art gallery and hotel boat. Little Venice is within walking distance to the American School in London, Venice Canal and Warwick Avenue tube station.

Regents Court is an enviable and well-presented stucco fronted building and the reason why buyers look to purchase on this fabulous street. The accommodation on offer comprises of spacious hallway with plenty of storage, family bathroom, two double bedrooms, the principal bedroom with en-suite shower room and double doors onto the garden. address: South Lodge, Circus Road, St. John's Wood, London NW8
detailedDescription:
A stunning interior designed penthouse apartment with unrivalled views of London available for sale.

Location

South Lodge is a well renowned building in St. John's Wood with porterage and residents parking on a first come first serve basis, ideally located close to the High Street and St. John's Wood tube station (Jubilee Line) & the American School.

Description

This spectacular sixth floor penthouse apartment had undergone a comprehensive refurbishment programme in 2015 to the highest standard offering modern, luxurious living. Accommodation comprises three bedrooms (each with fitted wardrobes), three bathrooms (two en suite), separate kitchen diner fitted with top German appliances (Miele/Seimens – American style double fridge/freezer, gas hob, combination oven, wine cooler, boiling water tap, integrated dish washer) and granite work top. The double reception room is South Easterly facing and enjoys a lot of light & lovely views. The entire apartment has been interior designed and includes design details such as beautiful herringbone wood floors, bespoke high quality wood joinery including full height architectural doors, glass panelled wenge doors in reception and Italian wardrobes in master bedroom complimented with designer lighting & ironmongery throughout the apartment The bathrooms have luxurious finishes in Marble/Corian & Designwork tiles. The flat is equipped with all modern comforts including High speed broadband with usb power outlets in every room, underfloor heating in Kitchen & bathrooms, dimmer lights in every room as well as a single last man out switch at the entrance .The flat benefits from communal central heating and a spacious storage room allocated to the flat in the basement area of the building – extremely handy for bikes, suitcases & other storage needs. The refurbishment included full new electric wiring.

Square Footage: 1682 sq ft

Naturally bright, 6th floor 1 bedroom apartment in Bramah House, Grosvenor Waterside which is a popular modern development located close to the banks of the River Thames.

This beautifully presented apartment has an open plan reception room enjoying views of the River Thames as well as Battersea Power Station, there is a smart kitchen with integrated appliances, a luxury bathroom suite, wood flooring, and good storage including a utility cupboard housing a washer dryer, a large coat cupboard and fitted wardrobes to the bedroom.

One of the best located riverside developments, Grosvenor Waterside comprises of six innovative buildings within the historic Grosvenor Dock. Situated on the north side of the river right by Chelsea Bridge, a short walk across Chelsea Bridge will find you at 200 acres of beautiful landscapes at Battersea Park featuring a boating lake, secret gardens and a children’s zoo. detailedDescription:
Immaculately presented five bedroom duplex apartment in the heart of Pimlico.

Location

Belgrave Road runs between Victoria and St Georges Square and is renowned for being an ideal location for connecting Pimlico with Westminster and Belgravia, with easy access to Sloane Square and the City, and with some of the best schools in London closeby.

Transport connections are fantastic with Victoria Station offering national mainline services including the Gatwick Express, as well as underground services from nearby Pimlico, making it a most convenient and accessible Central London home.

There are numerous renowned restaurants and boutiques locally in Denbigh Street, Churton Street and Wilton Road, as well as theatres, markets, a Curzon cinema in Victoria Street, and the traditional lifestyle and café culture of Elizabeth Street and Belgravia; all of which are contributing to a thriving and active local scene which is increasingly enjoyed by local residents, coupled with iconic cultural landmarks such as the Houses of Parliament and Tate Britain Gallery.

Description

This beautifully refurbished duplex penthouse apartment is situated within a stucco fronted, building in the heart of Pimlico.

Accommodation at the third floor comprises a principal bedroom suite with en suite, one further bedroom with en suite shower room, three further bedrooms and two additional bathrooms.

The upper (fourth) floor comprises a fantastic reception room which leads out to a balcony, a separate contemporary kitchen and dining room which also leads out to another balcony.

In all, this is an exceptional property which has been meticulously planned to provide a bright, immensely comfortable and highly specified central London property which could be an ideal home or pied a terre.

Square Footage: 1903 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 119 years remaining

detailedDescription:
A 4th floor, three bedroom penthouse apartment (2338 sq ft ) with a huge terrace, in this eagerly awaited luxury development to be built in Marylebone over recent decades.

Nestled in the absolute epicentre of Marylebone Village just a stone's throw from Marylebone High Street, this incredible building will have an art deco feel with its anodized bronze aluminium and granite retail façade and cladding with 4 glaze colours and balconies with concealed lighting to emit a soft glow at night.
Internally there is a 6 storey internal atrium with trees and shrubs to create an amazing inner garden similar to the famous Squares of Marylebone, protected from the elements by an apex glass roof and offering a haven to relax and meet fellow residents.
Paddington and Euston stations are a short ride away, while Baker Street and Marylebone stations are right on your doorstep. Bond Street underground is a five-minute walk, where the Elizabeth line will connect you to Heathrow Airport or Paris via the Eurostar. For an evening of entertainment, hail a cab to The Royal Opera House or to London's iconic West End or for a spot of shopping Selfridges is your local department store.

address: Scott House, Battersea Power Station SW11
detailedDescription:
A luxurious six bedroom apartment in the Battersea Power Station development. Covering the space of three typical apartments, this 8th floor property is not only spacious but also finished to the highest specification. Every room boasts unique features, from the curved wall in the dining room to the marble units in the bathrooms. Every window offers a stunning view over the River Thames, and gives onto either the balcony or the private winter garden.

Property
A luxurious six bedroom apartment in the Battersea Power Station development. Spanning and enormous 3,297 sq foot, this 8th floor property is not only spacious but also finished to the highest specification. Every room boasts unique features, from the curved wall in the reception room to the marble units in the bathrooms. Every window offers a stunning view over the River Thames, and gives onto one of the private winter garden.
Enter the apartment through a private hallway with discreet storage for coats and shoes. This leads to the ample reception room, with attractive uplighting and enough power points for all your personal tech. The full-height windows provide access to the main winter garden.
The kitchen features Gaggenau appliances set in marble work surfaces. The space doubles as a dining room, with atmospheric lighting and a curved feature wall. This room provides another entrance point to the apartment, and boasts the latest security technology to keep you and your family safe and sound.
The master bedroom suite is located at the extreme east end of the apartment. It includes a spacious bedroom, as well as its own dressing room, en-suite bathroom and WC. The master suite connects with the reception room and the second winter garden.
A corridor at the west end of the apartment houses the other four bedrooms, as well as an office, study and utility room. Each bedroom has its own bathroom, each finished to the highest specification with the finest porcelain and either wood or marble surfaces. The sliding windows in the smaller bedrooms and the office all give access to the winter garden. From the winter garden, you can enjoy natural light, as well as the stunning view of the Thames, without having to brave the British weather.

Development
Iconic Battersea Power Station has been a feature of London's skyline for nearly ninety years. The new, mixed-use development is spread over 42 acres, incorporating 4,000 homes as well as shopping and leisure facilities in the converted power station building.
Scott House is a luxury apartment complex within the development. Residents benefit from 24-hour concierge, swimming pool, gym, screening room and private dining rooms. Parking spaces are allocated to each apartment – an important convenience in a capital city.
In addition to residential properties, the Battersea Power Station development will include a six-acre park, a new high street, office and retail space, a library, medical centre, childcare facilities, leisure and culture facilities as well as a 2,000-capacity events space. With so many shops, restaurants and events coming to the area, Battersea Power Station will become a destination in itself.

Location
SW11 is a great location in Transport for London's Zone 1, just a short tube ride from the West End and walking distance from Chelsea and Sloane Square.
Thanks to the Northern Line Extension, SW11 will benefit from two new London Underground stations, Nine Elms and Battersea Power Station. Residents will be able to travel to the West End, as well as connecting with intercity stations like Euston and King's Cross. A shuttle bus for residents will provide a direct link with Victoria Station.
New shops, restaurants and leisure facilities form part of the mixed-use development, while existing local supermarkets are fully stocked with daily provisions.
Battersea Park is just fifteen minutes' walk away. This beautiful riverside park is home to Battersea Children's Zoo and the delightful Peace Pagoda – an oasis of calm in the UK's busy capital.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Unmodernised Opportunity with Planning Permission in Eccleston Square.

The London Broker is delighted to market this well positioned Lower Ground Floor flat on one of Pimlico’s most prestigious addresses, Eccleston Square.

This large basement flat of over 1,600sqft provides an enticing opportunity for an incoming purchaser to create a most charming modern apartment, well located for access to central London as well as benefiting from the exclusive facilities of one of London’s finest garden squares.

The current vendors have already achieved planning permission and listed buildings consent for the remodelling of the apartment which can be found on the Westminster planning portal with reference 18/08264/full. The vendor also has the necessary contracts and other permissions in place which will enable any incoming purchaser to save significant costs and time and provide them with the opportunity to put their own stamp on the final design and finishes.

The property comes with a long 980+ year lease and benefits from a share in the freehold.

Full details and CGI’s are available upon request.

Eccleston Square is located a very short walk from Victoria Station which offers access to the capital’s business and finance districts, as well as the Gatwick Express. Within walking distance of the square are some of London’s finest cultural highlights including Buckingham Palace, the King’s Road and Westminster Abbey.

The Square dates to the 1830s, an integral part of Thomas Cubitt's planned design of “South Belgravia”, which is now called Pimlico. Cubitt designed many of the houses on the square and built and leased Nos 1-3 in 1836 and Nos 4 and 5 in 1842 all of which are grade II listed with English Heritage. The land was formerly part of the Grosvenor family estate, who owned land in Eccleston, Cheshire, from where it is thought the square takes its name.

The communal private gardens in the centre of the Square are grade II listed with English Heritage since 1987, and open for the National Gardens Scheme each year.

The Buddhist Society has been based at no.58 since 1956. There are two blue plaques in the square. The first is for Winston Churchill, who moved to Eccleston Square a year after marrying Clementine Hozier, and their first two children, Diana and Randolph, were born there.

The garden is the centre point of the square and a rare oasis of tranquillity within the heart of the busy city. Whether having a picnic with friends on the lawn or reading a book on one of the many benches, it is easy to forget that you are in the middle of one of the most vibrant cities in the World.

Eccleston Square garden is a regular winner of the “Best Garden Square” award. Planned by Cubitt in 1828, the 3 acre square is divided into mini gardens with camellias, iris, ferns and containers.

The Square is now owned and held in trust for the use of the residents, as a garden, in perpetuity, which seems right and fitting as Eccleston Square was designed from the start as a community garden for the residents of the surrounding properties.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A third floor, west facing three bedroom apartment with a separate study set within this most eagerly awaited residential development to be built in the heart of Marylebone Village.

Marylebone Square is a rare opportunity to be part of the provenance of aristocratic estates in Central London. A contemporary take on a classic London mansion, it is an intuitively designed building that slots into the urban fabric of Marylebone. Set over five floors, Marylebone Square houses just 54 one to three bedroom apartments. All apartments have been designed from a central atrium which is the centrepiece of the building and allows for every apartment to have dual aspect. The residences are refined, elegant and intuitively designed; each apartment is generously spacious yet warmly intimate. Created by developers, Concord London and Simon Bowden Architects, all residences benefit from floor-to-ceiling windows and glass sliding doors giving each space a bright and capacious feel. Additional features include 24 hour concierge service. Marylebone Square has an estimated completion of 2021 and complies with a 10 year build warranty by NHBC.
title: 3 bed property for sale

address: Queen Anne's Gate, St. James's Park, London SW1H
detailedDescription:
An elegant and generously proportioned lateral three bedroom, third floor apartment in this landmark building and in one of Westminster's most iconic locations next to St James's Park.

Location

Queen Anne's Gate runs parallel to Birdcage Walk, sitting between Parliament and Buckingham Palace, with the tranquil and iconic St James's Park immediately behind.

A wonderfully central location, and within a conservation area, houses in these streets are renowned for their heritage and elegance, having provided homes to gentry and Prime Ministers for over 300 years.

Today this is a location recognised for convenient proximity to London’s most significant landmarks, as well as its accessibility to the cultural attractions of London, including the Tate Britain Gallery and of course West End theatre land; Andrew Lloyd Webber's new 'Other Palace' is nearby in Palace Street.

Significant redevelopment of Victoria has seen £2billion spent to create a fantastic new residential and commercial destination, with numerous bars and restaurants at Nova, and brands including the chefs Jason Atherton and Jamie Oliver; Michel Roux Jnr's Michelin starred Parliament Square restaurant is situated only minutes from the house.

Victoria Street has seen exciting retail development from Hugo Boss and Jo Malone, and the area has always been renowned for exceptional transport connections. Victoria Station provides national mainline services including the Gatwick Express, as well as underground services with the Victoria Line and District and Circle Line. Nearby St James's Park Station is the closest connection to the District and Circle Line and Westminster Station is equally convenient for its direct access to the Jubilee line heading to the City and Canary Wharf.

Description

This building was originally built in the 1840s and was reconstructed in the 1990s behind the retained Grade II* listed façade to provide luxury apartments.

Enjoying generously proportioned rooms and exceptional natural light, accommodation is arranged over 1,717 sq ft and briefly comprises principal bedroom which leads to a balcony, two further bedrooms and two bathrooms (one en suite), an elegant reception room of some 23.7'' x 19.4'', and a separate fitted kitchen/breakfast room.

The apartment is presented in very good decorative order and the building equally is well maintained and managed, and benefits from the services of a daytime concierge, and passenger lift to all floors.

Please note - the furniture and dressings in this image have been virtually staged using the floor plan dimensions.

Square Footage: 1717 sq ft

address: Sutherland Avenue, Maida Vale, London W9
detailedDescription:
Well-presented two bedroom garden flat with a fantastic layout and large private garden.

Location

Maida Vale is a stunning location in west London, offering period conversions and red-brick mansion flats some of which include well-manicured communal gardens.
Paddington Recreational Ground offers open green space for the avid jogger and dog walker, as well as an athletics track, gym and 3D artificial pitch. In addition, there are a number tennis clubs in the immediate area.
Bbc Maida Vale Studios is conveniently located on a quiet residential street and hosts a number of live performances.
The local area has excellent transport links from Maida Vale Station (Bakerloo line) and strong bus links into central London.
Maida Vale benefits from a wide selection of local amenities such as cafes, bars, restaurants and florists accessible via Elgin Avenue and Lauderdale Parade.

Description

Adopting a bespoke layout, this garden apartment has recently been fully refurbished and makes good use of its footprint with multiple access to the quiet, private outside space. The principal bedroom incorporates a dressing area with wall-to-wall fitted wardrobes and contemporary en-suite shower room. The fully fitted kitchen boasts twin full size Neff ovens, Siemens hob and extractor, built-in dining area seating, and flows seamlessly into a bright lounge, with ceiling skylights. A special mention should be made of the north west-facing garden with its pleasant decked area and fully planted borders; a perfect place for evening entertaining. This spacious area is accessed directly from the reception area through the full-width bi-folding doors. A further double bedroom also offers direct access to the garden, and built-in storage with the convenience of a second contemporary family bathroom.

Square Footage: 840 sq ft

address: Jermyn Street, St James's, London SW1Y
detailedDescription:
This split level property is situated on the third floor (with lift) within an imposing mansion block on Jermyn Street. As you walk in, you are greeted with a large reception room and study, separate kitchen, spacious dining area and the second bedroom with en-suite . Upstairs you then have the main double bedroom with an en-suite bathroom with plenty of in-built storage space.

For centuries, St James's has formed the sophisticated centre of city living in London. With its iconic landmarks and beautiful architecture, the area is internationally renowned for the best galleries, restaurants, hotels and shops.

59-60 Jermyn Street is located in the heart of the St James's district, nearby the open spaces of Green Park and St James's Park and the boutiques and members clubs of cosmopolitan Mayfair.

detailedDescription:
Stunning one bedroom apartment styled to a contemporary finish, providing a thoughtfully designed living space. It measures approximately 44.1 square metres (475 sq ft), this modern apartment has wood floors and double glazing throughout.

The apartment has an open plan living area, a fully fitted kitchen with contemporary gloss units and integrated appliances, double bedroom, fitted storage in the hallway, bathroom with white metro tiles and a three piece white suite with a shower over the shower-bath.

St. George's Fields is a unique, quiet, gated development surrounded by its own two and a half acres of wooded gardens, in the heart of Connaught Village with its many fashionable boutiques, bars, cafes and restaurants. Opposite Hyde Park and in excellent proximity to Marble Arch and Paddington Station.

There is an on site estate office and underground residents parking. The apartment blocks have lift access and the development is secure within a gated perimeter wall. Each flat has a share of the freehold and a long lease.

Sold with no upper chain.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Coming soon | register now for exclusive access
Situated in a prominent position overlooking the Covent Garden's historic Inigo Jones designed Italianate Piazza, 43 King Street is an imposing period building with a sought after address in the very heart of London's vibrant West End.

This well proportioned and comprehensively refurbished three bedroom lateral apartment offers a rare opportunity to live on the Piazza, only moments from the renowned Royal Opera House in the heart of the Covent Garden Estate, with truly world class shopping, dining and leisure opportunities literally on the doorstep.

A bright, well proportioned drawing room with generous ceilings heights and large original windows directly overlooks the famed Piazza, offering a rare view over one of London's most globally recognisable landmarks. Modern finishes mix with traditional features, high quality craftsmanship and contemporary colours & tones to create a sense of style and tranquillity.

The main living space is perfect for entertaining with distinct living and dining zones. A separate study area again overlooks the Piazza and offers a bright space ideal for home working, but can alternatively function as a further guest bedroom.

A beautiful bespoke high quality kitchen is separated from the main living space but designed in such a way as to form the heart of the home and a space to dine or relax.

A generous principal bedroom suite is located to the rear of the apartment, featuring high quality bespoke cabinetry. The principal suite is served by a large en-suite shower room featuring exceptional contemporary finishes. The adjacent guest bedroom again features bespoke cabinetry and is served by a beautiful family bathroom featuring a contemporary freestanding bath.

King Street is one of the West End's most sought after addresses, being part of the Covent Garden Estate and located close to iconic London landmarks including The Royal Opera House, Covent Garden's famed Italianate Piazza and St. Paul's Church with its tranquil public gardens.

Being located in the very heart of London, residents are perfectly positioned to travel and explore on foot. The West End, Mayfair, the South Bank and River Thames and many of London's wonderful parks and open spaces are within easy reach, as well as the City of London.

title: 4 bed flat for sale

agency_name: John D Wood & Co. - Notting Hill Sales
detailedDescription:
A ‘hidden house’ of superb quality. Over 3,000 square feet arranged over only four floors, with four bedrooms, plus a conservatory/study, a self-contained studio and terraces at three levels.

A long hallway and a pair of front doors separate the house from Notting Hill Gate and enters into a magnificent, over 650 square foot, reception and dining room. There is a real sense of calm and great light from three floor-to-ceiling windows which overlook the split level patio to the rear and a large skylight in the middle of the room.

Downstairs is an extraordinary open plan space, nearly 50 feet in length, which is zoned into kitchen/ dining space, a family room and a library reading area. There is also a utility and cloakroom at this level as well as a vast storage area.

The dual level terrace is accessed via the kitchen, the lower patio leading to the self-contained studio with shower room, and the upper terrace featuring a calming water feature and ample seating.

Back upstairs there is a classic first floor main bedroom suite of excellent proportions, storage and ceiling heights as well as a conservatory style study. There are three further bedrooms, an ensuite shower room and a family bathroom on the second floor.

The house is very well positioned for Kensington Gardens, access to the tube at Notting Hill Gate and more coffee shop options than you could shake a stick at!

Marylebone Square offers a collection of luxury apartments for sale, carefully chosen boutiques and restaurants, and a versatile community hall.

The signature 5-storey, glass-canopied inner courtyard offers a refreshing and unique alternative to your walk to your apartment, the glass roof allows natural light to flood the hallways and the lily ponds and greenery offer a warmth to the residences.

Each unit features a private balcony or terrace and the unit itself displays only the finest quality of finishes.

Please enquire for more information on our full availability within the development.

Completion due Q1/Q2 of 2023

detailedDescription:
We are pleased to offer this rarely available, substantial, freehold building situated on the preferred north side of this sought-after garden square.

The building is currently arranged as offices on the lower ground floor, raised ground floor and first floor, with residential accommodation on the upper two floors, and is suitable for a number of uses, including residential conversion, subject to planning.

Dorset Square forms the central feature of an urban layout planned by the Portman Estate (1815-20), and was the original site of Lords Cricket Ground. Marylebone and Baker Street stations are close by, with Regent's Park and Marylebone High Street within easy walking distance.

address: Craven Hill Gardens, Bayswater, London W2
detailedDescription:
This sensational one bedroomed apartment is located in the heart of Bayswater and boasts period features, bespoke finishing and a beautiful southerly facing reception room.

The property is entered into a hallway, directly to the front is the reception room, a truly impressive space. This stylish room features ornate cornicing (original and commissioned) and a fireplace. The reception has a semi-open plan kitchen, in a gorgeous dusty pink this kitchen has been meticulously finished, with integrated appliances, ample storage and a fireplace. The tiled flooring of the reception and kitchen also features underfloor heating

At the rear of the property is the bedroom, a superb size with extensive bespoke fitted wardrobes and feature wallpaper, a luxurious room. Just before the bedroom on the hallway is a shower room and WC. A real 'wow' property in a great location

Access to communal garden square by separate arrangement.

Craven Hill Gardens is centrally located with excellent transport links such as Lancaster Gate underground (Central line) and Paddington mainline (Network Rail and Heathrow Express) and underground (District, Circle, Bakerloo and Hammersmith & City lines) station. Oxford Street and the West End are both easily accessible offering some of the best shops, restaurants and theatre London has to offer. Craven Hil Gardens is also perfectly positioned for the imminent arrival of Crossrail which will offer faster journey times into the City and Canary Wharf.

detailedDescription:
Offered for sale and arranged over approximately 1,613sqft. Is this two bedroom, two bathroom apartment sold in immaculate condition having been recently renovated and dressed.

There is a large open plan living room which flows through to the dining room and kitchen giving an open plan feel whilst still having the rooms separate. All rooms have a great amount of natural light giving a lovely airy feel which is extenuated by the excellent ceiling heights.

There are two fantastic sized bedrooms, with the principal bedroom having an en-suite bathroom whilst bedroom two has access to the family bathroom. Both the living room and the principal bedroom have direct access onto their own individual terraces getting an excellent amount of natural light.

The apartment is sold on a 940+ year lease, benefitting from 24 hour porterage as well as two allocated underground parking spaces.

Two Avenue Road is perfectly located being both opposite Regent's Park as well as around the corner from Primrose Hill. The building is also very close to St John's Wood High Street, affording easy access to all of its amenities including St John's Wood Underground Station (Jubilee Line) as well as the cafes and shops of the High Street.

detailedDescription: Benefitting from exceptionally high ceilings, air-conditioning and beautifully renovated communal areas, this larger than average one bedroom apartment measures approximately 643 sq ft and is located just a few moments from Regents Park and Marylebone High Street. The property is presented in excellent condition throughout and is accessed via a recently renovated reception area and a delightful communal courtyard. Marathon House is a highly prestigious modern development with a 24-hour concierge service and a residents-only gym. The building was originally constructed in 1960 having been influenced by New York city’s Lever house and was then subsequently redeveloped by the well known luxury property developer Berkeley Homes in 1998. The more recent renovations to the building took place in 2019. The layout of the apartment works incredibly well with a large reception/dining room, a separate kitchen, a spacious bedroom with built in storage and a modern bathroom. Marylebone Station and Baker Street stations are both within easy walking distance.

Descritption The property extends approximately 665 square feet, comprising a bright and spacious reception room with feature fireplace, semi-integrated kitchen, master bedroom with built in wardrobes and an en-suite bathroom, second bedroom with built in wardrobe, and a shower room. The block benefits from a resident porter, residents only gym, and beautifully maintained communal gardens.

Location Gladstone Court is situated within the Regency Street Conservation Area, being very well positioned for the many and varied amenities of Pimlico, Westminster and Victoria. Pimlico Underground Station (Victoria Line) is within short walking distance (3 minutes), and Victoria Station (National Rail links, Victoria, Circle & District Lines) being a little further (10 minutes).

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Place, Great Portland Street, London W1W
detailedDescription:
Regeneration in the heart of the city

Stunning one-bedroom apartment available in the latest development in Marylebone, London W1.

The proposed development will be based over 8-storeys and consists of 37 private residential 1,2 and 3-bedroom apartments, and allocated with two basement levels for parking and approximately 2,500 sq. Ft. Of retail space on the ground floor.

W1 Place is located on the east side of Great Portland Street, in the heart of Fitzrovia. This vibrant area is known for its quality retail and trendy bars, as well as being a major hub for the creative industry, with occupiers such as Time Out, Virgin Media, cnbc and the bbc.

The nearest tube stations are Great Portland Street (3 min walk), Regents Park (4 min) and Warren Street (6 min).

**Images are for Marketing Purposes Only**

Leasehold: 900 Years

Estimated Service Charge: £7.00/Sq Ft per annum

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented penthouse apartment arranged over the fourth and fifth floors of this striking period building with a lift.

Location

The Strand is internationally acknowledged as London's theatre and cultural heartland close to the River Thames.

Culture devotees can take their pick from all the must-see West End shows in London's theatre district, while also frequenting the likes of the English National Opera, the Royal Opera House, the National Portrait Gallery, Ronnie Scott's and Somerset House, to name just a handful of nearby attractions.
Covent Garden's substantial retail offering takes in countless designer outlets including the likes of Dior, Mulberry, Burberry, Chanel and the flagship Apple Store.

The surfeit of dining options range from casual eateries such as Bocca di Lupo, Dishoom and Balthazar, to fine dining fixtures, including the likes of The Ivy, J Sheekey and Hawksmoor. The locale is brimming with historic pubs, upscale cocktail bars and wine bars.

Living right in the heart of central London brings unbeatable transport connections. Charing Cross Railway Station is nearby (0.2 miles) with both mainline and underground services, and underground stations at Temple (0.1 miles), Embankment (0.3 miles) and Covent Garden (0.3 miles). (all distances are approximate)

Description

A stunning penthouse apartment offering luxurious living across 2,047 sq ft of internal space arranged over the fourth and fifth floors of this striking period building.

The lower floor boasts an impressive principal bedroom suite featuring a large walk-in wardrobe and magnificent en suite bathroom complete with double sinks, freestanding bath, shower and steam room. There are two further double bedrooms, each with their own en suite shower room and generous fitted wardrobes. The utility room is also situated on this floor.

A sweeping glass and oak staircase leads up to the dual aspect reception / dining room, which is flooded with natural light from feature skylights and two balconies with far reaching views to the south, including The Thames. The top floor of the penthouse apartment is exclusively dedicated to fine living, making it the perfect entertaining space. There is also a modern kitchen and guest cloakroom on this floor.

Further features include underfloor heating, comfort cooling, integrated AV system and iconic views of The Thames, the Shard and Nelson's Column. The property also benefits from lift access and well-presented communal areas.

Square Footage: 2047 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 991 years remaining

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Freehold property for sale in Seymour Place, Marylebone, W1

A unique opportunity to acquire a prominent Freehold building in Marylebone, W1.
The ground and lower ground floors currently offer approximately 1,000 sq.ft. Of commercial space (A1 use) with an estimated rental value of £35,000 per annum. Subject to planning, this space could potentially become its own maisonette or perhaps combined with the rest of the property to turn the building in to a townhouse.

The first, second and third floors of the building currently comprise of a single residential triplex apartment with an outstanding roof terrace. There might also be scope to add a fourth floor. This apartment is also being marketed separately should someone wish to only buy the long leasehold interest of 990+ years without the commercial space.

Situated on the corner of Seymour Place and York Street the property has fantastic curb appeal. An array of local shops, restaurants and pubs are on your doorstep and Marylebone station is within close proximity. Baker Street station is 0.2 miles away offering accessibility across London via Bakerloo, Circle, Hammersmith & City, Jubilee and Metropolitan Lines.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Great Portland is an eagerly awaited luxury residential and retail development, centrally situated on Great Portland Street and ideally positioned to enjoy the village-like intimacy of Marylebone and the bohemian chic of Fitzrovia.
This two bedroom apartment on the first floor is approximately 868 sq. Ft. Practical completion of this prestigious project is anticipated for quarter three/four of 2023.

Unifying Marylebone and Fitzrovia, the area has a rich heritage of illustrious residents from the Beatles, the pre-Raphaelite artist Dante Rossetti, to the literary greats Charles Dickens, Dylan Thomas, George Orwell and Virginia Woolf, and national heroine Florence Nightingale. Respectful of the past with an eye on the future, Great Portland has been thoughtfully designed, blending old and new to create delightful modern homes, enviably located amid the boutique bohemia and café culture of this distinguished district.

Highly crafted and exuding modern quality with its bright limestone façade and bronze framed lantern bay windows, Great Portland offers considered interiors and artistic flair where luxury lives in the finer detail and exquisite originality. With floor to ceiling bay windows, oak floors, intimate open plan living and entertaining spaces, and bathrooms with clean lines and quality finishes, Great Portland offers a wonderful sanctuary for the discerning buyer.

This magnificent avant-garde development comprises a mixture of one, two and three bedroom, luxury apartments of varying sizes.

There is easy access from Great Portland to Paddington, Marylebone and Baker Street stations. Great Portland Street underground station (Hammersmith and City, Circle, and Metropolitan lines) is moments away.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Designed from the inside out, and with an enviable central London location, W1 Place is perfect for the discerning individual, the professional couple and the modern family.

The highly crafted quality throughout the building means you'll be feeling that reassuring click with every door you close, and the satisfying sound of your feet on the oak floor. Light pours in through the floor to ceiling bay windows, creating a sense of both openness and warmth, while the open plan living and kitchen areas provide a thoroughly modern space to host your friends or enjoy a cosy night in.

The selection of one, two and three bed layouts provide luxurious living, designed with you at heart.

With spacious apartments, curated retail and a prime location, you are perfectly placed to enjoy all that London has to offer.

Leasehold - 900 years
Estimated Completion Q3/Q4 2023
Estimated Service Charge £7.00/Sq Ft per annum
Ground Rent - 1 bed £750.00,2 bed £1,250.00,3 bed £1,500.00

address: Westmark Tower, West End Gate, Marylebone W2
detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

A luxury one bedroom apartment in Westmark Tower, part of the new West End Gate development in Paddington. Arranged over the first floor the property comprises open plan kitchen/reception room, one double bedroom, large bathroom and a private balcony. Other benefits include 24 hour concierge, lift, gym, swimming pool, cinema, gym, meeting room, residents lounge and private hire dining area. West End Gate by St Edward is built to the highest quality. Paddington mainline and underground stations are just a short walk away.

Announcing the entrance to London’s West End, West End Gate is a modern interpretation of classic London and brings brand new homes to one of London’s most prestigious postcodes. Situated moments from Marylebone & Little Venice, the development also benefits from excellent transport connections. Its 30-storey tower is iconic in form and stature, providing impressive city views whilst a series of mansion blocks add to the London streetscape.

With architecture by renowned architects Squire & Partners, West End Gate offers a range of facilities, including a concierge, gym, swimming pool and a private cinema. With a new piazza complete with water features and beautiful landscaping designed to make the grandest of statements. World-renowned retail and cultural districts such as Mayfair and Soho are enviably close, showcasing the best designer brands, world-class theatre and internationally renowned institutions such as The Royal Academy.

Images for illustration purposes not actual.

Its 30-storey tower is iconic in form and stature, providing impressive city views whilst a series of mansion blocks add to the London streetscape.

With a new piazza complete with water features and beautiful landscaping designed to make the grandest of statements. World-renowned retail and cultural districts such as Mayfair and Soho are enviably close, showcasing the best designer brands, world-class theatre and internationally renowned institutions such as The Royal Academy.

Images for illustration purposes not actual.

detailedDescription:
Description

A well laid out one-bedroom apartment on the second floor in the popular St. Georges Square benefitting from the rare use of a direct passenger lift.

The flat is well presented with a spacious reception room with high ceilings facing the square, a separate modern kitchen, and large bedroom to the rear with en-suite bathroom.

Location

This is a popular residential district in Central London, convenient for iconic Westminster landmarks, such as the Houses of Parliament and the Tate Britain Gallery.

The area is well provided for in terms of transport connections, with Victoria Station offering national mainline services including the Gatwick Express, and underground services from nearby Pimlico Station on the Victoria Line.

There are numerous renowned restaurants and boutiques locally in Denbigh Street, Churton Street and Wilton Road, as well as theatres, markets, a Curzon cinema in Victoria Street, and the traditional lifestyle and café culture of Elizabeth Street and Belgravia; all of which are contributing to a thriving and active local scene which is increasingly enjoyed by residents.

Coupled with the extensive redevelopment seen around Victoria and Westminster there is no question that Pimlico has been revitalized as a highly attractive and sought after residential destination with Prime Central London.

Tenure: Leasehold (101 years unexpired)

Size: 670 sq ft (62.2sqm)

detailedDescription:
A stunning property with a large roof terrace for sale in Marylebone.

Offered for sale measuring approximately 1,582 sq.ft. Is this exceptional property for sale in Marylebone.

Benefitting from its own private entrance and front door on ground level this imposing property offers flexible living accommodation over three floors. The property was recently refurbished and benefits from high ceilings and double aspect windows on each floor providing an abundance of natural light throughout. The accommodation comprises an open plan kitchen and dining room on the first floor with a formal reception room on the second. There are four bedrooms of which two have ensuite bathroom facilities and there is a third family shower room plus a guest WC. Finally there is a large roof terrace offering outstanding views across central London and is truly remarkable. There is potential to buy the Freehold which consists of The Mirror Shop and creates an opportunity to add two more floors subject to planning.

Situated on the corner of Seymour Place and York Street the property has fantastic curb appeal. An array of local shops, restaurants and pubs are on your doorstep and Marylebone station is within close proximity. Baker Street station is 0.2 miles away offering accessibility across London via Bakerloo, Circle, Hammersmith & City, Jubilee and Metropolitan Lines.
